original: gza' sogs thams cad sngags rnams bkug par @190a * //
analyzed: gza' sogs thams cad sngags rnams bkug par @190a * //
translated: All the planets and so forth are summoned by the mantras.

original: rab gyur dug gis zin pa gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rab gyur dug gis zin pa gtong ba'o //
translated: The one who is possessed by poison is released.

original: de phyir sems can don du dang por skyes bus mkha' lding dbang po bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: de phyir sems can don du dang por skyes bus mkha' lding dbang po bsgrub par bya //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of sentient beings, first the human should accomplish the lord of the sky-farers.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: da ni dri ma med pa las bshad pa'i tshigs bcad bzhi bcu ni rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dri ma med pa las bshad pa'i tshigs bcad bzhi bcu ni rgyas par bya ste /
translated: Now, the forty verses explained in the Stainless Light will be elaborated:

original: gang zhig sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir mi rnams kyi snying ga la gnas pa dang rna bas thos par gyur pa'i sgra de dang sems sbyar na sems ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir mi rnams kyi snying ga la gnas pa dang rna bas thos par gyur pa'i sgra de dang sems sbyar na sems ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur te /
translated: Here, when the sound that resides in the heart of humans and is heard by the ear is applied to the mind, the mind becomes of the same taste.

original: sems dang srog gi rlung gcig tu gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems dang srog gi rlung gcig tu gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the mind and the life-force wind become one, supreme unchanging bliss is attained. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan yang de'i dbang gis lkog tu gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyi skad ni rnal 'byor pas thos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i dbang gis lkog tu gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyi skad ni rnal 'byor pas thos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, by its power, the yogi hears the sounds of all hidden sentient beings.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs dang snyan ji lta bar gyur pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs dang snyan ji lta bar gyur pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, just as the Bhagavān’s mind and ears are, in the same way, the yogin should practice. This is the meaning.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pas sgom par byed pa'i dus su bza' ba la sogs pa ma rnyed par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pas sgom par byed pa'i dus su bza' ba la sogs pa ma rnyed par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If, when the yogin is practicing, he does not find food, etc.,

original: sems ma zin pa'i bar du gang gis 'tsho bar bgyi zhe na /
analyzed: sems ma zin pa'i bar du gang gis 'tsho bar bgyi zhe na /
translated: then how should he live until he has captured the mind?

original: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares “having made” and so forth.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas rdo rje'i skyil krung bcas nas kha cung zad phyi bar byas la /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas rdo rje'i skyil krung bcas nas kha cung zad phyi bar byas la /
translated: Here, the yogin, having made the vajra posture, should open the mouth slightly.

original: so rnams phan tshun du reg par mi bya ste /
analyzed: so rnams phan tshun du reg par mi bya ste /
translated: The teeth should not touch each other.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi rlung bkug nas bdud rtsi cung zad 'dzag pa dang lhan cig tu lte bar zhugs la /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi rlung bkug nas bdud rtsi cung zad 'dzag pa dang lhan cig tu lte bar zhugs la /
translated: Then, having drawn in the external wind, together with a little nectar dripping, it enters the navel.

original: gdungs dang bkres skom lus mchog la ni yang dag 'gog pa'i dug ni 'phrog bar byed //
analyzed: gdungs dang bkres skom lus mchog la ni yang dag 'gog pa'i dug ni 'phrog bar byed //
translated: The poison of perfect cessation is removed from the body, the best of all bodies, which is emaciated and hungry and thirsty.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yang na dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon skor du dbyangs bcu drug tu dgod par byas nas bdud rtsi 'dzag par byed pa'i thig le dkar po dbus su bsgom par byas nas /
analyzed: yang na dpral bar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la g-yon skor du dbyangs bcu drug tu dgod par byas nas bdud rtsi 'dzag par byed pa'i thig le dkar po dbus su bsgom par byas nas /
translated: Or else, on the forehead, one should arrange the sixteen vowels in a counterclockwise circle on a moon disk, and meditate on a white drop that exudes nectar in the center.

original: don de nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don de nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by “one should do that very thing.”

original: phyi rol gyi rdzas las ma gtogs par /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdzas las ma gtogs par /
translated: Apart from external substances,

original: rnal 'byor pas tshe bsgrub na ji ltar bgyi zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas tshe bsgrub na ji ltar bgyi zhe na /
translated: how should the yogī practice to attain longevity?

original: sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “nose,” and so on.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas tsog tsog po'i 'dug stangs kyis stan la 'dug nas kha bsdam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas tsog tsog po'i 'dug stangs kyis stan la 'dug nas kha bsdam par bya ste /
translated: Here, the yogī, sitting on a seat in the squatting position, should close the mouth.

original: de nas sna bug gnyis kyis cig car du phyi rol gyi rlung bkug la thur sel gyi rlung 'og tu bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sna bug gnyis kyis cig car du phyi rol gyi rlung bkug la thur sel gyi rlung 'og tu bsdam par bya'o //
translated: Then, having simultaneously drawn in the external wind through both nostrils, he should bind the downward-voiding wind below.

original: de ltar rgyun mi chad par byas na ma 'ongs pa'i dus su goms pa'i dbang gis g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang @190b dbus mar ro mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyun mi chad par byas na ma 'ongs pa'i dus su goms pa'i dbang gis g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang @190b dbus mar ro mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one does this uninterruptedly, in the future, by the power of familiarity, the right, left, and middle channels will become of equal taste.

original: de'i dbang gis bza' sogs bkres nyes skom pa lus kyis 'joms shing 'chi ba med nyid ster bar byed //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bza' sogs bkres nyes skom pa lus kyis 'joms shing 'chi ba med nyid ster bar byed //
translated: By its power, hunger, thirst, and so on, and the body's destruction, are conquered, and immortality is granted.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: don de lta bur 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don de lta bur 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is accomplished in this way.

original: de bzhin du gal te rnal 'byor pas rdzas 'dod par gyur pa de lta na ni de bsgrub pa'i thabs ji lta bu bgyi zhe na //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rnal 'byor pas rdzas 'dod par gyur pa de lta na ni de bsgrub pa'i thabs ji lta bu bgyi zhe na //
translated: In the same way, if the yogi desires substances, then how is the method for accomplishing them?

original: rang gi grib ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir rnal 'byor pas ni ma la rgyab bstan nas mdun du gnas pa'i rang gi grib ma la khengs pa'i lta bas dus kha cig gi bar du blta bar byas la nam mkha' la blta bar bya ste
analyzed: rang gi grib ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir rnal 'byor pas ni ma la rgyab bstan nas mdun du gnas pa'i rang gi grib ma la khengs pa'i lta bas dus kha cig gi bar du blta bar byas la nam mkha' la blta bar bya ste
translated: Here, the yogi, facing away from the mother, should look with an inflated gaze at his own shadow in front, for some time. Then he should look at the sky.

original: / lta ba de'i dbang gis nam mkha' la yan lag la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur pa dang / du ba'i kha dog tu gyur pa'i skyes bu mthong ngo //
analyzed: / lta ba de'i dbang gis nam mkha' la yan lag la sogs pa dang ldan par gyur pa dang / du ba'i kha dog tu gyur pa'i skyes bu mthong ngo //
translated: By the power of that gaze, he sees in the sky a person endowed with limbs and so on, and having the color of smoke.

original: de ltar zla ba drug gi bar du bsgoms na /
analyzed: de ltar zla ba drug gi bar du bsgoms na /
translated: Having meditated in this way for six months,

original: sa la gnas pa'i gter gyi bug pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: sa la gnas pa'i gter gyi bug pa ston par byed do //
translated: It shows the opening of a treasure existing in the earth.

original: yang na shing gi grib ma'i rtsar 'dug nas thig le'i tshogs ni nam mkha' la bltas na don de nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na shing gi grib ma'i rtsar 'dug nas thig le'i tshogs ni nam mkha' la bltas na don de nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Or, sitting at the edge of a tree's shade, if one looks at the collection of bindus in the sky, it will do that very thing.

original: da ni grong khyer gzhan la 'jug par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni grong khyer gzhan la 'jug par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he enters another city.

original: nus pa gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nus pa gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is the capacity? and so on.

original: 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo las srog gi rlung langs nas nyin mtshan du g-yas pa dang g-yon pa las nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i bar du 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir lte ba'i 'khor lo las srog gi rlung langs nas nyin mtshan du g-yas pa dang g-yon pa las nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i bar du 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed de /
translated: Here, the life-force vāyu arises from the navel cakra and moves and returns through the right and left [channels] for twenty-one thousand six hundred [breaths] in a day and night.

original: de nyid sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas g-yas pa la sor bcu gnyis kyi bar du phyi rol du byung nas ldog cing /
analyzed: de nyid sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas g-yas pa la sor bcu gnyis kyi bar du phyi rol du byung nas ldog cing /
translated: That very [vāyu], by the previously explained process, moves externally for twelve finger lengths on the right and returns;

original: g-yon pa la sor bcu drug gi bar du byung nas ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa la sor bcu drug gi bar du byung nas ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it moves for sixteen finger lengths on the left and returns.

original: srog gi rlung de nyid srog rtsol bas lte ba la bzung nas glog dang 'dra ba 'gyur ba'i dbyug pa'i tshul gyis lte ba las bslangs nas snying ga ra 'gro zhing /
analyzed: srog gi rlung de nyid srog rtsol bas lte ba la bzung nas glog dang 'dra ba 'gyur ba'i dbyug pa'i tshul gyis lte ba las bslangs nas snying ga ra 'gro zhing /
translated: That life-force wind itself, held at the navel by life-force control, is drawn up from the navel by the stick of the lightning-like transformation.

original: snying ga'i lte ba phug nas mgrin par 'gro zhing mgrin pa nas dpral ba dang dpral ba nas gtsug tor gyi bu ga'i bar du 'gro ste /
analyzed: snying ga'i lte ba phug nas mgrin par 'gro zhing mgrin pa nas dpral ba dang dpral ba nas gtsug tor gyi bu ga'i bar du 'gro ste /
translated: Having pierced the navel of the heart, it goes to the throat. From the throat it goes to the forehead, and from the forehead it goes to the aperture of the fontanel.

original: de byin nas pags pa de khab kyi rtse mos pags pa phug pa bzhin du phug nas 'gro bar byed de /
analyzed: de byin nas pags pa de khab kyi rtse mos pags pa phug pa bzhin du phug nas 'gro bar byed de /
translated: After that, that skin is pierced by the tip of a needle, like piercing skin.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas shin tu stobs kyi 'og tu gyur pa'i rlung steng du gtang bar bya ste /🔽de ltar byas na g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rlung 'gags nas srog gi rlung dang lhan cig tu sems gtsug tor gyi bug pa'i @191a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas shin tu stobs kyi 'og tu gyur pa'i rlung steng du gtang bar bya ste / de ltar byas na g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i rlung 'gags nas srog gi rlung dang lhan cig tu sems gtsug tor gyi bug pa'i @191a * //
translated: At that time, the yogi should send the wind, which has become very powerful, upward.

original: lam nas 'gro bar gyur to //
analyzed: lam nas 'gro bar gyur to //
translated: If that is done, the right and left winds will cease and the mind will go through the path of the aperture of the fontanel together with the life-force wind.

original: de nas don gyis ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de nas don gyis ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished by that?

original: de ltar rdo rje mthu yis yul dang ldan pa'i yid ni mkha' spyod nyid du 'gro /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje mthu yis yul dang ldan pa'i yid ni mkha' spyod nyid du 'gro /
translated: Thus, by the power of the vajra, the mind endowed with the object goes to the state of Khecara.

original: gzhan yang mngon shes lnga yi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas ni sna tshogs pa yi yul 'dir 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon shes lnga yi rang bzhin rnal 'byor pas ni sna tshogs pa yi yul 'dir 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, the yogin endowed with the nature of the five superknowledges has this variety of objects.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying that

original: srog gi nus pa des rnal 'byor pa rnams la mngon par shes pa lnga ster bar byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: srog gi nus pa des rnal 'byor pa rnams la mngon par shes pa lnga ster bar byed ces bya'o //
translated: the power of the life force bestows the five superknowledges on the yogins.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam ster bar mdzad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam ster bar mdzad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How does it bestow the path of unsurpassed awakening?

original: phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽bla na med pa'i byang chub la rgyas btab par gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni yod pa dang med pa las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / bla na med pa'i byang chub la rgyas btab par gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni yod pa dang med pa las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The mudra, and so on.

original: sgyu ma dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The mudra that seals unsurpassed awakening is to be understood as being like an illusion because it transcends existence and nonexistence.

original: dper na gzugs gcig pu ni me long gi nang du mthong ba dang / sngon gyi gnas la gnas par snang ba'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs gcig pu ni me long gi nang du mthong ba dang / sngon gyi gnas la gnas par snang ba'o //
translated: For example, a single form is seen in a mirror and appears in the past.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po de nyid me long la snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po de nyid me long la snang ba ma yin te /
translated: That external thing is not reflected in the mirror,

original: rang la gnas par gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang la gnas par gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it remains in its own place.

original: / de las ma gtogs par yang ma yin te de nyid de bzhin du snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de las ma gtogs par yang ma yin te de nyid de bzhin du snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it not other than that, because it appears just as it is.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor pas yan lag drug rtag tu bsgom pa'i dbang gis rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs ni phyi rol du nam mkha' la mthong zhing nang du yid kyi dbang pos kyang de bzhin du mthong
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba'i rnal 'byor pas yan lag drug rtag tu bsgom pa'i dbang gis rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs ni phyi rol du nam mkha' la mthong zhing nang du yid kyi dbang pos kyang de bzhin du mthong
translated: In the same way, the yogi/nī of practice, by the power of always meditating on the six-branched yoga, sees the form of emptiness endowed with all aspects externally in the sky and internally with the mental faculty.

original: ngo // de bas na phyi dang nang gi snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo // de bas na phyi dang nang gi snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, external and internal appearances do not exist,

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi 'brel pa las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi 'brel pa las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are beyond the relationship of produced and producer.

original: med pa yang ma yin te dbang po so so la spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te dbang po so so la spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor are they nonexistent, because they are the objects of individual sense faculties.

original: de bas na khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they are special.

original: 'jig rten gsum snang byed cing dri med glog 'dra 'od zer du ma 'phro bar mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum snang byed cing dri med glog 'dra 'od zer du ma 'phro bar mdzad //
translated: Illuminating the three worlds, he radiates many light rays like a stainless lightning bolt.

original: ces bya ba ni /🔽rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du bstan par mdzad pas na /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni / rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du bstan par mdzad pas na /
translated: This is🔽because he illuminates the three worlds,

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: since he teaches the nature of all things just as it is, in the nature of the support and the supported.🔽He is stainless,

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bar gyur bas na dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bar gyur bas na dri ma med pa'o //
translated: since he is free from the latent tendencies of cyclic existence.🔽He is like a lightning bolt,

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na glog 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na glog 'dra ba'o //
translated: since he has the nature of clear light.🔽He radiates many light rays,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pas na 'od zer du ma 'phro bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: since he has the nature of the five supramundane wisdoms.

original: de gar @191b bzhugs she na /
analyzed: de gar @191b bzhugs she na /
translated: Where is he?

original: phyi dang lus la zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi dang lus la zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: He is in the external and in the body.

original: 'o na gal te phyi dang lus la gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te phyi dang lus la gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If he is in the external and in the body,

original: ci'i phyir sems can rnams kyis mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can rnams kyis mi mthong zhe na /
translated: why don’t sentient beings see him?

original: yul bral zhes bya bar gsungs te /🔽nam gyi dus su mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi drin gyis yul gzugs la sogs pa dor bar byed pa'i dus de la nyi ma dang nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du phyi dang lus la dbyer med pa'i ngo bos rnal 'byor pas mthong
analyzed: yul bral zhes bya bar gsungs te / nam gyi dus su mig gi dbang po la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi drin gyis yul gzugs la sogs pa dor bar byed pa'i dus de la nyi ma dang nyi ma'i 'od zer bzhin du phyi dang lus la dbyer med pa'i ngo bos rnal 'byor pas mthong
translated: It is said, free from objects.🔽 At that time, by the grace of the emptiness of the eye faculty, etc., the yogi sees the abandonment of objects such as form, etc.

original: ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ba yin gyi /
translated: At that time, like the sun and the sun's rays, he sees with a nature that is inseparable from the external and the body.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa chad pa'i bar du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa chad pa'i bar du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not until the connection between subject and object is severed.

original: dngos po ji ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How is the thing seen?

original: snang ba tsam zhes bya ba ni rdzas las 'das par gyur pa'i rmi lam gyi gzugs brnyan dang chu zla bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam zhes bya ba ni rdzas las 'das par gyur pa'i rmi lam gyi gzugs brnyan dang chu zla bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: It is said, mere appearance, that is, it is seen as a reflection in a dream, like a moon in water, and as beyond substance.

original: gang du mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gang du mthong zhe na /
translated: Where is it seen?

original: nam mkha' la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said, abiding in space.

original: dper na dang pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan mthong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dang pa'i me long la gzugs brnyan mthong ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a reflection is seen in a clear mirror,

original: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la gnas par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' la gnas par mthong ba'o //
translated: so it is seen abiding in cloudless space.

original: ci mthong zhe na sems zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci mthong zhe na sems zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is seen? The so-called mind.🔽

original: bag chags kyi dri ma las 'das par gyur pa'i rang gi sems yin gyi /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dri ma las 'das par gyur pa'i rang gi sems yin gyi /
translated: What is seen? It is one’s own mind, which has gone beyond the stain of habitual notions.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs de gang nas byung zhe na //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs de gang nas byung zhe na //
translated: From where does that form of emptiness, which is the nature of mind, arise?

original: sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It arises from the mind.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su phal pa'i sems las byung ba'i khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po rnams so sor snang ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'khor pa'i sems las byung ba yin gyi gzhan ma las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su phal pa'i sems las byung ba'i khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos po rnams so sor snang ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'khor pa'i sems las byung ba yin gyi gzhan ma las ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as various things appear distinctly in the mind during the dream state, so do things arise from the mind in the cycle of existence, and not from anything else.

original: 'o na gal te sems las byung ba de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sems las byung ba de lta na ni /
translated: But if things arise from the mind,

original: phyi rol du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can they exist externally?

original: 'gro ba du ma la ni 'khyud par byed pa de gcig go / zhes bya ba ni dper na chus gang bar gyur pa'i grangs med pa'i bum pa rnams kyi nang du nyi ma gcig pu snang bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du phyag rgya chen
analyzed: 'gro ba du ma la ni 'khyud par byed pa de gcig go / zhes bya ba ni dper na chus gang bar gyur pa'i grangs med pa'i bum pa rnams kyi nang du nyi ma gcig pu snang bar gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du phyag rgya chen
translated: Just as the one sun shines in countless vases filled with water, so also the great seal

original: mo de sems can thams cad kyi snying gar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: mo de sems can thams cad kyi snying gar zhugs pa'o //
translated: enters the hearts of all sentient beings.

original: rten du ma'i dbang gis de yang du mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten du ma'i dbang gis de yang du mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not multiple by virtue of many supports.

original: dper na nyi ma gcig pu ni bum pa re re la gzugs brnyan du gyur pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma gcig pu ni bum pa re re la gzugs brnyan du gyur pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the one sun is reflected in each vase.

original: 'o na gal te rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas gnas par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If it abides by the relation of support and supported,

original: rten med pas brten pa med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rten med pas brten pa med par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: then, since there is no support, is there not also no supported?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: @192a * // de ltar ma yin te khyab bya khyab byed kyi tshul gyi sa gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @192a * // de ltar ma yin te khyab bya khyab byed kyi tshul gyi sa gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: No, it is not like that. It abides in the manner of the pervaded and the pervader,

original: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the relation of support and supported.

original: dper na nyi ma gcig pus bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad gsal ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du de rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma gcig pus bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad gsal ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du de rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the sun alone illuminates all things such as pots by its illumination, so too, it is said that it makes a difference by its nature.

original: de nas gal te rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas gnas pa de lta na yang skyon med de /
analyzed: de nas gal te rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pas gnas pa de lta na yang skyon med de /
translated: Then, if it is the case that the abiding is by the connection of the support and the supported, even so, there is no fault.

original: dper na bum pa nyams par gyur pas nyi ma nyams par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i sems nyams par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: dper na bum pa nyams par gyur pas nyi ma nyams par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i sems nyams par 'gyur bas /
translated: For example, just as the sun does not decline when a pot is broken, so too, when the mind of cyclic existence declines,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems ma nyams par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems ma nyams par shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the mind of nirvana does not decline.

original: de bas na rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa ni sems dang ye shes la yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rten dang brten pa'i 'brel pa ni sems dang ye shes la yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the connection of the support and the supported is with the mind and gnosis,

original: lus po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with the body and so on.

original: de bas na rang gi sems snang bar gyur pa dang 'jig rten gsum po gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyag rgya chen mos ni bla na med pa'i byang chub ster bar mdzad kyi /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi sems snang bar gyur pa dang 'jig rten gsum po gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyag rgya chen mos ni bla na med pa'i byang chub ster bar mdzad kyi /
translated: Therefore, the great seal of the illumination of one's mind and the illumination of the three worlds grants unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nyi tshe ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Not with a limited or conceptual karmamudra, etc.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: He demonstrates just that:

original: sems ni dri ma dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya dag dang brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya spang //
analyzed: sems ni dri ma dang bcas las kyi phyag rgya dag dang brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya spang //
translated: “The mind with stains abandons karmamudras and conceptual jnanamudras.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.🔽

original: 'o na gal te las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya dgag pas de lta na ni ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dgos pa nyid gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te las kyi phyag rgya dang / ye shes kyi phyag rgya dgag pas de lta na ni ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag dgos pa nyid gsungs she na /
translated: “Well, if karmamudra and jnanamudra are prohibited, then why did the Bhagavat teach that they are necessary?”

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: 'dir las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos po gang yin pa de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dngos grub dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir las kyi phyag rgya dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i dngos po gang yin pa de 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dngos grub dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Here, the karmamudra and jnanamudra are for the sake of accomplishing the siddhis of the desire realm and the siddhis of the form realm.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not for the sake of accomplishing unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: Likewise, the Root Tantra says:

original: las kyi phyag rgya spang bya zhing //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya spang bya zhing //
translated: The action seal is to be abandoned,

original: brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya'o //🔽mchog tu mi 'gyur rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ye shes phyag rgya'o // mchog tu mi 'gyur rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: and the imagined wisdom seal.🔽The great seal is to be meditated on

original: phyag rgya chen mo bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo bsgom par bya // zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: by the yogi/nī of the unchanging supreme.

original: de bzhin du slar yang de nyid las //
analyzed: de bzhin du slar yang de nyid las //
translated: And again, the same text says:

original: 'dod par spyod pa'i dngos grub ni //
analyzed: 'dod par spyod pa'i dngos grub ni //
translated: The power of enjoying desire

original: las kyi phyag rgyas bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgyas bsgrub par bya //
translated: is accomplished by the action seal.

original: 'og min mthar thug bar du ni //
analyzed: 'og min mthar thug bar du ni //
translated: Up to the end of the Akaniṣṭha realm,

original: ye shes phyag rgyas gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes phyag rgyas gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: the form is by the wisdom seal.

original: rnal 'byor chen po kun mkhyen nyid //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: The great yogi/nī is omniscience itself,

original: @192b mi 'gyur sangs rgyas bde ba nyid //
analyzed: @192b mi 'gyur sangs rgyas bde ba nyid //
translated: the unchanging bliss of the Buddha.

original: phyag rgya chen mo'i yan lag ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo'i yan lag ni //
translated: The branch of the great seal

original: bsgom pas bsgrub bya skye 'di nyid //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas bsgrub bya skye 'di nyid // ces bya ba'o //
translated: is this very birth to be accomplished by meditation.

original: 'dir yang don de nyid bstan te //🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu ru mchog gi rgyal ba bskyed pa'i phyag rgya bzang mo bsgom //
analyzed: 'dir yang don de nyid bstan te // rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu ru mchog gi rgyal ba bskyed pa'i phyag rgya bzang mo bsgom //
translated: Here also that very meaning is taught:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Meditate on the good seal that generates the supreme victors as the cause of perfect awakening.

original: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: gos med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos med ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is called “uncovered.”

original: rtog pa thams cad las 'das par gyur pas na gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las 'das par gyur pas na gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it transcends all concepts, it is called “uncovered.”

original: dus thams cad du nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bos gnas pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i ngo bos gnas pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since it abides with an unchanging nature like space at all times, it is “unchanging.”

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa dag par mdzad pas na mun 'joms zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa dag par mdzad pas na mun 'joms zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it clears away the darkness of ignorance, it is called “darkness-destroyer.”

original: rgyu las 'das par gyur pas na nam mkha' mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu las 'das par gyur pas na nam mkha' mnyam pa'o //
translated: Since it transcends causes, it is “space-like.”

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par mdzad pas na khyab pa mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par mdzad pas na khyab pa mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it reveals the nature of all things, it is called “pervading.”

original: de yang ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that known?

original: rnal 'byor gyis ni bgrod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyis ni bgrod ces bya ba la /
translated: It is said, “It is reached by yoga.”

original: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa gnyis ka sbyar bar gyur pa'i dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa gnyis ka sbyar bar gyur pa'i dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i ste /
translated: Yoga is the central avadhūti, which is the union of the right and left.

original: de bzhin du srog dang thur sel gyi sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor du brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog dang thur sel gyi sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor du brjod do //
translated: Similarly, the union of prāṇa and apāna is called “yoga.”

original: gzhan yang chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba ro mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang chags pa dang chags pa dang bral ba ro mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: Moreover, the equality of passion and the absence of passion is

original: rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ro //
translated: yoga.

original: de bzhin du goms par gyur pa'i so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i yan lag drug ni rnal 'byor yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du goms par gyur pa'i so sor sdud pa la sogs pa'i yan lag drug ni rnal 'byor yin la /
translated: Thus, the six limbs of withdrawal, etc. , which are cultivated in that way are yoga.

original: de yis shes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yis shes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: By that, one will know,

original: gzhan ma gang gis kyang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma gang gis kyang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by any other means.

original: de gang na gnas she na /
analyzed: de gang na gnas she na /
translated: Where is that located?

original: lus la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is located in the body.

original: sems can thams cad kyi lus po la gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi lus po la gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is located in the bodies of all sentient beings.

original: ngo bo ji lta bus gnas she na /🔽ye shes gzi brjid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo bo ji lta bus gnas she na / ye shes gzi brjid ces bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bos gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: In what manner is it located?

original: bems po nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bems po nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is located in the nature of consciousness, not in the nature of an inanimate object.

original: gal te rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis shes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis shes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If it is known by the power of yoga,🔽what benefit does it provide?

original: don ci mdzad ce na srid pa'i dri 'phrog ces bya ba la srid pa'i dri ma ni 'khor ba'i bag chags yin la /
analyzed: don ci mdzad ce na srid pa'i dri 'phrog ces bya ba la srid pa'i dri ma ni 'khor ba'i bag chags yin la /
translated: It removes the stain of existence. The stain of existence is the latent tendency for cyclic existence.

original: de 'phrog par mdzad pas na srid pa'i dri 'phrog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'phrog par mdzad pas na srid pa'i dri 'phrog ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since it takes away that, it is called “the remover of the stain of existence.”

original: de'i dngos po ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: dus kyi 'khor los rig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'am rang bzhin @193a * //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor los rig ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'am rang bzhin @193a * //
translated: “ Known by the wheel of time” is the supreme unchanging bliss or nature that has become the nature of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: yin gyi / sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'pho ba dang rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi / sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa 'pho ba dang rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of suffering, which is the nature of the movement of subtle particles.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma phyag rgya chen mo gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po bka' gsang sngags ma gtogs par gang yang ma bstan te ;
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das ma phyag rgya chen mo gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis theg pa chen po bka' gsang sngags ma gtogs par gang yang ma bstan te ;
translated: Thus, the Blessed Lady, the Great Seal, is not taught by the Blessed One anywhere except in the secret vehicle of the Great Vehicle.

original: de bas na sngags kyi theg pa ni khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sngags kyi theg pa ni khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the vehicle of mantra is special.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bstan par mdzad de /
translated: It is taught:

original: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Consciousness” and so forth.

original: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung la sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas mdo sde pas sun phyung bar mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung la sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas mdo sde pas sun phyung bar mdzad de /
translated: Here, the Vaibhāṣika texts are refuted by the Sautrāntika in the order in which they were previously stated.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po smra bar 'dod pa de rnams la rnam par shes par smra ba pos sun dbyung bar byas la srid pa gsum po ni rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam du 'dod do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po smra bar 'dod pa de rnams la rnam par shes par smra ba pos sun dbyung bar byas la srid pa gsum po ni rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa tsam du 'dod do //
translated: The proponents of consciousness refute those who assert that things such as blue exist. They assert that the three existences are consciousness alone, which is beyond the most subtle particles.

original: de rnams kyang sems las ma gtogs par gzhan ma dngos po gang yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sems las ma gtogs par gzhan ma dngos po gang yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They also do not assert any other thing that is not included in the mind.

original: de rnams la yang gcig dang du mas rnam par dpyad pa'i rigs pas dbu ma pas sun dbyung bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de rnams la yang gcig dang du mas rnam par dpyad pa'i rigs pas dbu ma pas sun dbyung bar mdzad de /
translated: The Mādhyamikas refute them with the reasoning of the analysis of singularity and plurality.

original: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: All things are emptiness.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad na /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad na /
translated: When analyzed by way of their nature as singular or plural,

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: they are like a sky flower, devoid of characteristics. They are not mere consciousness.

original: de bas na gzung 'dzin la sogs pa las 'das par gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad bems po'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa de rnams kyi bsam pa ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gzung 'dzin la sogs pa las 'das par gyur pa'i dngos po thams cad bems po'i rang bzhin du 'dod pa de rnams kyi bsam pa ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the thought of those who assert that all things that are beyond subject-object duality and so on have the nature of matter is not so.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That very point is being taught:

original: sangs rgyas shes rab gang la'ang gnas min sangs rgyas pa rnams tshig ston 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas shes rab gang la'ang gnas min sangs rgyas pa rnams tshig ston 'gyur //
translated: The buddhas do not abide in any wisdom at all, for the buddhas teach words.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: sangs rgyas rnams la rnam pa thams cad du shes pa'i ngo bo ni med de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la rnam pa thams cad du shes pa'i ngo bo ni med de /
translated: The buddhas do not have an entity that is wisdom in any way at all.

original: gal te sangs rgyas shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni shes bya sngon du 'gro ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni shes bya sngon du 'gro ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: If the buddhas were the nature of wisdom, then wisdom would precede the object of knowledge.

original: shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ni gzung 'dzin gyi rtog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya gnyis ni gzung 'dzin gyi rtog pa yin gyi /
translated: Wisdom and the object of knowledge are the concepts of subject and object,

original: stong pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not emptiness.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi shes rab dngos po gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya bar phyogs bzung nas stong pa nyid bsgrub par 'dod de dngos po gang yang ma grub pa'i stong pa nyid kyi bsgom pa des mchog tu @193b mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi shes rab dngos po gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya bar phyogs bzung nas stong pa nyid bsgrub par 'dod de dngos po gang yang ma grub pa'i stong pa nyid kyi bsgom pa des mchog tu @193b mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang
translated: For that reason, having taken the position that the Buddha's wisdom does not abide in any entity, they wish to establish emptiness.

original: bral ba'i bems po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa de rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i bems po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa de rnams su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that meditation on emptiness, in which no entity is established at all, they become empty, which is the nature of an inanimate thing, devoid of the supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' gsang sngags kyi theg pa las 'pho ba med pa'am lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i skur bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' gsang sngags kyi theg pa las 'pho ba med pa'am lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i skur bstan to //
translated: For that reason, in the Bhagavān's secret mantra vehicle, it is taught as the unchanging or innate body of bliss.

original: gtso bos de phyir gang zhig 'pho med lhan cig skyes pa'i bde sku sngags kyi theg par bstan //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bos de phyir gang zhig 'pho med lhan cig skyes pa'i bde sku sngags kyi theg par bstan // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The principal one taught that in the mantra vehicle, the unchanging innate body of bliss.

original: bde ba de nyid kyang rig byed la sogs pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don du bstan la /
analyzed: bde ba de nyid kyang rig byed la sogs pa las tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis nges pa'i don du bstan la /
translated: That bliss is also taught in the Vedas and so on as the definitive meaning of Brahmā and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal bar smos ci dgos she na bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal bar smos ci dgos she na bstan par mdzad de /
translated: What need is there to mention the Bhagavān Buddha?

original: ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the verse beginning with “cow,”

original: 'dir nges pa'i don du mchod sbyin gyi dus ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i dus yin la /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa'i don du mchod sbyin gyi dus ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i dus yin la /
translated: here, in the definitive meaning, the time of sacrifice is the time of supreme non-change.

original: dus der ba lang la sogs pa'i sgras mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dang de rnams kyi yul du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phan tshun du 'brel ba tshad ma ni mchod skyin yin la ye shes kyi sbyor ba la dmigs pa gsal zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: dus der ba lang la sogs pa'i sgras mig gi dbang po la sogs pa dang de rnams kyi yul du gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phan tshun du 'brel ba tshad ma ni mchod skyin yin la ye shes kyi sbyor ba la dmigs pa gsal zhes bya ba'i
translated: At that time, the word “cow” and so on refers to the mutual connection of the eye sense base and so on and the form sense base and so on that are their objects. The valid knowledge that is the sacrifice is the clear focus on the union of wisdom.🔽This is the meaning.

original: don to // de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi dus su khrag dang ldan pa'i ko ba la phyi rol gyi sman so ma ni brdungs nas bram ze rnams kyi btung ba yang yin pa de spyi bo nas byung ba'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi ni rdul dang ldan pa'i bha gar dga'
analyzed: don to // de bzhin du mchod sbyin gyi dus su khrag dang ldan pa'i ko ba la phyi rol gyi sman so ma ni brdungs nas bram ze rnams kyi btung ba yang yin pa de spyi bo nas byung ba'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi ni rdul dang ldan pa'i bha gar dga'
translated: Similarly, at the time of sacrifice, the outer medicine soma, which is endowed with blood, is pounded and is also the drink of the brahmins. The nectar of the moon that arises from the crown is the form of joy that abides in the bhaga endowed with the bindu.

original: ba'i gzugs kyis gnas par brjod do //
analyzed: ba'i gzugs kyis gnas par brjod do //
translated: This is said.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha gsum po dang / zla ba'i rig byed dang mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / rigs kyi rig byed gsum ni srog chags rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems su de rnams shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha gsum po dang / zla ba'i rig byed dang mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / rigs kyi rig byed gsum ni srog chags rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang sems su de rnams shes par bya'o ;
translated: Likewise, the three gods Brahma and so forth, the three Vedas of the moon, sacrifice, and clan, should be known as the body, speech, and mind of living beings.

original: / aom bhu:bho ba: yi ge gsum ni yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: / aom bhu:bho ba: yi ge gsum ni yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The three syllables Om, Bhūḥ, and Bhuvaḥ are the three qualities, and the three channels.

original: de bzhin du phyi rol du rigs kyi brtul zhugs ni nang du lus kyi lha dang lha mo'i rigs su brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi rol du rigs kyi brtul zhugs ni nang du lus kyi lha dang lha mo'i rigs su brjod do //
translated: Likewise, the external clan observances are said to be the clan of the body gods and goddesses internally.

original: de bzhin du rig byed srid srung ni gzhom du med pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur bar brjod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig byed srid srung ni gzhom du med pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur bar brjod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the Veda of the protector of existence is said to be the supreme, unchanging, invincible.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rig byed mtha' las gsang bas 'di nyid tshangs pas rnal 'byor pa la sngon du brjod //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas rig byed mtha' las gsang bas 'di nyid tshangs pas rnal 'byor pa la sngon du brjod //🔽ces bya ba ni /
translated: In this way, the secret of the Veda of the end of the Veda was previously expressed to the yogi by Brahma.

original: rig byed mtha' ni shin tu gsang bar gyur pa'i don 'di lta bu tshangs pas gang bstan pa //
analyzed: rig byed mtha' ni shin tu gsang bar gyur pa'i don 'di lta bu tshangs pas gang bstan pa //
translated: The Vedānta teaches this very secret meaning:

original: de yi dus kyi shes pa rang nyams @194a * //
analyzed: de yi dus kyi shes pa rang nyams @194a * //
translated: “Brahmā, who is the self-experience of the knowledge of that time,

original: thub pa rnams kyis srog chags rnams la gsod bstan pa //
analyzed: thub pa rnams kyis srog chags rnams la gsod bstan pa //
translated: teaches the living beings the killing of living beings.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: phyi nas de'i dbang gis mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi nas de'i dbang gis mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: Later, by the power of that, for the sake of heaven,

original: sems can thams cad kyi srog bcad par byas nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi srog bcad par byas nas /
translated: having killed all living beings,

original: mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: one will go to Avīci.

original: de bas na srog bcad pas rnam pa thams cad du mtho ris su mi 'gro ba'i dpe bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na srog bcad pas rnam pa thams cad du mtho ris su mi 'gro ba'i dpe bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, it teaches the example that by killing, one will not go to heaven in any way:

original: sol ba 'o ma'i rgyun gyis bkrus na zla ba'i mdog tu 'dir ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sol ba 'o ma'i rgyun gyis bkrus na zla ba'i mdog tu 'dir ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Even if one washes coal with a stream of milk, it will never become the color of the moon in this world.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de bas na nges pa'i don dang bral bar gyur pa'i rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyis mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na nges pa'i don dang bral bar gyur pa'i rig byed kyi tshig rnams kyis mi rnams kyi nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the words of the Vedas, which are devoid of definitive meaning, teach only the afflictions of humans.

original: rnal 'byor bral zhing dam tshig bral ba'i rig byed tshig gis mi rnams gang bslus des //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bral zhing dam tshig bral ba'i rig byed tshig gis mi rnams gang bslus des //
translated: By what means do the Brahmans deceive men, who are devoid of yoga, devoid of vows, and who are full of the Vedas?

original: rang gi chung ma nyin mtshan dus su bdag gi bu ni bskyed phyir srung bar byed //
analyzed: rang gi chung ma nyin mtshan dus su bdag gi bu ni bskyed phyir srung bar byed //
translated: The wife of a man, in order to protect her son, guards him day and night.

original: sbyin pa bu yis byin na yi dags 'jig rten la gnas pa yis thob 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: sbyin pa bu yis byin na yi dags 'jig rten la gnas pa yis thob 'gyur ro ;
translated: If a son gives a gift, he obtains a place in the world of the hungry ghosts.

original: / de'i phyir bde mnyam 'bras ster 'dod chags sbyin pa 'di ni bram ze sdang bas sbas //
analyzed: / de'i phyir bde mnyam 'bras ster 'dod chags sbyin pa 'di ni bram ze sdang bas sbas //
translated: Therefore, this gift of passion, which bestows the fruit of the bliss of union, is hidden by the Brahmans out of hatred.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the verse.

original: 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa la yon tan ci bdog ce na /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa la yon tan ci bdog ce na /
translated: What is the virtue of the gift of passion?

original: dpes bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: dpes bstan par mdzad de /
translated: It is taught by an example.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyi rta mchog rgod ma las ni rta chen skyes nas ni //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyi rta mchog rgod ma las ni rta chen skyes nas ni //
translated: A man, having obtained a great horse from another's mare,

original: de yi mthu yis slar yang dpa' mor gyur pa bdag pos phyir don ma thob bam //
analyzed: de yi mthu yis slar yang dpa' mor gyur pa bdag pos phyir don ma thob bam //
translated: by its power again becomes a hero, does the master not obtain his purpose?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the verse.

original: dper na skyes bu gang zhig la rgod ma las khyad par du skyes pa'i rta'i dbang gis rdzas kyi dpal mo thob par gyur pa ji ltar de bzhin du bud med phran tshegs kyi sbyin pas skye ba phyi ma la shin tu khyad par gyi don 'grub par
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gang zhig la rgod ma las khyad par du skyes pa'i rta'i dbang gis rdzas kyi dpal mo thob par gyur pa ji ltar de bzhin du bud med phran tshegs kyi sbyin pas skye ba phyi ma la shin tu khyad par gyi don 'grub par
translated: Just as that is, so in the next birth, the attainment of the highest goal is accomplished through the gift of a trifling woman.

original: gyur pa de la skyon ci yod ce na bstan to //
analyzed: gyur pa de la skyon ci yod ce na bstan to //
translated: What is the fault in that? It is shown:

original: des na gal te dus thams cad du bza' bran gnyi ga rtag pa yin pa de lta na ni mi'i sbyin pa mchog ste de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te dus thams cad du bza' bran gnyi ga rtag pa yin pa de lta na ni mi'i sbyin pa mchog ste de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if both the husband and wife were permanent at all times, then the gift of a human would be supreme. But that is not so.

original: de bas na 'chi bar gyur pa'i mi la khyim thab gang yin pa dang bdag po gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'chi bar gyur pa'i mi la khyim thab gang yin pa dang bdag po gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, when a man dies, who is his husband? Who is his master?

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That is shown:

original: nyin mtshan dus su chags can gyis ni rang rang khyem thab srung byed pa //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dus su chags can gyis ni rang rang khyem thab srung byed pa //
translated: Day and night, at all times, the passionate one protects his own husband.

original: shi nas khyod ni gang dang khyod kyi khyim thab gang yin kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings //
analyzed: shi nas khyod ni gang dang khyod kyi khyim thab gang yin kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings //
translated: After death, you are bound by the evil karma of “who are you?” and “who is your husband?”

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ngan pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ngan pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the bad intention.

original: de bas sbyin pa thams @194b cad kyi nang nas 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa khyad par du gyur par shes nas bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas sbyin pa thams @194b cad kyi nang nas 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa khyad par du gyur par shes nas bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, knowing that among all gifts, the gift of passion is the most special, he taught it.🔽The gift of cattle, the gift of land, and likewise the gift of enjoyments to the human world,🔽the gift of medicine and food that conquers all illnesses, hunger and thirst,

original: ba lang sbyin dang sa sbyin gzhan yang de bzhin longs spyod mi yi 'jig rten la ster dang // sman dang bza' ba'i sbyin ba nad rnams kun 'joms bkres dang skom pa 'joms pa dang // thams cad las ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'dod pa'i sbyin pa'i 'khor lo'i dus su smos ci dgos //
analyzed: ba lang sbyin dang sa sbyin gzhan yang de bzhin longs spyod mi yi 'jig rten la ster dang // sman dang bza' ba'i sbyin ba nad rnams kun 'joms bkres dang skom pa 'joms pa dang // thams cad las ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'dod pa'i sbyin pa'i 'khor lo'i dus su smos ci dgos //
translated: and the gift of all that bestows the result of the bliss of nirvana—what need is there to mention the gift of desire?

original: chung ma sdug dang sring mo skal bzang bu mo gsang ba ster phyir sbyin par bya //
analyzed: chung ma sdug dang sring mo skal bzang bu mo gsang ba ster phyir sbyin par bya //
translated: For the sake of giving the beloved wife, the beautiful sister, and the secret daughter, give them.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This teaches

original: sa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa thams cad las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa thams cad las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster ba'i phyir /
translated: that among all gifts such as land, it is the gift of passion that bestows the supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa khyad par du gyur par shes nas yid du 'ong ba'i khyim thab la sogs pa rdo rje mchod pa'i phyir dus thams cad du sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa khyad par du gyur par shes nas yid du 'ong ba'i khyim thab la sogs pa rdo rje mchod pa'i phyir dus thams cad du sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Knowing that generosity is especially exalted by passion, one should always give gifts for the sake of the vajra worship of a pleasing spouse, etc.

original: da ni smad 'tshong ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi ni las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhis dag pa bstan par mdzad de /🔽gsal bar lus 'tshong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir smad 'tshong ma ni las kyi phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: da ni smad 'tshong ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi ni las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhis dag pa bstan par mdzad de / gsal bar lus 'tshong zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir smad 'tshong ma ni las kyi phyag rgya yin te /
translated: Now, the four seals such as the prostitute are taught to be pure by the four seals such as the karmamudra.🔽The prostitute, etc.

original: sems can thams cad la thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin du gsang bar gyur ba'i bud med ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du gsang bar gyur ba'i bud med ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya yin te /
translated: Here, the prostitute is the karmamudra, because she is common to all sentient beings.

original: dam tshig gsang bar 'gyur ba'i ji lta ba de bzhin du mi gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gsang bar 'gyur ba'i ji lta ba de bzhin du mi gsal bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the secret woman is the guhyamudra, because she is secret, and because she is not clear, as is the case with the secret commitment.

original: rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni chos kyi phyag rgya yin te /
analyzed: rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyag rgya ni chos kyi phyag rgya yin te /
translated: The independent woman is the dharmamudrā, because she is independent.

original: gang gis kyang dbang du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis kyang dbang du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not controlled by anyone.

original: khyim thab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya yin te rang gi sems dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim thab ni ye shes kyi phyag rgya yin te rang gi sems dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The husband is the knowledge consort, because he is like one's own mind.

original: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: gsal bar lus 'tshong zhes bya ba ni lo bcu gnyis lon pa'i smad 'tshong ma dang / rim pa de bzhin du lo bcu drug ma dang nyi shu ma dang sum cu lon pa'i khyim thab ni rim pa ji lta ba de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar lus 'tshong zhes bya ba ni lo bcu gnyis lon pa'i smad 'tshong ma dang / rim pa de bzhin du lo bcu drug ma dang nyi shu ma dang sum cu lon pa'i khyim thab ni rim pa ji lta ba de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The prostitute who is twelve years old is called the prostitute who is clear in body. The husband who is sixteen years old, the one who is twenty years old, and the one who is thirty years old should be known in the same order.

original: de ltar phyag rgya de rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes nas bla ma la sogs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa ji lta bar de rnams dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya de rnams kyi mtshan nyid shes nas bla ma la sogs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa ji lta bar de rnams dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, having understood the characteristics of those consorts, they should be offered to the guru and so forth, in accordance with their suitability.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: theg pa chen po gsang sngags la zhugs nas 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa ma sbyin gyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gsang sngags la zhugs nas 'dod chags kyi sbyin pa ma sbyin gyi bar du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having entered the vehicle of mantra, until one has offered the gift of passion, one will not attain the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /🔽sngon du sangs rgyas rnams kyis sa dang glang chen rta dang shing rta gser khur du ma ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de / sngon du sangs rgyas rnams kyis sa dang glang chen rta dang shing rta gser khur du ma ni /
translated: He taught that very thing:🔽Previously, the Buddhas, for the sake of Buddhahood, gave away many lands, elephants, horses, chariots, and loads of gold.

original: @195a * // sangs rgyas phyir sbyin slar yang bu dang sha khrag rnams ni rab tu sbyin 'gyur te //
analyzed: @195a * // sangs rgyas phyir sbyin slar yang bu dang sha khrag rnams ni rab tu sbyin 'gyur te //
translated: They gave away their children, flesh, and blood,🔽but did not attain the Buddhahood they desired.

original: 'dis ni 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur min de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa mdzad //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur min de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa mdzad //
translated: Then they made the gift of desire,

original: de yi sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs las me rnams gsang ba'i sbyin pas so //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yi sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs las me rnams gsang ba'i sbyin pas so // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and from the lineage of the Victorious Ones, the producers of Buddhahood, the fire of the secret gift arose.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon du sbyin pa la sogs pas nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma grub par gzigs nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir btsun mo stong phrag drug cu tham pa bzhes te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon du sbyin pa la sogs pas nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa ma grub par gzigs nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir btsun mo stong phrag drug cu tham pa bzhes te /
translated: The Bhagavat Sakyamuni, seeing that previously he had not accomplished his own perfection by giving and so forth, in order to complete the gift of desire, took sixty thousand queens.

original: phyi nas de thams cad sbyin pa mdzad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nas de thams cad sbyin pa mdzad nas bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon du mdzad par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Later, having given all that away, he will manifest unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang rgyu phran tshegs las 'bras bu khyad par du gyur pa bzhin du de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu phran tshegs las 'bras bu khyad par du gyur pa bzhin du de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, just as a small cause can result in something special, he taught that very thing:

original: gser zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Gold, etc.

original: dper na 'dir gal te zangs kyis gser de tsam du rnyed pa dang lha'i cod pan gyi nor bu ni mching bu dum bus dang gsal bar smad 'tshong byin pas mtho ris kyi lha mo dang pags pa'i dum bus gla rtsi'i lte ba dang bong bus rta dang
analyzed: dper na 'dir gal te zangs kyis gser de tsam du rnyed pa dang lha'i cod pan gyi nor bu ni mching bu dum bus dang gsal bar smad 'tshong byin pas mtho ris kyi lha mo dang pags pa'i dum bus gla rtsi'i lte ba dang bong bus rta dang
translated: For example, here, if copper is that much gold, a divine crown jewel is a piece of glass, a prostitute is a goddess, a piece of skin is the navel of musk, and a donkey is a horse.

original: / ras brjes nas glang po che rnyed pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyim thab kyi sbyin pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i btsun mor gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo thob pa ni don khyad par du gyur pa
analyzed: / ras brjes nas glang po che rnyed pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa dang 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyim thab kyi sbyin pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i btsun mor gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo thob pa ni don khyad par du gyur pa
translated: Just as a piece of cloth is exchanged for an elephant, in the same way, by the gift of a husband who is impermanent and a cause of cyclic existence, one attains the state of a great seal who is the queen of the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is this not a special meaning?

original: de dag la sogs pa'i sbyin pa gang la sbyin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i sbyin pa gang la sbyin zhe na /
translated: To whom should one give such gifts and so forth?

original: byams pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: byams pa'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To the abode of love, etc.

original: 'dir phyi'i sbyin pa ni 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la thun mong du sbyin par bya zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni bla ma dang khyad par du gyur pa'i gang zag rnams la sbyin par bya ba ni
analyzed: 'dir phyi'i sbyin pa ni 'bras bu la ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis sems can thams cad la thun mong du sbyin par bya zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni bla ma dang khyad par du gyur pa'i gang zag rnams la sbyin par bya ba ni
translated: Here, external giving is giving in common to all sentient beings with a mind that does not consider results. Giving of desires, etc. is giving to gurus and special individuals.

original: nges pa'o // de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa ni rang gi rigs bsrung ba'i phyir bram ze gdug pa rnams kyi rig byed tshad mar byas nas dgag pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'o // de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa ni rang gi rigs bsrung ba'i phyir bram ze gdug pa rnams kyi rig byed tshad mar byas nas dgag pa ste /
translated: Thus, by the sequence of statements, the giving of desire is prohibited in order to protect one's own class, taking the Vedas of evil Brahmins as authoritative.

original: de bas na gang gi rig byed tshad mar 'dod pa de rig byed tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi rig byed tshad mar 'dod pa de rig byed tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one who accepts the Vedas as authoritative will have the Vedas as authoritative.

original: rig byed tshad mar 'dod pas mchog sbyin tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig byed tshad mar 'dod pas mchog sbyin tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: By accepting the Vedas as authoritative, one will have the giving of desire as authoritative.

original: mchog sbyin tshad mar gyur pas mnar sems tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog sbyin tshad mar gyur pas mnar sems tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: By having the giving of desire as authoritative, one will have malice as authoritative.

original: mnar sems tshad mar gyur pa la dmyal bar gtong ba'i sdig pa tshad @195b mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mnar sems tshad mar gyur pa la dmyal bar gtong ba'i sdig pa tshad @195b mar gyur pa'o //
translated: For one who has malice as authoritative, the sin of casting into hell will be authoritative.

original: de bas na rig pa 'dzin pa dang phrag dog gi bsam pa dor nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams la 'dod pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa 'dzin pa dang phrag dog gi bsam pa dor nas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i dam tshig dang sdom pa la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams la 'dod pa'i sbyin pa sbyin par bya zhes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the attitude of jealousy towards the knowledge holders, one should give the giving of desire to those individuals who abide in the commitments and vows of accomplishing the siddhi of Mahamudra. This is the definite meaning.

original: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang bzhengs su gsol ba gang yin pa de sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang bzhengs su gsol ba gang yin pa de sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, the Blessed One declared the special quality of those who request the construction of a temple,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du gyur pa gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par du gyur pa gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: because they become a field of merit for sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa las ma gtogs par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa las ma gtogs par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not because of any exclusion from generosity.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches just that:

original: gtsug lag khang dpal rab gnas gos dang bza' phyir dge bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dpal rab gnas gos dang bza' phyir dge bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs //
translated: The Blessed One declared that a temple is virtuous for the sake of clothing and food,

original: sman dang bza' ba'i sbyin pa sdig pa'i nad ni nyams byed der ni sbyin pa po yis sbyin //
analyzed: sman dang bza' ba'i sbyin pa sdig pa'i nad ni nyams byed der ni sbyin pa po yis sbyin //
translated: and the giver there gives medicine and food to destroy the sickness of sin.

original: sbyin pa med na sa steng gnas su gtsug lag khang ni dud 'gro'i gnas nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med na sa steng gnas su gtsug lag khang ni dud 'gro'i gnas nyid do //
translated: Without generosity, a temple on the face of the earth is just a dwelling for animals.

original: gang du bza' bar gyur ba de ni dge 'dun chos dang sangs rgyas 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du bza' bar gyur ba de ni dge 'dun chos dang sangs rgyas 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: O King, where there is food, there is the Sangha, the Dharma, and the Buddha.

original: da ni sngags kyi tshul gyis mngon sum du gyur pa'i dkon mchog gsum po'i mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi tshul gyis mngon sum du gyur pa'i dkon mchog gsum po'i mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he presents the characteristics of the Three Jewels that are manifest in the manner of mantra.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Buddhahood and so forth.

original: 'dir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to attain unsurpassed awakening,

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bar byed de /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su song bar byed de /
translated: one should go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas dkon mchog gsum po de min par mdzad de //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas dkon mchog gsum po de min par mdzad de //
translated: The Three Jewels are made non-existent by ultimate truth.

original: gtsug lag khang gnas sangs rgyas 'di dang 'di ni bris pa'i glegs bam chos dang ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gnas sangs rgyas 'di dang 'di ni bris pa'i glegs bam chos dang ni /
translated: This temple, this Buddha, and this written scripture are the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun dur smrig gyon pas mchog 'gyur gtso bo'i bde ba skye 'bum gyis ster min //
analyzed: dge 'dun dur smrig gyon pas mchog 'gyur gtso bo'i bde ba skye 'bum gyis ster min //
translated: and the Saṅgha wearing saffron robes is the supreme, not given by a hundred thousand births.🔽This is

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: shing dang 'dag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas dang glegs bam du gnas pa'i yi ge'i tshogs dang / skra sregs pa dang dur smrig 'dzin pa'i dge 'dun gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ni ster bar mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: shing dang 'dag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas dang glegs bam du gnas pa'i yi ge'i tshogs dang / skra sregs pa dang dur smrig 'dzin pa'i dge 'dun gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ni ster bar mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: The Buddha in the nature of wood and clay, the collection of syllables in the form of a book, and the Saṅgha of those who burn their hair and wear saffron robes will not bestow the supreme unchanging bliss of Bhagavat Vajrasattva.

original: /'o na don dam par dkon mchog gsum gang yin zhe na /🔽slob dpon sangs rgyas nyid de sa mchog steng du chos ni de yis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: /'o na don dam par dkon mchog gsum gang yin zhe na / slob dpon sangs rgyas nyid de sa mchog steng du chos ni de yis bstan pa'o //
translated: What then are the three jewels ultimately?

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽dbang po thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa mngon sum du rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdo rje / slob dpon @196a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / dbang po thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa mngon sum du rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rdo rje / slob dpon @196a * //
translated: The master is the Buddha himself, on the supreme stage, the Dharma is taught by him.

original: ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin gyi bems po dang lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin gyi bems po dang lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The master is the Bhagavat Buddha, not an insentient or hidden object.

original: de ltar de yis drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa ni chos yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar de yis drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don gyi 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos bstan pa ni chos yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the Dharma is the teaching of the mundane and supramundane dharmas of the interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning.

original: shog bu la gnas pa'i yi ge'i tshogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shog bu la gnas pa'i yi ge'i tshogs ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the collection of letters on paper.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin snying rje byed pa dang / dus thams cad du sems dgyes par gyur pa'i slob dpon gyi 'khor ni dge 'dun yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin snying rje byed pa dang / dus thams cad du sems dgyes par gyur pa'i slob dpon gyi 'khor ni dge 'dun yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the Saṅgha is the assembly of disciples who are like a single son to all sentient beings, who are compassionate, and who are always delighted in mind.

original: rang gcig pu dul bar 'dod pa dang sdug bsngal dang ldan par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gcig pu dul bar 'dod pa dang sdug bsngal dang ldan par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not those who desire to be disciplined alone, nor those who are in suffering.

original: de yang mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said to be of two kinds in brief:

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bla na med pa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bla na med pa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: the Śrāvaka Saṅgha and the unsurpassed Saṅgha.

original: rgyas par ni dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas par ni dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni rnam pa bzhir bstan to //
translated: In detail, it is taught that all the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās are the four kinds of conventional Śrāvaka Saṅgha.

original: don dam par na bla na med pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam par na bla na med pa ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma dang bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
translated: Ultimately, the unsurpassed is said to be the four types of yogis and yoginis who have attained supreme unchanging bliss, and the four types of upasakas and upasikas who abide in the samadhi of the generation stage.
