original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa bzhir gyur pa'i dge 'dun de la rang rang gi chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod kyis de rnams gang gis tshim par byed pa'i skyes bu de la skye ba 'di nyid du don 'grub par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis dang rnam pa bzhir gyur pa'i dge 'dun de la rang rang gi chos dang mthun pa'i longs spyod kyis de rnams gang gis tshim par byed pa'i skyes bu de la skye ba 'di nyid du don 'grub par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, the Sangha, which is of two types and four types, is satisfied by the enjoyments that are in accordance with their respective Dharmas. The person who satisfies them is taught to accomplish the purpose in this very life.

original: bsod nams ye shes don phyir rnam pa sna tshogs sbyin pa rtag tu shin tu dgyes //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes don phyir rnam pa sna tshogs sbyin pa rtag tu shin tu dgyes //
translated: For the sake of merit and wisdom, he always delights in giving various things.

original: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs mchog gi bde byed 'dod 'gyur sbyin pa rnal 'byor pa rnams la //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs mchog gi bde byed 'dod 'gyur sbyin pa rnal 'byor pa rnams la //
translated: He gives the best enjoyments, such as feasts, to the Shravakas.

original: sbyin pa po rnams gang zhig rab tu dga' sems kun nas rjes chags sems kyis sbyin //
analyzed: sbyin pa po rnams gang zhig rab tu dga' sems kun nas rjes chags sems kyis sbyin //
translated: The givers, with a mind of delight, with a mind of complete attachment, give.

original: de rnams bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog tu bde ba'i go 'phang skye ba 'di las 'gro //
analyzed: de rnams bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog tu bde ba'i go 'phang skye ba 'di las 'gro //
translated: They go from here to the state of supreme bliss, having completed merit and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is🔽the stage of accumulating the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.🔽The givers, who are free from the fault of giving to those who are not🔽recipients, give gifts of feasts, etc., and of the five sense objects, to the

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos kyi sdom pa la gnas pa dang sngags kyi theg pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sbyin pa po gang gi kha na ma tho ba
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du nyan thos kyi sdom pa la gnas pa dang sngags kyi theg pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sbyin pa po gang gi kha na ma tho ba
translated: yogis who abide in the śrāvaka vow and who abide in the vehicle of🔽mantra. By that giving, they definitely go from this very life to the state of

original: dang bral ba'i ston mo la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa des skye ba 'di nyid du tshogs nyid kyi dbang gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub grub pa de @196b ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: dang bral ba'i ston mo la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sbyin pa sbyin pa des skye ba 'di nyid du tshogs nyid kyi dbang gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub grub pa de @196b ni nges pa'o //
translated: supreme bliss, having completed the collections, by the power of the collections, and having attained the power of the great seal.

original: de bas na ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa ni slob dpon yin la rgyu de'i phyir de la mi gang gis smod par byed pa de mnar med pa'i sar 'gro bar 'gyur ba bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs par byed pa ni slob dpon yin la rgyu de'i phyir de la mi gang gis smod par byed pa de mnar med pa'i sar 'gro bar 'gyur ba bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the master is the one who perfects the accumulation of wisdom. For that reason, it is shown that whoever criticizes him will go to the Avīci hell.

original: gsal ba'i rgyal ba slob dpon nyan thos glen pa gang zhig rnams kyis smod byed de //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyal ba slob dpon nyan thos glen pa gang zhig rnams kyis smod byed de //
translated: The foolish śrāvakas, who are the victors’ disciples, criticize him.

original: de rnams bgegs kyi mgon pos gsod de myur du shin tu 'jigs byed mnar med 'gro /🔽zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: de rnams bgegs kyi mgon pos gsod de myur du shin tu 'jigs byed mnar med 'gro / zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The lord of obstacles kills them quickly, and they go to the terrifying Avīci hell.

original: rgyu de gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zhig sngags kyi mthu yis mchog gi rgyal dbang bdag byin brlab par mdzad //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig sngags kyi mthu yis mchog gi rgyal dbang bdag byin brlab par mdzad // ces bya ba ni /
translated: He is the one who, by the power of mantra, blesses the supreme king with self-consecration.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyi sngags dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i mi rnams la rdo rje sems dpa' mngon sum du byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyi sngags dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i mi rnams la rdo rje sems dpa' mngon sum du byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the vajra master, by the power of mantra and samādhi, blesses those fortunate people with the direct perception of Vajrasattva.

original: gzhan yang dge slong gang zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i go 'phang tshangs spyod mi rnams de dang mtshungs //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong gang zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i go 'phang tshangs spyod mi rnams de dang mtshungs //
translated: Moreover, what monk is there who is equal to the Master, who is endowed with pure conduct, who is established in the state of definite observance?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa brtul zhugs nges pa la gnas pa'i slob dpon ni de dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i dge slong gang zhig kyang med de nyan thos kyi bslab pa tsam bsrung ba dang dus thams cad du tshangs par spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa brtul zhugs nges pa la gnas pa'i slob dpon ni de dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i dge slong gang zhig kyang med de nyan thos kyi bslab pa tsam bsrung ba dang dus thams cad du tshangs par spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro
translated: There is no monk who is equal to the Master, who is endowed with pure conduct, who is established in definite observance, because he alone guards the training of the śrāvakas and is always endowed with pure conduct.

original: // gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir dka' ba'i las byed de ;
analyzed: // gzhan yang nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyis mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir dka' ba'i las byed de ;
translated: Moreover, the śrāvakas and others perform difficult tasks because they desire supreme unchanging bliss.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bya bas bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bya bas bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i don 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But they do not accomplish the goal of the nature of bliss through the performance of suffering.

original: de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa'i byis pa rnams la lam 'khrul bar gyur pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos la sogs pa'i byis pa rnams la lam 'khrul bar gyur pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the path of the śrāvakas and others is taught to be mistaken.

original: mchog gi bde 'dod dge slong dag gam kun du rgyu rnams thams cad dga' bar byed //
analyzed: mchog gi bde 'dod dge slong dag gam kun du rgyu rnams thams cad dga' bar byed //
translated: The monks and wandering mendicants who desire the highest bliss are all delighted.

original: gcer bu mgo reg dang ni ral pa can dang klog nyan ngag la mkhas pa lam nyams ni //
analyzed: gcer bu mgo reg dang ni ral pa can dang klog nyan ngag la mkhas pa lam nyams ni //
translated: The naked, the shaven-headed, the long-haired, the readers and reciters, the wise in speech, the ascetics,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are all delighted.

original: ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: How is it done?

original: byed pa po dang bdag 'dzin rang gzhan 'dir ni rtag tu bu dang khyim thab 'dzin pa dang // bza' dang bza' min 'dzin dang rigs dang rigs min 'dod cing snod dang snod min gzung bas so //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bdag 'dzin rang gzhan 'dir ni rtag tu bu dang khyim thab 'dzin pa dang // bza' dang bza' min 'dzin dang rigs dang rigs min 'dod cing snod dang snod min gzung bas so //
translated: The agent, the self, the constant grasping here of self and other, of son and wife, of what is edible and inedible, of what is proper and improper, and of what is a vessel and what is not a vessel.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang dag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir gang dag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Here, by these and other conceptualizations.

original: de bas na lus dang ngag dang sems sdug bsngal du gyur pas na bde ba gang gis thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang ngag dang sems sdug bsngal du gyur pas na bde ba gang gis thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since body, speech, and mind are suffering, by what bliss will they be attained?

original: rgyu de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i @197a * //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i @197a * //
translated: For that reason, it bestows the highest unchanging bliss.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: Body, speech, and mind are the nature of all buddhas.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Not of others.

original: de bas na de rnams las ma gtogs par gang zhig rnams kyis thar pa bsgrub par 'dod pa'i mi de rnams 'khor bar 'khyams par gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na de rnams las ma gtogs par gang zhig rnams kyis thar pa bsgrub par 'dod pa'i mi de rnams 'khor bar 'khyams par gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, those who seek liberation outside of those, those people wander in cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba las pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba las pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: They are not liberated from cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni sangs rgyas dang bcas bde mnyam 'bras ster lus ngag yid dang chags pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni sangs rgyas dang bcas bde mnyam 'bras ster lus ngag yid dang chags pa ste //
translated: The Buddha-field is the Buddha together with the field of the result of the same bliss, body, speech, mind, and attachment.

original: 'di dag nyams par byas nas sdig pa'i blo can gyis ni gtso bo gzhan ma tshol bar byed //
analyzed: 'di dag nyams par byas nas sdig pa'i blo can gyis ni gtso bo gzhan ma tshol bar byed //
translated: Having destroyed these, the sinful-minded one does not seek another principal one.

original: zhing dang lam du 'jug dogs yul gzhan brtul zhugs nges pa brgya dang smyung ba ri rtser mchong /
analyzed: zhing dang lam du 'jug dogs yul gzhan brtul zhugs nges pa brgya dang smyung ba ri rtser mchong /
translated: The field, the path, the fear of entering, the vow of another country, the hundred vows, fasting, jumping from the peak of a mountain,

original: g-yul dang nyi ma gzas zin yul gyi bde ba la dga' du ma'i mtshon mer 'jug pas so //
analyzed: g-yul dang nyi ma gzas zin yul gyi bde ba la dga' du ma'i mtshon mer 'jug pas so //
translated: battle, the eclipse of the sun, the joy of the bliss of the country, the many weapons, the fire.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na 'di dag la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po rnams gang yin pa de bdud kyis bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po rnams gang yin pa de bdud kyis bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, all these things that have the nature of suffering are taught by Māra.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ma yin par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ma yin par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavān Buddha has taught that they are not.

original: 'di dag ma lus bdud kyis sngon dus khrag ni btung ba'i ched du brjod /
analyzed: 'di dag ma lus bdud kyis sngon dus khrag ni btung ba'i ched du brjod /
translated: All of these are taught by Māra in order to drink the blood of sentient beings in the future.

original: mtho ris 'jug dogs smyung ba dang ni g-yul du bcom nas 'chi bar gyur pa dang / ba lang nyi ma mthar phyin khyim nor yul dang bram ze'i ched du shi pas so //
analyzed: mtho ris 'jug dogs smyung ba dang ni g-yul du bcom nas 'chi bar gyur pa dang / ba lang nyi ma mthar phyin khyim nor yul dang bram ze'i ched du shi pas so //
translated: Through fasting, through being killed in battle, through dying while trying to reach the sun, through dying for the sake of a home, wealth, country, or a brahmin.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir bdud rnams kyi sprul pas bzung nas mi rnams la nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir lam gyi ngogs su smyung bas shi bar gyur pa'i mi ni mtho ris su gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir bdud rnams kyi sprul pas bzung nas mi rnams la nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i phyir lam gyi ngogs su smyung bas shi bar gyur pa'i mi ni mtho ris su gyur te /
translated: Here, through being seized by the emanations of Māras, people generate afflictions. Those who die through fasting on the banks of the path go to a high rebirth.

original: de bzhin du g-yul dang mtshon cha rnams kyis 'chi ba dang / ba lang nyi ma bsrung ba'i phyir dang / khyim dang nor gyi phyogs dang / bram ze rnams kyi bya bas 'chi bar gyur na mtho ris kyi 'gro bar bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yul dang mtshon cha rnams kyis 'chi ba dang / ba lang nyi ma bsrung ba'i phyir dang / khyim dang nor gyi phyogs dang / bram ze rnams kyi bya bas 'chi bar gyur na mtho ris kyi 'gro bar bstan to //
translated: Likewise, if one dies in battle or by weapons, or if one dies for the sake of protecting a cow or the sun, or for the sake of one’s home or wealth, or for the sake of the duties of a brahmin, one is taught to go to heaven.🔽Therefore, knowing that the words of Māra destroy this life and future lives, one should protect one’s own body and the bodies of others in every way as the basis for the supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de bas na skye ba 'di dang skye ba phyi ma'i don nyams par byed pa'i bdud kyi tshig rnams su shes nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rten du gyur pa'i rang gi lus po dang / gzhan gyi lus ni rnam pa thams cad du bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba 'di dang skye ba phyi ma'i don nyams par byed pa'i bdud kyi tshig rnams su shes nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rten du gyur pa'i rang gi lus po dang / gzhan gyi lus ni rnam pa thams cad du bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should protect one’s own body and the bodies of others

original: de bas bde mnyam gnas 'dir gyur pa yi //🔽rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi bsrung bar bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas bde mnyam gnas 'dir gyur pa yi // rang gi lus dang gzhan gyi bsrung bar bya'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in this state of the bliss of equality.

original: gzhan yang sngags kyi theg pa la zhugs nas gang gis @197b phrag dog mi 'dor ba de la dam tshig nyams par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngags kyi theg pa la zhugs nas gang gis @197b phrag dog mi 'dor ba de la dam tshig nyams par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, for one who has entered the mantra vehicle but does not abandon jealousy, it is taught that the commitments are destroyed.

original: gang zhig rgyal ba'i mchog spyod pa dang rgyud rgyal thos shing dbang ni thob par gyur nas kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyal ba'i mchog spyod pa dang rgyud rgyal thos shing dbang ni thob par gyur nas kyang //
translated: But if someone, having heard the conduct of the Victorious Ones and the tantras of the Victorious Ones, and having received initiation,

original: slar yang phrag dog byed na dmyal ba brgyud kyi bar nyid der ni 'jug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang phrag dog byed na dmyal ba brgyud kyi bar nyid der ni 'jug par gyur pa'o //
translated: should later on be jealous, he will enter into the hells, and will remain there until the end of the world.

original: dmyal ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmyal ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the hells like?

original: gang du khab rtse'i sa gzhir mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams ni kun spyod byed //
analyzed: gang du khab rtse'i sa gzhir mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams ni kun spyod byed //
translated: There, by the power of the result of non-virtue, the hells are experienced on the surface of a needle.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de phyir mi rnams sems la phrag dog yod pa'i bar du dbang ni blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir mi rnams sems la phrag dog yod pa'i bar du dbang ni blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, until one is free of jealousy, one should not receive initiation.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang la phrag dog yod pa de la chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la phrag dog yod pa de la chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Where there is jealousy, all the afflictions such as attachment arise.

original: de bas phrag dog gcig pu'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nyams par gyur par shes nas 'bad pas phrag dog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas phrag dog gcig pu'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nyams par gyur par shes nas 'bad pas phrag dog dor bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, knowing that for the sake of jealousy alone all the roots of virtue are destroyed, one should strive to abandon jealousy.

original: de nas gal te phrag dog dor bar mi nus pa de lta na ni //
analyzed: de nas gal te phrag dog dor bar mi nus pa de lta na ni //
translated: Then, if one is unable to abandon jealousy,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i bla na med pa'i dbang rnams blang bar mi bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o //🔽'o na gal te phrag dog gi dbang gis mnar med par 'gro bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i bla na med pa'i dbang rnams blang bar mi bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nges pa'o // 'o na gal te phrag dog gi dbang gis mnar med par 'gro bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: The Blessed One has declared that one should not receive the unsurpassed initiations of the vase, etc.

original: phrag dog dor nas de nyid sbyin bas don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: phrag dog dor nas de nyid sbyin bas don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: But if, through the power of envy, one goes to Avīci Hell, then what is the point of giving, after abandoning envy?🔽The Victorious Ones are born from the perfection of generosity and morality, and from the perfection of patience and effort,

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims rab rdzogs rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la bzod dang brtson 'grus rab rdzogs dang // bsam gtan shes rab thabs dang smon lam stobs dang ye shes de rdzogs shing //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims rab rdzogs rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la bzod dang brtson 'grus rab rdzogs dang // bsam gtan shes rab thabs dang smon lam stobs dang ye shes de rdzogs shing //
translated: and from the perfection of meditation, wisdom, method, aspiration, power, and knowledge.

original: rnal 'byor dga' ba'i sems kyis khyim thab myur du byin pas skye ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dga' ba'i sems kyis khyim thab myur du byin pas skye ba 'di la'o //
translated: Through the mind of delight in yoga, quickly giving one’s husband, in this life.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the verse.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang gis sems dga' bar byas nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang gis sems dga' bar byas nas /
translated: Through which yoga, having delighted the mind,

original: gal te khyim thab bla ma la sogs pa rnams la 'bul bar byed pa de lta na ni sbyin pa des sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim thab bla ma la sogs pa rnams la 'bul bar byed pa de lta na ni sbyin pa des sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one offers one's wife, teacher, etc., by that giving one will complete the ten perfections of giving, etc.

original: de ltar yon tan shes nas gang gis chags par byed pa de sngon du brjod pa bzhin du dmyal bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan shes nas gang gis chags par byed pa de sngon du brjod pa bzhin du dmyal bar 'gro ste /
translated: Knowing the virtues in that way, whoever is attached to them goes to hell as previously stated.

original: rgyu de'i phyir mi gang gis phrag dog byed pa des rang gi don nyams par byed pa'i phyir bdud kyis zin pa dang rmongs par gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir mi gang gis phrag dog byed pa des rang gi don nyams par byed pa'i phyir bdud kyis zin pa dang rmongs par gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, one should know that the person who is jealous is possessed by Mara and has become confused, because he has lost his own aim.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang las dang po pa rnams kyi rang gi skyon brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang las dang po pa rnams kyi rang gi skyon brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, the Lord has stated the faults of beginners:🔽The beginner should not live in a place where there is no temple, etc.

original: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di las dang po pas gnas kyi nges pa dang gnas kyi nges pa ma shes par gal te @198a * //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di las dang po pas gnas kyi nges pa dang gnas kyi nges pa ma shes par gal te @198a * //
translated: Here, the beginner, not knowing the certainty of the place and the certainty of the person, should not live in a place where there is no temple, etc.

original: sngags la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de lta na ni cho gas dman par gyur pa'i phyir de rnams don grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de lta na ni cho gas dman par gyur pa'i phyir de rnams don grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one practices mantra and so on, then because of the inferiority of the rite, those will not accomplish the goal.

original: de la don mi 'grub pa'i rgyu ni rang gi nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de la don mi 'grub pa'i rgyu ni rang gi nges pa yin te /
translated: The cause of not accomplishing the goal is one’s own lack of confidence,

original: sngags rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: not the mantras.

original: dper na rgyal srid thob par bya ba'i phyir g-yul gyi dus su dgra la sogs pa mthong nas mi gang zhig la rang gi lag pa nas ral gri lhung bar 'gyur te /🔽de la sems 'jigs par gyur pa'i dbang gis lag pa'i skyon yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na rgyal srid thob par bya ba'i phyir g-yul gyi dus su dgra la sogs pa mthong nas mi gang zhig la rang gi lag pa nas ral gri lhung bar 'gyur te / de la sems 'jigs par gyur pa'i dbang gis lag pa'i skyon yin gyi /
translated: For example, in order to attain a kingdom, when one sees enemies and so on in the time of battle, a man’s sword may fall from his hand.

original: ral gri'i skyon ma yin pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i skyon ma yin pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the fault is in the hand, not in the sword, because of the fear in the mind.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i phan tshun du mtshan nyid la sogs par shes nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i phan tshun du mtshan nyid la sogs par shes nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the yogi, knowing the characteristics of the mutual cause and effect, accomplishes mundane and supramundane powers just as they are taught.

original: sngags dang dpa' bo'i rim gyis kyang ni lha min gdengs ka lha rnams drag po'i sar bsgrub bya /
analyzed: sngags dang dpa' bo'i rim gyis kyang ni lha min gdengs ka lha rnams drag po'i sar bsgrub bya /
translated: And also by the means of the mantra and hero stages, the gods and demigods are accomplished in the fierce abode.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: dur khrod la sogs pa'i sa la'o //
analyzed: dur khrod la sogs pa'i sa la'o //
translated: In the places such as charnel grounds and so forth.

original: bdag byin brlabs pas lha mo dam tshig rigs gnas bsam gtan bzlas dang sbyin sreg gis //
analyzed: bdag byin brlabs pas lha mo dam tshig rigs gnas bsam gtan bzlas dang sbyin sreg gis //
translated: By means of self-consecration, the goddesses are accomplished by means of the pledges, families, meditative concentration, recitation, and burnt offerings.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is saying:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i gnas dang rnam pa gnyis kyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dam tshig la sogs pa rnams kyis zhi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lha mo rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par mdzad pa'i gnas dang rnam pa gnyis kyis rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dam tshig la sogs pa rnams kyis zhi ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lha mo rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the two places that are blessed by the buddhas and bodhisattvas, the goddesses who are of the nature of peace are accomplished by means of the natural pledges and so forth.

original: de bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i rim pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i rim pa dang rgyun mi 'chad par bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, by means of the stage of purity and the mind that is of the nature of uninterrupted great bliss, the supramundane gnosis of the nondual initiation is accomplished.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes des sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gyi rim pa ste /🔽de bas ye shes yid bzhin nor ltar gang 'gyur rgyal ba'i lam ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes des sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i lam gyi rim pa ste / de bas ye shes yid bzhin nor ltar gang 'gyur rgyal ba'i lam ni 'di nyid do //
translated: That nondual intuition, which is like a wish-fulfilling gem, is the path for achieving the state of Mahamudra, the sovereignty of the twelve stages.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the path of the Victor, the intuition which is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: da ni thabs dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la las kyi phyag rgya'i dgos pa bstan par mdzad de //
analyzed: da ni thabs dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la las kyi phyag rgya'i dgos pa bstan par mdzad de //
translated: Now, for the yogis who are endowed with the means, he teaches the necessity of the karmamudra.

original: dngul chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dpe bstan to //
analyzed: dngul chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dpe bstan to //
translated: The two verses beginning with “mercury” teach the example.

original: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i gnas kyi nges pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i gnas kyi nges pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Similarly, he teaches the necessity of the place for achieving the mundane siddhis, such as pacification, which were mentioned previously.

original: skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba @198b la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal zhes bya ba @198b la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “park” teach that.

original: 'o na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba gang du bsgrub par bgyi zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba gang du bsgrub par bgyi zhe na /
translated: Now, where is the supreme, unchanging bliss to be achieved?

original: phyag rgya kun la rab sbyor bar //
analyzed: phyag rgya kun la rab sbyor bar //
translated: One should apply it to all seals.🔽

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should practice in all the seals.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas gnas la sogs pa'i nges pa ma shes par sgrub par byed na skye ba grangs med pa rnams kyis kyang dngos grub bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas gnas la sogs pa'i nges pa ma shes par sgrub par byed na skye ba grangs med pa rnams kyis kyang dngos grub bsgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one practices without knowing the certainty of the site, etc., as it is explained, one will not attain power even in countless lives.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches just that:

original: khyim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gdan la sogs pa dor nas gnas dang mi mthun pa'i khyim la sogs par gang gi ji lta ba bzhin du bzlas pa la sogs pa byed pa de la nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: khyim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gdan la sogs pa dor nas gnas dang mi mthun pa'i khyim la sogs par gang gi ji lta ba bzhin du bzlas pa la sogs pa byed pa de la nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig skyed par byed de /
translated: Here, having abandoned the seat, etc., in a house, etc., which is not in accord with the site, whoever performs the recitation, etc., just as it is, he generates only afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: gnas dang dus tshod la sogs pa ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang dus tshod la sogs pa ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not know the site, the time, etc.

original: dper na rkang ba'i sor mo rnams la nad byung ba mgo la sman byed pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rkang ba'i sor mo rnams la nad byung ba mgo la sman byed pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it like this: for example, it is like applying medicine to the head for a disease in the toes.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa la gnas la sogs pa la dgos par gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa la gnas pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa la gnas la sogs pa la dgos par gsungs pa ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub pa la gnas pa dang bsam gtan la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Just as it is said that for the achievement of the powers of the meditative stabilizations of the creation stage, one needs a place and so forth, what are the meditative stabilizations, places, and so forth for the achievement of the power of the Great Seal?

original: bsam gtan med ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub ba la bsam gtan la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: bsam gtan med ces bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub ba la bsam gtan la sogs pa med de /
translated: As for no meditative stabilization, there is no meditative stabilization and so forth for the achievement of the power of the Great Seal.

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba'i phyir dang med pa'i dngos po las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba'i phyir dang med pa'i dngos po las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from space, it is self-arisen, and because it is accomplished from a nonexistent entity.

original: de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems las ma gtogs par gzhan ma gang gis kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems las ma gtogs par gzhan ma gang gis kyang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, except for one's own mind, which is the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, the power of the Great Seal is not accomplished by anything else.

original: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: 'dir shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su sems rang bzhin med pa dang / rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su bag chags las ma 'das pa dang sad pa'i gnas skabs su gzung 'dzin gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su sems rang bzhin med pa dang / rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su bag chags las ma 'das pa dang sad pa'i gnas skabs su gzung 'dzin gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, in the state of deep sleep, the mind is devoid of intrinsic reality, and in the state of dreaming, it does not transcend latent impressions, and in the state of waking, it has the nature of subject and object.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang rang gi sems ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas na phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang rang gi sems ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas na phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub ster bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, by the nature of the emptiness of form and one's mind being of the same taste, the Great Seal bestows spiritual power.

original: da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la thun mongs dang por chang gis mchod pa'i rnam pa bstan par mdzad de aom a'a:zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la thun mongs dang por chang gis mchod pa'i rnam pa bstan par mdzad de aom a'a:zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Now, for the yogis, first of all, he presents the form of worship with alcohol, saying Oṃ āḥ.

original: sngon du brjod pa'i bdud rtsi bsgrub pa'i cho gas chang sbyang ba la sogs pa byas pa snod de las lag pa g-yon @199a * //
analyzed: sngon du brjod pa'i bdud rtsi bsgrub pa'i cho gas chang sbyang ba la sogs pa byas pa snod de las lag pa g-yon @199a * //
translated: Having purified the alcohol and so forth with the ritual of accomplishing nectar as previously described, one should take it with the left hand from that vessel.

original: pa'i ming med kyi sor mos chang gi thig le blangs nas mnyam par gyur pa'i sa la chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gru gsum pa byas te /
analyzed: pa'i ming med kyi sor mos chang gi thig le blangs nas mnyam par gyur pa'i sa la chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gru gsum pa byas te /
translated: Having taken up a drop of liquor with the nameless finger, one should make a triangle in the place of union, which is the nature of the source of phenomena.

original: de'i dbus su thig le'i gzugs bya'o //🔽de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas thig le'i dbus su bzhugs par bsams la lag pa g-yon pa'i ming med dang mthe bong gi chang gi snod nas thig le re re blangs nas yi dam lha nas brtsams nas lha dang lha mo'i tshogs thams cad
analyzed: de'i dbus su thig le'i gzugs bya'o // de nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs nas thig le'i dbus su bzhugs par bsams la lag pa g-yon pa'i ming med dang mthe bong gi chang gi snod nas thig le re re blangs nas yi dam lha nas brtsams nas lha dang lha mo'i tshogs thams cad
translated: In the middle of that, one should make the form of a drop.🔽Then, having invited the wheel of wisdom, one should imagine it residing in the middle of the drop.

original: la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Having taken up a drop from the vessel of liquor with the nameless finger and thumb of the left hand, one should make offerings to all the hosts of gods and goddesses, beginning with the pledged deity.

original: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas zhing skyong la sogs pa'i gtor ma dang bza' ba'i dus su cho ga bya ba thams cad ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas zhing skyong la sogs pa'i gtor ma dang bza' ba'i dus su cho ga bya ba thams cad ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the same way, all the rites of offering to the field protectors and so forth, as previously described, are to be performed at the time of eating.

original: da ni dbang po rtul po dang dbang po mchog tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha bsgom pa'i nges pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni dbang po rtul po dang dbang po mchog tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha bsgom pa'i nges pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, in order to teach the certainty of deity meditation for yogis of dull and sharp faculties, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for direct perception, and so forth,

original: 'dir skye ba snga mar mi rnams kyis nyin mtshan du stong pa nyid bsgom par bya pa'i mi de rnams la sngon gyi stong pa nyid kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la sems skye bar 'gyur te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye
analyzed: 'dir skye ba snga mar mi rnams kyis nyin mtshan du stong pa nyid bsgom par bya pa'i mi de rnams la sngon gyi stong pa nyid kyi bag chags kyi stobs kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub la sems skye bar 'gyur te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye
translated: here, for those people who meditate on emptiness day and night in a previous life, the mind arises for the mahāmudrā siddhi by the power of the latent tendencies of previous emptiness.

original: shes kyang bsgom par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes kyang bsgom par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is also asserted that nonconceptual gnosis is cultivated.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs des dang por shal sogs pa'i mig rnams kyis dus gsum du sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du srid pa gsum du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs des dang por shal sogs pa'i mig rnams kyis dus gsum du sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du srid pa gsum du mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of that cultivation, first, with eyes wide open, one sees the three existences like an illusion and a dream with the eyes of the three times.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems so sor spong ba la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhis ni nam mkha' la brtan por byas nas phyag rgya'i sbyor bas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas skad cig bsgrub par bya ste
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems so sor spong ba la sogs pa'i yan lag bzhis ni nam mkha' la brtan por byas nas phyag rgya'i sbyor bas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas skad cig bsgrub par bya ste
translated: Thus, one's mind, which has become the nature of the form of emptiness, is stabilized in space by the four branches of the elimination of isolation, and so on, and the supreme, unchanging bliss is accomplished in an instant by the yoga of the consort.

original: / des na rang bzhin gyis rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub ni rnal 'byor pas mngon sum du byed par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / des na rang bzhin gyis rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub ni rnal 'byor pas mngon sum du byed par gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogin directly perceives the Great Seal, which is the nature of the four results, the natural outflow, and so forth.

original: 'o na dbang po rtul por gyur pa rnams kyis bris sku la sogs pa la dmigs pa byas nas lkog tu gyur pa'i yi dam gyi lha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par spros par mi nus pa'i dbang du
analyzed: 'o na dbang po rtul por gyur pa rnams kyis bris sku la sogs pa la dmigs pa byas nas lkog tu gyur pa'i yi dam gyi lha'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i rang gi sems kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par spros par mi nus pa'i dbang du
translated: Now, those of dull faculties, having made an image, and so forth, their object, are unable to emanate the mandala wheel of their own mind, which is the nature of the hidden deity.

original: byas pa thams cad bor nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byas pa thams cad bor nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should meditate, having abandoned all that.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam @199b gyi rim pa gang yin pa de rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo las ma gtogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu gsal bar ma mdzad de
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam @199b gyi rim pa gang yin pa de rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo las ma gtogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis shin tu gsal bar ma mdzad de
translated: By this process, the stages of the supreme, unchanging, supramundane path are not clearly taught by the Bhagavān anywhere other than in the King of Tantras, the Bhagavān Kālacakra.

original: / de bas na gal te bsod nams kyis dbang gis bla ma dam pa'i zhal las rnyed par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: / de bas na gal te bsod nams kyis dbang gis bla ma dam pa'i zhal las rnyed par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Therefore, if one obtains it from the mouth of a holy guru through the power of merit,

original: rnal 'byor dbang pos phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir nyin mtshan du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang pos phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir nyin mtshan du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: then the lord of yogins should meditate day and night in order to attain the power of the Great Seal.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las sgrub thabs kyi le'u'i 'grel bshad padma can gyi mdor bsdus pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las sgrub thabs kyi le'u'i 'grel bshad padma can gyi mdor bsdus pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on the method of achieving the glorious Wheel of Time, the king of tantras, in the concise explanation of the Lotus Crown.

original: // / de ltar bsgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin la de nyid bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba gdab par mdzad de /
analyzed: // / de ltar bsgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes yin la de nyid bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba gdab par mdzad de /
translated: The preliminary for such achievement is nondual wisdom, and in order to teach just that, the Blessed Vajrapāṇi makes a request:

original: cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo lha dang lha mo dang lhan cig tu bsgrub pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bka' stsal pa de bdag gis cung zad smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo lha dang lha mo dang lhan cig tu bsgrub pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bka' stsal pa de bdag gis cung zad smra bar bya'o //
translated: Here, I will explain a little of what the Blessed One, the Wheel of Time, has taught in the context of the achievement of the deities and goddesses.

original: da ni nang gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji lta bu yin pa nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: da ni nang gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji lta bu yin pa nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: Now, the request is: “I wish to hear what the inner maṇḍala is like, etc.”

original: gsol ba btab pa'i tshig de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas nang gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bstan par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa'i tshig de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsan nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas nang gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bstan par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Having heard that request, the Blessed One, in the sequence of the explanation, teaches the inner maṇḍala, etc., and the nondual wisdom.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi sgo de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi sgo de nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad de /
translated: By that very door of supreme unchanging wisdom, the bodhisattva Lokanātha pays homage to the Blessed One, who is of the nature of nondual wisdom.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston pa gcig pu de la 'dud ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ston pa gcig pu de la 'dud ces bya ba'o //
translated: He bows to that sole teacher with “That which,” etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i bdud bzhi 'dul bar mdzad pas na ston pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i bdud bzhi 'dul bar mdzad pas na ston pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher because he subdues the four māras of the aggregates, etc.

original: yang na rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par mdzad pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par mdzad pas na ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, he is the Teacher because he teaches the nature of all things, both animate and inanimate.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: gang gis rang gi rdo rje las ni yid 'byung bkug nas nyid kyi dpral bar khrid //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi rdo rje las ni yid 'byung bkug nas nyid kyi dpral bar khrid // ces bya ba ni /
translated: By which he drew out his mind from his vajra and led it to his forehead.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis nyid kyis gsang ba'i rdo rje las yid las skyes par gyur pa'i 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams ni nyid kyi dpral bar khrid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis nyid kyis gsang ba'i rdo rje las yid las skyes par gyur pa'i 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams ni nyid kyi dpral bar khrid ces bya ba'o //
translated: By which the Lord drew out the drops of the mind-born, which are of the nature of passion, from his secret vajra and led them to his forehead.

original: ji ltar khrid ce na /🔽shes rab ye shes @200a * //
analyzed: ji ltar khrid ce na / shes rab ye shes @200a * //
translated: How did he lead them?🔽By the power of the wisdom intuition.

original: stobs kyis zhes bya ba la shes rab ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: stobs kyis zhes bya ba la shes rab ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: Wisdom is emptiness endowed with all supreme aspects.

original: de nyid ye shes yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ye shes yin te /
translated: That itself is intuition,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa shes par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa shes par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the knowledge of the naturelessness of all things.

original: de ltar gang gis khrid ce na sh'akya thub pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang gis khrid ce na sh'akya thub pas zhes bya'o //
translated: By Shakyamuni.

original: dpral ba nas gang khrid ce na /
analyzed: dpral ba nas gang khrid ce na /
translated: Where is it led?

original: rdo rje gtsug tor chen po der //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje gtsug tor chen po der // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To the great vajra ushnisha.

original: 'og tu gnas pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje ni gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo spro bar mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'og tu gnas pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje ni gtsug tor gyi 'khor lo spro bar mdzad nas /
translated: The secret vajra located below emits the wheel of the ushnisha,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le der 'dzin par mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le der 'dzin par mdzad de /
translated: and the drop of bodhicitta is held there.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la med par gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la med par gyur ba'i phyir chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called great because it does not exist for bodhisattvas and so on.

original: yang na bde ba chen po'i skad cig nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas gang bar gyur pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: yang na bde ba chen po'i skad cig nyi khri chig stong drug brgyas gang bar gyur pas na chen po'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is great because it is filled with twenty-one thousand moments of great bliss.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das de nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /🔽gang la dmigs pa dang bcas rdul med stong pa nyid dang snying rje bzang po dmigs med pa //
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das de nyid ji ltar yin zhe na / gang la dmigs pa dang bcas rdul med stong pa nyid dang snying rje bzang po dmigs med pa //
translated: Moreover, what is the Bhagavat himself like?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He who is endowed with an object, the good emptiness and compassion free of dust, and without an object.

original: gang la stong pa nyid dang snying rje yod pa des de ltar mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la stong pa nyid dang snying rje yod pa des de ltar mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: Whoever has emptiness and compassion does this,

original: gzhan ma rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not others.

original: stong pa nyid kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is emptiness like?

original: dmigs bcas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs bcas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be “with reference point,”

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams la spyod yul du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rnams la spyod yul du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is the domain of experience of the eye faculty and so forth.

original: rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a nature that is completely nonexistent.

original: 'o na gal te med pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te med pa'i rang bzhin du ma yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: If it is not a nature of nonexistence, then is it not a nature of existence?

original: yod pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ram zhe na rdul med ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ram zhe na rdul med ces bya ba ni rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i phyir yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said to be “without particles,” because it is beyond the most subtle particles, it is not existent.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su dngos po gang yin pa de med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su dngos po gang yin pa de med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, in the context of a dream, whatever things there are are not nonexistent,

original: mngon sum du nyams su myong bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du nyams su myong bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are experienced directly.

original: yod pa yang ma yin te bskyed bya skyed byed dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin te bskyed bya skyed byed dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i 'brel pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not existent because it is beyond the relationship of the produced and the producer and the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi gzugs ni rnal 'byor bas mig gi dbang pos mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi gzugs ni rnal 'byor bas mig gi dbang pos mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir med pa ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the form of emptiness is not nonexistent because it is directly perceived by the eye faculty of the yogi.

original: sa chu me rlung la sogs pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung la sogs pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not existent because it is not produced from earth, water, fire, wind, and so on.

original: snying rje yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is compassion like?

original: dmigs med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmigs med ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be nonconceptual.

original: bya ba'am rgyu thams cad kyi bde ba myong bar byed pas na snying rje'o //
analyzed: bya ba'am rgyu thams cad kyi bde ba myong bar byed pas na snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the experience of the bliss of all activities or causes.

original: 'o na snying rje bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur @200b pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na snying rje bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur @200b pa de lta na ni /
translated: If compassion has the nature of bliss,

original: rtog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: rtog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: then is it not conceptual?

original: dmigs med ces bya ba ni rtog pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs med ces bya ba ni rtog pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin la /
translated: It is said to be nonconceptual because it is not produced from concepts.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of nonconceptuality.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: 'dir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de gzugs sna tshogs las skyes pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba gang yin pa de gzugs sna tshogs las skyes pa ste ;
translated: Here, whatever is supreme unchanging bliss is born from various forms.

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyang stong pa nyid las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyang stong pa nyid las skyes pa'o //
translated: And various forms are born from emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyang rgyu gang las kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang rgyu gang las kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bar grub pa'o //
translated: And since emptiness is not born from any cause, it is established as the so-called non-conceptual supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: Similarly, in the root tantra of Śrī Heruka it is said:

original: stong nyid dpag bsam ljon shing las //
analyzed: stong nyid dpag bsam ljon shing las //
translated: From the wish-fulfilling tree of emptiness

original: dmigs med snying rje 'dras bur 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs med snying rje 'dras bur 'gyur //
translated: the fruit of non-apprehending compassion grows.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs dgongs ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs dgongs ni //
translated: The enlightened mind of all the buddhas

original: 'grub 'gyur 'di ru the tshom med //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur 'di ru the tshom med //
translated: is accomplished here, there is no doubt.

original: cas bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: cas bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: This is what the Bhagavān has said.

original: rgyu de'i phyir lha mi lha min klu'i bla ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir lha mi lha min klu'i bla ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For that reason, the so-called “guru of gods, humans, demigods, and nāgas”

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan rnams kyis lci bar gyur pas na bla ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan rnams kyis lci bar gyur pas na bla ma yin la /
translated: is a guru because he is heavy with mundane and supramundane qualities.

original: de nyid lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi bla mar 'os pa dang mchod par 'os pa dang bkur bar 'os pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi bla mar 'os pa dang mchod par 'os pa dang bkur bar 'os pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is worthy of the worship of all sentient beings, such as gods, and is worthy of the worship of all sentient beings, such as gods.

original: de lta bu sna tshogs gtso bor ston pa gang yin pa de la bdag gis phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu sna tshogs gtso bor ston pa gang yin pa de la bdag gis phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I pay homage to that one who teaches such a variety of things.

original: yon tan de dag dang ldan par gyur pa'i ston pa gcig pu de mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan de dag dang ldan par gyur pa'i ston pa gcig pu de mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of that one teacher who possesses those qualities?

original: rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa yi //
translated: He is without cause and without characteristics.

original: g-yo med rim pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: g-yo med rim pa de bzhin te //
translated: He is without deceit and is of that nature.

original: dus kyi 'khor lor mngon brjod pa //
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lor mngon brjod pa //
translated: He is the Wheel of Time, as expressed in the tantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: de bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i mtshan mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: the expression of the name of that Bhagavān Kālacakra.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo yang gang la brjod ce na /
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo yang gang la brjod ce na /
translated: What is the Wheel of Time that is being referred to?

original: rgyu dang mtshan nyid nyid med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang mtshan nyid nyid med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is without cause and without characteristics.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi yin la 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi yin la 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause is that of the mundane aggregates, etc.

original: de rnams gang la med de rgyu med pa'o //🔽de bzhin du sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dngos po las 'das par gyur pas na /
analyzed: de rnams gang la med de rgyu med pa'o // de bzhin du sra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi dngos po las 'das par gyur pas na /
translated: The wandering in cyclic existence is that of those who do not have that cause.🔽Similarly, since it transcends the nature of solidity, etc.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and transcends the nature of pleasure and pain, it is said to be without characteristics.

original: 'o na rgyu dang mtshan nyid ni sems can rnams shin tu gnyid logs pa'i gnas skabs su med par 'gyur te /🔽de med pa'i phyir sems can thams cad dus kyi 'khor lo @201a * //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu dang mtshan nyid ni sems can rnams shin tu gnyid logs pa'i gnas skabs su med par 'gyur te / de med pa'i phyir sems can thams cad dus kyi 'khor lo @201a * //
translated: Well, the cause and characteristics of sentient beings would not exist in the state of deep sleep,🔽because of the absence of those.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would all sentient beings not be the wheel of time?

original: g-yo med ces bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: g-yo med ces bya bar gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is unmoving.

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Here, the cause and characteristics of sentient beings

original: shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su yin gyi /
analyzed: shin tu gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su yin gyi /
translated: are in the state of deep sleep,

original: sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the state of being awake, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa ni dus thams cad du yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid med pa ni dus thams cad du yin gyi /
translated: The Blessed One's cause and characteristic are at all times,

original: dus kha cig gi bar du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kha cig gi bar du ni ma yin no //
translated: and not for a certain period of time.

original: de bas na nyi khri chig stong drug brgya 'gags pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa thugs brtan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyi khri chig stong drug brgya 'gags pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa thugs brtan par gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the cessation of the twenty-one thousand six hundred, he is said to be unshakable, with a firm mind.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams la byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhir rim pa bzhir gyur pa'i ji lta ba de bzhin du gang la med pa de rim pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams la byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhir rim pa bzhir gyur pa'i ji lta ba de bzhin du gang la med pa de rim pa med pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, in sentient beings, in the four stages of childhood and so on, there are four stages. In whom that does not exist, there is no stage.

original: yang na sems can thams cad la dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas bde ba skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du gang la med pa de rim pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad la dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas bde ba skye ba ji lta ba de bzhin du gang la med pa de rim pa med pa ste /
translated: Or, just as pleasure arises in all sentient beings through the distinctions of joy and so on, in whom that does not exist, there is no stage.

original: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because he is always of the nature of supreme, unchanging, innate joy alone, he is said to be without stage.

original: rgyu de'i phyir gnyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir gnyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For that reason, he is said to be two.

original: chags pa dang chags bral las 'das par gyur pas na de gnyis su med pa yin la /
analyzed: chags pa dang chags bral las 'das par gyur pas na de gnyis su med pa yin la /
translated: Since it transcends attachment and non-attachment, it is non-dual.

original: yang na stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur pas na gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur pas na gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, since it is the very essence of both emptiness and compassion, it is called non-dual.

original: dngos po de lta bu gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo yin gyi bum pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo yin gyi bum pa dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is such an entity is the Bhagavān Kālacakra, not a pot, a rabbit’s horns, and so on.

original: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo gang yin pa de nyid mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo gang yin pa de nyid mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: That very Bhagavān Kālacakra is the supreme primordial buddha.

original: ming gis dbye ba tsam gyis de nyid la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: ming gis dbye ba tsam gyis de nyid la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad de /
translated: He is merely distinguished by name, and so he is paid homage.

original: sprul dang longs spyod chos bzang dag pa ni //
analyzed: sprul dang longs spyod chos bzang dag pa ni //
translated: The emanation, the enjoyment, and the excellent Dharma are pure.

original: yi ge ka la sogs pas sku bzhi bor //🔽de bzhin gshegs pas gang la gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pas sku bzhi bor // de bzhin gshegs pas gang la gsungs pa yi //
translated: The four bodies are cast off by the syllables ka and so on.

original: rgyu med dang po'i sangs rgyas de la spyi bos 'dud //
analyzed: rgyu med dang po'i sangs rgyas de la spyi bos 'dud //
translated: I bow my head to that primordial buddha, the cause of the Tathāgata’s speech.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the homage.

original: bcom ldan 'das mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase Homage to the Blessed One, the primordial Buddha is the connection.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the Blessed One like?

original: sprul pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku bzhi'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sprul pa zhes bya ba ni sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku bzhi'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word emanation refers to the nature of the four bodies of the Buddha, beginning with the emanation body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku bzhi gang yin pa de rnams sems can phal pa rnams kyis ji @201b ltar shes she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku bzhi gang yin pa de rnams sems can phal pa rnams kyis ji @201b ltar shes she na /
translated: How do ordinary beings understand those four bodies of the Blessed One?

original: ka sogs kyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ka sogs kyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase by means of the syllables ka and so on

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa dang / yi ge ka la sogs pa rnams kyi brda'i tshig gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa dang / yi ge ka la sogs pa rnams kyi brda'i tshig gis shes par bya'o //
translated: refers to the understanding by means of the symbolic syllables, such as the syllable a and the syllable ka.

original: nges pa'i don du thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems dang rdul phan tshun du phye bar gyur na rnam ba bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ba'i byang chub kyi sems dang rdul phan tshun du phye bar gyur na rnam ba bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: In the definitive meaning, when the bodhicitta, which is the nature of method and wisdom, is divided into the particles of the male and female deities, it becomes fourfold.

original: bzhi po de 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bar gyur na sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bar gyur na sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When those four are free from the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence, they become the nature of the four bodies of the Buddha.

original: de gang gis gsungs she na /
analyzed: de gang gis gsungs she na /
translated: By whom was it taught?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Tathāgata,

original: dus gsum du bskor bar mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du bskor bar mdzad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: all the Tathāgatas who have turned the wheel of doctrine in the three times.

original: gang la gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang la gsungs she na /
translated: To whom was it taught?

original: gang zhig rgyu med dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu med dang po'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To those who are causeless, self-arisen Buddhas.

original: thabs kyi rgyu dang shes rab kyi rgyu la 'das par gyur bas na rgyu med pa yin la /
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyu dang shes rab kyi rgyu la 'das par gyur bas na rgyu med pa yin la /
translated: They are causeless because they transcend the cause of method and the cause of wisdom.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the embodiment of both.

original: de la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad nas ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad nas ci mdzad ce na /
translated: Having paid homage to them, what did he do?

original: dpal ldan ye shes le'u yi //
analyzed: dpal ldan ye shes le'u yi //
translated: The glorious chapter on wisdom

original: zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: he composed.

original: don gang gi phyir mdzad ce na /
analyzed: don gang gi phyir mdzad ce na /
translated: For what purpose did he compose it?

original: drang srong sems can thams cad la //
analyzed: drang srong sems can thams cad la //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings,

original: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob phyir //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes 'bras thob phyir //
translated: the sage, in order that they attain the fruit of merit and wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that he composed it in order to attain mundane and supramundane feats.

original: da ni phyi rol du drang ba'i don du dkyil 'khor gang gsungs pa de /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol du drang ba'i don du dkyil 'khor gang gsungs pa de /
translated: Now, in order to draw it externally, he explains that very maṇḍala

original: de nyid nang du lus po la sbyar bar mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid nang du lus po la sbyar bar mdzad de /
translated: applied to the body internally.

original: ka ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ka ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: With “the pillars” and so forth.

original: 'o na gal te dkyil 'khor de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dkyil 'khor de lta bu yin na /
translated: If that is the case, then if the maṇḍala is like that,

original: lha rnams kyi dag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: what is the purity of the deities?

original: sngon du rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sngon du rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “ The vajra” and so forth.

original: 'dir a'a li dang k'a li yongs su gyur pa las mtshan ma rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir a'a li dang k'a li yongs su gyur pa las mtshan ma rnams skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the signs arise from the transformation of the vowels and consonants.

original: de rnams las lha dang lha mo rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las lha dang lha mo rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: From those, the deities arise as the gods and goddesses.

original: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rigs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi rigs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the clan of the gods and goddesses?

original: sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sde zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “ The group” and so forth.

original: 'dir k'a la sogs pa'i sde drug pa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir k'a la sogs pa'i sde drug pa ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rigs so //
translated: Here, the six groups beginning with ka are the clans of the six tathāgatas, in due order, of Akṣobhya and so forth.

original: rigs drug po de las byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang lha mo rnams skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs drug po de las byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa dang lha mo rnams skyes pa'o //
translated: From those six families, the Bodhisattvas and so on, and the goddesses are born.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus par yi ge lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sde gcig ni rigs gcig tu bstan par mdzad de /🔽ka la sogs pa'i yi @202a * //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus par yi ge lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sde gcig ni rigs gcig tu bstan par mdzad de / ka la sogs pa'i yi @202a * //
translated: Thus, the one class that has become the nature of the five syllables is taught as one family.🔽From each of the syllables ka and so on,

original: ge re re las lha dang lha mo rnams ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ge re re las lha dang lha mo rnams ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how are the gods and goddesses born?

original: bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bstan par mdzad de /
translated: It is taught:

original: sum cu zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sum cu zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By thirty and so on.

original: 'dir yi ge ka ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams kyis phye bar gyur na yi ge sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te yi ge sum cu rtsa drug po de las lha dang lha mo rnams gang skyed pa de rnams kyi nang gi dag pa
analyzed: 'dir yi ge ka ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i dbyangs rnams kyis phye bar gyur na yi ge sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te yi ge sum cu rtsa drug po de las lha dang lha mo rnams gang skyed pa de rnams kyi nang gi dag pa
translated: Here, when the syllable ka is divided by the vowels such as a, it becomes thirty-six syllables. From those thirty-six syllables, the gods and goddesses are born.

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is their purity?

original: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir phung po las ma gtogs par phyi rol du lha dang lha mo rnams gang yang med de /
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir phung po las ma gtogs par phyi rol du lha dang lha mo rnams gang yang med de /
translated: The aggregates and so on. Here, apart from the aggregates, there are no external gods and goddesses.

original: de bas na phung po drug la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas lha dang lha mo sum cu rtsa drug tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phung po drug la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pas lha dang lha mo sum cu rtsa drug tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know the thirty-six gods and goddesses by the purification of the six aggregates and so forth.

original: 'o na lha dang lha mo de rnams kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lha dang lha mo de rnams kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the purification of the limbs of those gods and goddesses?

original: rdo rje rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhal la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhal la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: The limbs such as the faces and so forth are taught to be purified by the vajras and so forth.

original: 'o na dpa' bo gcig pu dang 'khor dang lhan cig tu lnga la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rim pa la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dpa' bo gcig pu dang 'khor dang lhan cig tu lnga la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rim pa la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the intention of the stages of becoming the nature of five and so forth, alone and together with the retinue?

original: sa bon gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sa bon gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The single seed and so forth.

original: 'dir nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems gcig pu gnas pa'i phyir yi dam gyi lha dpa' bo gcig pur bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir nang du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni byang chub sems gcig pu gnas pa'i phyir yi dam gyi lha dpa' bo gcig pur bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Here, the inner ālaya consciousness is the single bodhicitta, and therefore one should meditate on the deity of the commitment being as the single hero.

original: de nas rdul dang lhan cig tu sbyar bar gyur pa'i phyir phyi rol du thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdul dang lhan cig tu sbyar bar gyur pa'i phyir phyi rol du thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, because of being united with the drops, one should meditate externally as the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de dag las phung po la sogs pa rnams rim pas skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang lha mo rnams phyi rol du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las phung po la sogs pa rnams rim pas skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang lha mo rnams phyi rol du shes par bya'o //
translated: From those, the aggregates and so on should be known externally as the tathāgatas and so on and the goddesses, respectively, just as they arise in sequence.

original: lha dang lha mo de rnams nang gi gnas gang nas skye bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir lo bcu drug gi steng nas khams drug gi rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyi sems spro ba de bzhin du khams drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug
analyzed: lha dang lha mo de rnams nang gi gnas gang nas skye bar 'gyur zhe na / dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir lo bcu drug gi steng nas khams drug gi rang bzhin gyi mi rnams kyi sems spro ba de bzhin du khams drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo drug
translated: From which inner location do those gods and goddesses arise?

original: las lha dang lha mo rnams skye bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las lha dang lha mo rnams skye bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Pure and so on. Here, just as the minds of humans, who are of the nature of the six elements, expand from the age of sixteen, one should understand that the gods and goddesses arise from the six cakras, such as the forehead and so on, which are free of obscuration and are of the nature of the six elements.

original: de ltar nang gi rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained inner purity and so on,
