original: rnal 'byor rnams la shas che bar gyur pa'i lha dang lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams la shas che bar gyur pa'i lha dang lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches the characteristics of the gods and goddesses that are predominant in the yogas.

original: phyogs 'dab la ni zhes bya ba la @202b sogs pas so //
analyzed: phyogs 'dab la ni zhes bya ba la @202b sogs pas so //
translated: In the petals of the directions, etc.

original: 'o na thabs rnams las shas che bar gyur pa'i thabs kyi rgyud rnams kyi lha dang lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thabs rnams las shas che bar gyur pa'i thabs kyi rgyud rnams kyi lha dang lha mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what are the characteristics of the gods and goddesses in the method tantras that are predominant among the methods?

original: snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence, etc.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i rgyud kyi rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, he teaches the characteristics of the mandala that is the nature of the supporting and supported in the condensed tantra.

original: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi lha dang lha mo rnams kyi dkyil 'khor bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: dpal 'khor lo sdom pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi lha dang lha mo rnams kyi dkyil 'khor bstan par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches the mandala of the gods and goddesses of the glorious Sri Heruka's Root Tantra.

original: thig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: thig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The line, etc.

original: 'dir 'khor lo sdom pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi gzhung gis thig dgu bcu rtsa drug btab nas 'khor lo drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'khor lo sdom pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi gzhung gis thig dgu bcu rtsa drug btab nas 'khor lo drug gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ste /
translated: Here, having laid out the ninety-six squares of the Cakrasaṃvara Root Tantra, one should draw the mandala that is the nature of the six wheels.

original: de nas a'a li dang k'a li'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lha mo rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas a'a li dang k'a li'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lha mo rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then one should arrange the goddesses that are the nature of the vowels and consonants.

original: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The ḍākinīs and so on teach the characteristics of the heroes and heroines.

original: phyi rol du de rnams kyi gnas gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol du de rnams kyi gnas gang yin zhe na /
translated: Where are their abodes externally?

original: ri rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ri rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Meru and so on.

original: phyi dang nang du lha rnams kyis kun du spyod pa ji ltar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: phyi dang nang du lha rnams kyis kun du spyod pa ji ltar mdzad ce na /
translated: How do the deities conduct themselves externally and internally?

original: lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goddesses and so on.

original: 'dir phyi rol du thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas lhag par byed pa la sogs pa ni lha mo rnams la ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du nang du srog gi kun du spyod pas sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du thun mtshams bzhi'i dbye bas lhag par byed pa la sogs pa ni lha mo rnams la ji ltar gyur pa de bzhin du nang du srog gi kun du spyod pas sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams las shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the external division into four sessions, the special ones, etc., should be understood from the internal conduct of the life-force in the maṇḍalas of earth, etc., just as they occur for the goddesses.

original: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i zhal la sogs pa rnam par dag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i zhal la sogs pa rnam par dag par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the purity of the face, etc. of the Bhagavān Heruka by the previously described process.

original: de nas gal te rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa las skyo bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de nas gal te rnal 'byor pas bsgom pa las skyo bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Then, if the yogī becomes weary of meditation,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to accomplish the rites of pacifying, etc.,

original: sngags bzlas pa'i cho ga bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa'i cho ga bstan par mdzad de /
translated: the procedure for mantra recitation is taught.

original: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one called wisdom and so forth.

original: 'dir phyi rol du dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams gang yin pa de rnams kyi nang gi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du dpa' bo dang dpa' mo rnams gang yin pa de rnams kyi nang gi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what are the external heroes and heroines, and what are their internal causes of generation?

original: gang zhig dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one called breath and so forth.

original: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha dang lha mo rnams kyi zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gyi dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of the moon and sun seats of the gods and goddesses?

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The verse begins, “The sun and moon, etc.”

original: 'dir nang gi rdul dang byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i srog dang thung sel lam ma gtogs par @203a * //
analyzed: 'dir nang gi rdul dang byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i srog dang thung sel lam ma gtogs par @203a * //
translated: Here, the sun and moon are not seats of the mind except in the sense that they are the nature of inner wind and bodhicitta.

original: sems kyi gnas su mi 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum gyi nyi ma dang zla ba las ma gtogs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu de'i phyir nyi ma'i sgra yis nang du rdul shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas su mi 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus gsum gyi nyi ma dang zla ba las ma gtogs par mi 'gyur ro // rgyu de'i phyir nyi ma'i sgra yis nang du rdul shes par bya zhing /
translated: In the same way, the sun and moon of the three times, past, future, and present, are not seats of the mind except in the sense that they are the nature of inner wind and bodhicitta.

original: zla ba'i sgra yis byang chub sems so //
analyzed: zla ba'i sgra yis byang chub sems so //
translated: For that reason, the word “sun” should be understood to refer to the inner wind, and the word “moon” should be understood to refer to bodhicitta.

original: de nyid phan tshun du ltos pa'i dbang gis thabs dang shes rab rnams la nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid phan tshun du ltos pa'i dbang gis thabs dang shes rab rnams la nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Those two are the seats of the sun and moon of method and wisdom, respectively, in the sense that they are mutually dependent.

original: de bzhin du 'khor lo sdom pa'i gdan rnams kyi nges pa ni zla ba'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga dang nyi ma'i rkang pa bcu gcig bsres nas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor lo sdom pa'i gdan rnams kyi nges pa ni zla ba'i rkang pa nyi shu rtsa lnga dang nyi ma'i rkang pa bcu gcig bsres nas sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the certainty of the seats of Cakrasaṃvara is that twenty-five parts of the moon and eleven parts of the sun are mixed, making thirty-six.

original: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan la ro rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i phyir zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan la ro rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of their purity, the seats of the moon and sun are called the seats of the corpses.

original: bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i gdan ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das he ru ka'i gdan ni /
translated: The seat of Bhagavat Heruka

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i phyir zla ba'i gdan nam yang na rdul dag pa'i phyir ni nyi ma'i gdan nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam par dag pa'i phyir zla ba'i gdan nam yang na rdul dag pa'i phyir ni nyi ma'i gdan nas /
translated: is the seat of the moon because of the purity of bodhicitta, or it is the seat of the sun because of the purity of the drops.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis kar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis kar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is both the moon and the sun.

original: de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal gyi rnam par dag pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lha rnams kyi zhal gyi rnam par dag pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Likewise, what is the purity of the faces of the deities who are the nature of Vāyu and so on?

original: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Vāyu and so on.

original: 'dir sa la sogs pa rnams kyi dri la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams su 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha rnams kyi zhal gyi dbye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sa la sogs pa rnams kyi dri la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams su 'gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha rnams kyi zhal gyi dbye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as the qualities of smell and so forth of earth and so forth are transformed, so too the faces of the deities should be understood.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol du thun mtshams la sogs pa'i dbye bas zhal la sogs pa'i dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol du thun mtshams la sogs pa'i dbye bas zhal la sogs pa'i dag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, externally, the purity of the faces and so forth is by way of the divisions of the periods of the day and so forth.

original: de bzhin du me'i rigs las skyes par gyur pa'i lha rnams la chu'i rigs las skyes par gyur pa'i phyag rgya rnams yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du me'i rigs las skyes par gyur pa'i lha rnams la chu'i rigs las skyes par gyur pa'i phyag rgya rnams yin te /
translated: Likewise, for the deities born from the fire family, the consorts are born from the water family.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sku mdog dmar por gyur pa'i thabs rnams la /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sku mdog dmar por gyur pa'i thabs rnams la /
translated: For that reason, the methods with red-colored bodies

original: sku mdog dkar por gyur pa'i shes rab ma rnams yin te /
analyzed: sku mdog dkar por gyur pa'i shes rab ma rnams yin te /
translated: are the wisdoms with white-colored bodies.

original: shes rab ma dmar mo rnams la sku mdog dkar por gyur pa'i thabs rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab ma dmar mo rnams la sku mdog dkar por gyur pa'i thabs rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: For the red wisdoms, the methods have white-colored bodies.

original: de bzhin du nag po rnams la phyag rgya'i sku mdog ser po yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nag po rnams la phyag rgya'i sku mdog ser po yin te /
translated: Likewise, for the black ones, the consort has a yellow-colored body.

original: phyag rgya ser mo rnams la thabs rnams nag po'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ser mo rnams la thabs rnams nag po'o //
translated: For the yellow consorts, the methods are black.

original: nam mkha' las skyes par gyur pa'i thabs sngon po rnams la ye shes las skyes par gyur pa'i shes rab ma ljang gu ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' las skyes par gyur pa'i thabs sngon po rnams la ye shes las skyes par gyur pa'i shes rab ma ljang gu ste /
translated: The blue ones born from space are the wisdom women born from gnosis, the green ones.

original: ljang gu rnams la shes rab ma sngon por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ljang gu rnams la shes rab ma sngon por shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the green ones are the blue wisdom women.

original: rgyu de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs so so las skyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs so so las skyes par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are born from the individual clans.

original: de lta bu'i lha dang lha mo @203b rnams gang yin pa de rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nas spro bar mdzad ce na /🔽shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lha dang lha mo @203b rnams gang yin pa de rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gang nas spro bar mdzad ce na / shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From which face of the Bhagavān are those gods and goddesses emanated?

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir thugs kyi rdo rje'i zhal nas dpal 'khor lo sdom pa la sogs pa'i ma rgyud kyi rgyud rnams spros te /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir thugs kyi rdo rje'i zhal nas dpal 'khor lo sdom pa la sogs pa'i ma rgyud kyi rgyud rnams spros te /
translated: The Bhagavān emanated the tantras of the mother tantras, such as the glorious Cakrasaṃvara, from the face of the mind vajra, called “wisdom” and so on.

original: de bzhin du nub kyi ye shes kyi zhal dang / g-yas pa'i gsung gi zhal dang / g-yon pa'i sku'i zhal nas rim pa bzhin du rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang 'dus pa dang bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa rnams spro bar shes par bya'o //🔽rim pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa la sogs pa lta ba bzhin du ni shar gyi zhal la sogs pa las spro bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nub kyi ye shes kyi zhal dang / g-yas pa'i gsung gi zhal dang / g-yon pa'i sku'i zhal nas rim pa bzhin du rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa dang 'dus pa dang bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa rnams spro bar shes par bya'o // rim pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa la sogs pa lta ba bzhin du ni shar gyi zhal la sogs pa las spro bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should know that the Yoga Tantras and so on are emanated from the face of gnosis in the west, the face of speech in the right, and the face of body in the left.🔽In the same order, one should know that the Yogācāra and so on are emanated from the face in the east and so on, in accordance with the view.

original: de bzhin du mu stegs pa rnams kyi lta ba ni rim pa bzhin du shes pa ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mu stegs pa rnams kyi lta ba ni rim pa bzhin du shes pa ni nges pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the views of the tīrthikas are known in order from the face in the south and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad tha ma dang 'bring po dang mchog gi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad tha ma dang 'bring po dang mchog gi dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: In brief, all moving and unmoving things are said to be created by the Bhagavān, divided into inferior, middling, and superior.

original: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la sogs pa mdzad pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la sogs pa mdzad pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the Bhagavān created those and so on,

original: spro bya spro byed kyi dbye ba yan lag dang ldan par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spro bya spro byed kyi dbye ba yan lag dang ldan par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is endowed with the branches of the distinction between the one who emanates and the emanated,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtog pa can dang / mi rtog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtog pa can dang / mi rtog par mi 'gyur ram zhe na ;
translated: one might think, “The Bhagavān will not become nonconceptual?”

original: dpal ldan zla ba zhes bya ba ni dper na chu shel zla ba'i 'od zer rnams dang phrad nas /
analyzed: dpal ldan zla ba zhes bya ba ni dper na chu shel zla ba'i 'od zer rnams dang phrad nas /
translated: The one called “the glorious moon” is like the moon crystal, which, when it meets the moon’s light rays,

original: mi rtog pa nyid kyis chu 'dzag par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i phung po rnams shes nas sems can rnams kyi sgrib pa dag par bya ba'i phyir ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: mi rtog pa nyid kyis chu 'dzag par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang 'dra bar gyur pa'i phung po rnams shes nas sems can rnams kyi sgrib pa dag par bya ba'i phyir ston par mdzad de /
translated: without any thought, causes water to flow. In the same way, having understood the aggregates, which are like illusions and dreams, the Bhagavān teaches in order to purify the obscurations of sentient beings.

original: chos kyang skal ba nye bar ldan pa dang skal ba ring bar gyur pa rnams kyis de bzhin du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyang skal ba nye bar ldan pa dang skal ba ring bar gyur pa rnams kyis de bzhin du shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Dharma will also be understood in that way by those who are endowed with good fortune and those who have a long-standing connection with good fortune.

original: de bas na don dam par rang gi sems las ma gtogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub gang gis kyang mi ster bar bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par rang gi sems las ma gtogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub gang gis kyang mi ster bar bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the Bhagavān teaches that there is no unsurpassed enlightenment to be given by anyone other than one’s own mind.

original: srid gsum gnas nas sems can don mdzad dang ni yid bzhin nor la bsam pa med //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid gsum gnas nas sems can don mdzad dang ni yid bzhin nor la bsam pa med // ces bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha acts for the sake of sentient beings in the three worlds, but the wish-fulfilling gem has no such thought.

original: 'dir gal te bcom ldan 'das dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu sems can la don grub par byed pa /🔽de lta na ni ci'i phyir sems can rnams la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten @204a * //
analyzed: 'dir gal te bcom ldan 'das dang yid bzhin gyi nor bu sems can la don grub par byed pa / de lta na ni ci'i phyir sems can rnams la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten @204a * //
translated: Here, one might argue as follows: The Blessed One and the wish-fulfilling gem both accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: las 'das pa'i don da rung ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i don da rung ma grub po zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, why is it that sentient beings have not yet accomplished their aims, whether mundane or supramundane?

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyi don ma grub pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyi don ma grub pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The reason that sentient beings have not accomplished their aims

original: sems ma dag pa yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ma dag pa yin gyis gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: is not anything else, but rather their impure minds.

original: gal te sems ma dag pa'i phyir don mi 'grub pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems ma dag pa'i phyir don mi 'grub pa de lta na ni /
translated: If it is because of their impure minds that they do not accomplish their aims,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the Blessed Buddha would be purposeless.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de sems can la gnas pa de mi mthong zhing sdig can sems mi dge ba'i 'bras bu'i las kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de sems can la gnas pa de mi mthong zhing sdig can sems mi dge ba'i 'bras bu'i las kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To explain this, he says, “They do not see it, which is present in sentient beings, because of their sinful, nonvirtuous minds.”

original: 'dir skye ba snga ma'i mi dge ba'i dbang gis rang gi sems la gnas par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba snga ma'i mi dge ba'i dbang gis rang gi sems la gnas par gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Here, due to the non-virtue of previous lives, one’s mind does not abide in the vision of the Bhagavān.

original: dper na mig dang bral ba'i mi rnams kyis nyi ma mi mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig dang bral ba'i mi rnams kyis nyi ma mi mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, people without eyes do not see the sun.

original: der nyi ma la skyon med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: der nyi ma la skyon med pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la shes par bya'o //
translated: Just as there is no fault in the sun, so it should be understood regarding the Bhagavān Buddha.

original: rgyu de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For that reason, in every way, the Bhagavān Buddha has no purpose for sentient beings who are not fortunate.

original: de bzhin du skal ba dang ldan par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la rang gi sems dag par gyur na sangs rgyas nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skal ba dang ldan par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la rang gi sems dag par gyur na sangs rgyas nyid kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, when the minds of fortunate sentient beings are purified, they become the nature of Buddhahood itself.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir phyi rol na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan mas dgos pa med ces bya ba bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i phyir phyi rol na gnas pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan mas dgos pa med ces bya ba bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Because of attaining Buddhahood, it is taught that there is no purpose in an externally present Buddha.

original: sems ni dag par gyur na mi de rgyal dbang nyid du 'gyur la rgyal ba gzhan mas ci zhig bya //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni dag par gyur na mi de rgyal dbang nyid du 'gyur la rgyal ba gzhan mas ci zhig bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the mind is purified, that person becomes a Lord of the Victorious Ones. What else is there to do?

original: sangs rgyas nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is Buddhahood like?

original: bskyed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bskyed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na rgyu gang las myu gu skyes pa'i rgyu de ni myu gu skyed pa'i phyir nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu gang las myu gu skyes pa'i rgyu de ni myu gu skyed pa'i phyir nyams pa'o //
translated: For example, a cause that produces a sprout is not destroyed because it produces the sprout.

original: de gal te myu gu ma skyes par nyams par gyur pa de lta na ni myu gu skye ba med de /
analyzed: de gal te myu gu ma skyes par nyams par gyur pa de lta na ni myu gu skye ba med de /
translated: If it were destroyed before the sprout is produced, then the sprout would not be produced,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na ma nyams pa la skyes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // yang na ma nyams pa la skyes par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: because there would be no cause.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la khyad med de /
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la khyad med de /
translated: Or, if it were not destroyed, then there would be no difference between the seed and the sprout,

original: rang bzhin mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature would not change.

original: de ltar yang ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'on gal te nyams pa las kyang mi skye mi nyams pa las kyang mi skye ba de lta ni /
analyzed: 'on gal te nyams pa las kyang mi skye mi nyams pa las kyang mi skye ba de lta ni /
translated: If it is not produced from a destroyed seed, nor from an undestroyed seed,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: how is there a relationship between cause and effect?

original: gang zhig sngon dngos de gzhan rgyu phyir zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig sngon dngos de gzhan rgyu phyir zhing //
translated: That which is prior and that which is real is not other than the cause.

original: zhes pa'i tshig ste rang bzhin nyid kyis ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig ste rang bzhin nyid kyis ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “not arisen by way of its own nature,” means

original: 'dir sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sa bon gang yin pa de nyid myu gu ma yin te /
translated: that the seed itself is not the sprout,

original: gnas skabs gzhan du @204b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du @204b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a different state.

original: sa bon las ma gtogs par myu gu ma skyes te /
analyzed: sa bon las ma gtogs par myu gu ma skyes te /
translated: The sprout is not arisen from anything other than the seed,

original: rgyu gzhan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from another cause.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: rang min gzhan ma las kyang min //
analyzed: rang min gzhan ma las kyang min //
translated: it is not from itself, nor from another,

original: gnyi gar ma yin rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyi gar ma yin rgyu med min //
translated: nor from both, nor without cause.

original: skyes pa'i dngos po gang zhig rnams //
analyzed: skyes pa'i dngos po gang zhig rnams //
translated: Whatever things are arisen

original: nam yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are never existent.

original: zhes bya par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya par gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das /
translated: For that reason, the Buddha Bhagavān

original: stong pa nyid las bde ba chen po nyid kyis ji ltar byon pa de bzhin du rang bzhin de nyid kyis de nyid gshegs par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las bde ba chen po nyid kyis ji ltar byon pa de bzhin du rang bzhin de nyid kyis de nyid gshegs par mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: has come from emptiness itself by way of great bliss, and in the same way, he has gone by way of that very nature.

original: bde ba'i skad cig de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba'i skad cig de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that moment of bliss?

original: bde gnas bde ba'i rjes chags skad cig tu ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos gzhan rjes chags min //
analyzed: bde gnas bde ba'i rjes chags skad cig tu ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dngos gzhan rjes chags min //
translated: The bliss of the abode is the instant passion of passion for bliss, not the passion for other things that are coemergent.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i skad cig yin gyi /
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i skad cig yin gyi /
translated: the instant of the supreme, unchanging coemergent bliss.

original: bems po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bems po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of the inanimate and so forth.

original: gzhan yang bems po dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phung po rnams gang yin pa de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bas 'bigs par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bems po dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phung po rnams gang yin pa de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde bas 'bigs par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the aggregates, which are by nature inanimate and suffering, and so forth, are pierced by coemergent bliss,

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: they become the nature of supreme, unchanging bliss.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phung po rnams kyis kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i skur skyed par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phung po rnams kyis kyang lhan cig skyes pa'i skur skyed par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The aggregates, which are by nature supreme, unchanging bliss, also give rise to the coemergent body.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku de las chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku skyes te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sku de las chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku skyes te /
translated: From that coemergent body, the dharmakāya, saṃbhogkāya, and nirmāṇakāya are born.

original: sprul pa'i sku de las slar yang de bzhin du 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku de las slar yang de bzhin du 'byung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it arises again in the same way from that emanation body.

original: 'o na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la dngos po gang yang ma zin pa'i chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i gal te skye ba de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur ram
analyzed: 'o na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i sku la dngos po gang yang ma zin pa'i chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i gal te skye ba de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad par mi 'gyur ram
translated: Now, if the dharmakāya and so on were to arise in the innate body, which has the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, without any substance being taken up, then would cause and effect not be different?

original: / dper na 'bras s'a lu las skye tshe la sogs pa skye ba bzhin no zhen brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: / dper na 'bras s'a lu las skye tshe la sogs pa skye ba bzhin no zhen brjod par bya ste /
translated: For example, it is like the arising of rice from rice.

original: sa bon las ni rtsa ba yal ga me tog 'bras bu lta bu dag pa'i sa las skyes //
analyzed: sa bon las ni rtsa ba yal ga me tog 'bras bu lta bu dag pa'i sa las skyes //
translated: The root, the branch, the flower, and the fruit are born from the pure earth.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is stated.

original: dper na dag pa'i sa las 'bras la sogs pa'i sa bon btab nas dus kyi dbang gis myu gu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur te /
analyzed: dper na dag pa'i sa las 'bras la sogs pa'i sa bon btab nas dus kyi dbang gis myu gu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur te /
translated: For example, having planted the seed of rice and so on in pure earth, by the power of time, it becomes the nature of the sprout and so on.

original: myu gu la sogs pa de rnams su gyur nas phyi nas sa bon bzhin du 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i sku las @205a * //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa de rnams su gyur nas phyi nas sa bon bzhin du 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lhan cig skyes pa'i sku las @205a * //
translated: Just as the seed transforms into the sprout and so on, and later the result arises like the seed, in the same way, the result arises from the connate body.🔽

original: chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i skye ba ni skyon med par grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i skye ba ni skyon med par grub ces bya'o //
translated: Just as the seed transforms into the sprout and so on, and later the result arises like the seed, in the same way, the arising of the dharmakāya and so on from the connate body is established as faultless.

original: 'o na gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa /
analyzed: 'o na gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i sku mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin yin pa /
translated: If the connate body is the nature of supreme, unchanging bliss,

original: de lta ni rten las ma gtogs par thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ni rten las ma gtogs par thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: it will not be attained apart from the support.

original: gang rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ste ;🔽rten dang bral ba'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gang rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ste ; rten dang bral ba'i phyir mi rtag par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Since it is the nature of the support and the supported,

original: rjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: rjod par mdzad de /
translated: will it not be impermanent because it is separated from the support?🔽It is said:

original: sa chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
analyzed: sa chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa las /
translated: Earth, water, and so on.

original: 'dir sa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni dri dang gzugs dang ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir sa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams ni dri dang gzugs dang ro dang / reg bya dang / sgra'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Here, the entities of earth and so on are the nature of smell, form, taste, texture, and sound.

original: de las yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de las yon tan lnga'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: They are the nature of the five qualities.

original: chu'i yon tan bzhi dang me la gsum dang rlung la gnyis dang yon tan sgra gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: chu'i yon tan bzhi dang me la gsum dang rlung la gnyis dang yon tan sgra gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: The four qualities of water, the three of fire, the two of wind, and the single quality of sound are the nature of space.

original: sa la sogs pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rnams kyi lus po yin zhing /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rnams kyi lus po yin zhing /
translated: The bodies of humans are of the nature of earth and so forth.

original: bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang de bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang de bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: The bodhicitta, which is of the nature of bliss, is also like that.

original: yon tan de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of the gods of the desire realm is of the nature of those qualities.

original: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lus po dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa rnams ni yon tan gsum gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i lus po dang bde ba'o //
translated: The bodies and bliss of the gods of the form realm are of the nature of the three qualities.

original: gzugs med pa'i lha rnams ni sems kyi bag chags tsam gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / yon tan sgra gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lus la bde bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i lha rnams ni sems kyi bag chags tsam gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / yon tan sgra gcig pu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i lus la bde bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The bliss of the formless gods should be understood as the body that is of the nature of the mere latent tendencies of the mind and the single quality of sound.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams de rnams gang gi tshe 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams de rnams gang gi tshe 'khor ba'i bag chags las 'das par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: In this way, when the elements such as earth transcend the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence,

original: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan par gyur pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sku'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: they become endowed with all aspects and the support of the innate body.

original: gzhan yang dngos po gcig gang du yod pa der rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba'i phyir dngos po gzhan rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po gcig gang du yod pa der rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba'i phyir dngos po gzhan rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, wherever one thing exists, other things should be understood to exist there, because they are dependently arisen.

original: rgyu de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi sa las dri skyes te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi sa las dri skyes te /
translated: For that reason, smell arises from the earth element,

original: brtags pa'i ngo bos gzugs la'o //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bos gzugs la'o //
translated: and form arises from the fire element, due to their imputed natures.

original: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin chu las gzugs dang me las ro dang rlung las reg bya dang / nam mkha' las sgra ni shas che bar skyes te /
analyzed: de ltar rim pa ji lta ba bzhin chu las gzugs dang me las ro dang rlung las reg bya dang / nam mkha' las sgra ni shas che bar skyes te /
translated: In that way, water gives rise to form, fire to taste, wind to touch, and space to sound, in their respective order.

original: shas chung bar dri la sogs pa skye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shas chung bar dri la sogs pa skye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Smell arises from them in a lesser way.

original: gzhan yang phung po dang khams rnams dang yul dang yul can la sogs pa'i bye brag @205b shes par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po dang khams rnams dang yul dang yul can la sogs pa'i bye brag @205b shes par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that the distinctions of the aggregates, elements, objects, subjects, and so on, should be understood.

original: sa sogs khams ni phan tshun dag ste gzhan yang gtso bo'i dngos dang brtags pa'i dngos por 'gyur //
analyzed: sa sogs khams ni phan tshun dag ste gzhan yang gtso bo'i dngos dang brtags pa'i dngos por 'gyur //
translated: The elements such as earth are mutually related, and are also the primary and imputed entities.

original: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba yul dang yul can phan tshun bdud dpung ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba yul dang yul can phan tshun bdud dpung ma rig pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, objects, and subjects are mutually related, and ignorance is the army of demons.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sa la sogs pa'i dngos po lnga ni phan tshun 'brel pa las ma gtogs par 'khor ba pa rnams kyi don 'grub par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sa la sogs pa'i dngos po lnga ni phan tshun 'brel pa las ma gtogs par 'khor ba pa rnams kyi don 'grub par mi byed do //
translated: For that reason, the five things such as earth do not accomplish the purpose of transmigrators except through mutual connection.

original: de bas na rnal 'byor pas phan tshun du de rnams kyi 'brel pa chad par byed na de rnams sgrib pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor pas phan tshun du de rnams kyi 'brel pa chad par byed na de rnams sgrib pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when the yogi cuts the mutual connection of those, they become free of obscuration,

original: rang rang gi yon tan bzung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi yon tan bzung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their individual qualities are grasped.

original: sgrib pa ni 'khor ba'i bag chags yin te de dang bral bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni 'khor ba'i bag chags yin te de dang bral bar gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: Obscuration is the latent tendency of cyclic existence, and when one is free from that, one becomes the nature of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de rnams mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de rnams mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'grub par 'gyur ba bstan par mdzad de /
translated: When they become the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, one accomplishes one's own and others' goals.

original: des ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des ni rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is taught by through that, miracles, and so on.

original: rgyu de'i phyir gang gi tshe phung po rnams sgrib pa med pa'i dus de nas bzung nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi skye ba dang mi 'jig pa ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir gang gi tshe phung po rnams sgrib pa med pa'i dus de nas bzung nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku mi skye ba dang mi 'jig pa ste mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason, when the aggregates are free from obscuration, from that time onward, the Bhagavān's body is unborn and undying, because it becomes the nature of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de ltar mdor bsdus pas rnal 'byor pas skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub thob na rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las mngon par byang chub par gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bsdus pas rnal 'byor pas skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub thob na rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba las mngon par byang chub par gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in brief, if the yogin attains manifest enlightenment in a single instant, he should understand that he has attained manifest enlightenment through the five aspects, the twenty aspects, and the magical net.

original: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa bzhi thob par gyur nas ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa bzhi thob par gyur nas ci 'grub ce na /
translated: Having attained the four kinds of manifest enlightenment, what is accomplished?

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha-field is

original: 'dir nam gyi dus su bya ba thams cad rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe la rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po'i dngos po thams cad ni dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nam gyi dus su bya ba thams cad rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe la rten dang brten pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po'i dngos po thams cad ni dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: at that time when all activities are completed here, all things of the three worlds, which have the nature of the support and the supported, are mastered.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: That is taught:🔽The Buddha-field is infinite, immeasurable, the realms of qualities, space, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni mtha' yas dpag med yon tan khams rnams nam mkha' la sogs dang // skye dang gnas dang nyams pa rnam gsum srid dang 'gro drug sems can kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni mtha' yas dpag med yon tan khams rnams nam mkha' la sogs dang // skye dang gnas dang nyams pa rnam gsum srid dang 'gro drug sems can kun //
translated: arising, abiding, and decaying in three ways, all sentient beings in the six migrations,

original: sangs rgyas khro bo la sogs snying rje thugs ldan sras bcas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas khro bo la sogs snying rje thugs ldan sras bcas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de /
translated: the Buddhas, the wrathful ones, etc., those with compassionate minds, all the Bodhisattvas with their sons,

original: 'di dag rgyal ba srid gsum gyis btud bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig pu'o //
analyzed: 'di dag rgyal ba srid gsum gyis btud bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig pu'o //
translated: these are the retinue of the sole wheel that produces the bliss of the sole Victor, bowed to by the three worlds.

original: zhes bya'o // 'o na sa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sgrib pa med @206a * //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'o na sa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sgrib pa med @206a * //
translated: Thus it is.

original: pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how do things such as earth become the nature of non-obstruction?

original: spu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the verse that begins with “hair,”

original: 'dir nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i spu la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi rten ni srog gi rlung yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i spu la sogs pa'i khams rnams dang lus dang ngag dang sems dang ye shes kyi rten ni srog gi rlung yin te /
translated: here, the elements such as hair, etc., which have the nature of space, etc., are the support of body, speech, mind, and gnosis. The life-force wind is the support of those.

original: rlung de nyid g-yas dang g-yon pa 'gags nas stong pa nyid kyi drin gyis dbus mar zhugs na sems brtan por gyur te /
analyzed: rlung de nyid g-yas dang g-yon pa 'gags nas stong pa nyid kyi drin gyis dbus mar zhugs na sems brtan por gyur te /
translated: When that wind stops on the right and left, through the kindness of emptiness, it enters the middle, and the mind becomes stable.

original: sems brtan por gyur na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bstan par byed do //
analyzed: sems brtan por gyur na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bstan par byed do //
translated: When the mind becomes stable, it is shown to be naturally luminous.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur na glo bur gyi dri ma bor nas stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gyur na glo bur gyi dri ma bor nas stong pa nyid kyi gzugs dang ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: When it becomes naturally luminous, it casts off adventitious stains and becomes the nature of the same taste as the form of emptiness.

original: sems stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur na dngos po thams cad kyis mi gos par skye ba dang 'chi ba spangs pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du dus thams cad du grub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur na dngos po thams cad kyis mi gos par skye ba dang 'chi ba spangs pa'i nam mkha' bzhin du dus thams cad du grub par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind becomes the nature of the form of emptiness, it is established at all times like space, free from birth and death, uncontaminated by any entity.

original: de bas na don gang gis sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid thob par byed pa'i don de nyid rnal 'byor bas 'bad pas bsgrub par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na don gang gis sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug nyid thob par byed pa'i don de nyid rnal 'byor bas 'bad pas bsgrub par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the meaning by which one attains mastery of the twelve stages is the meaning that the yogi/nī should accomplish with effort.

original: spu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir spu la sogs pa'i khams rnams sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: spu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir spu la sogs pa'i khams rnams sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur na rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Here, when the elements of the body hairs and so on become the nature free of obscuration, one becomes a master of the twelve stages, such as the Joyous and so on.

original: de bas na bla ma'i zhal las sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas lus po dag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bla ma'i zhal las sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor bas lus po dag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī who wishes to accomplish unsurpassed awakening by means of the six-branched yoga should purify the body from the guru’s mouth.

original: lus po dag par gyur nas sangs rgyas nyid dang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus po dag par gyur nas sangs rgyas nyid dang rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa'o //
translated: and having purified the body, they attain buddhahood and the nirvāṇa that is not a resting place.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sems las ma gtogs par khams gsum las sangs rgyas gzhan med de //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sems las ma gtogs par khams gsum las sangs rgyas gzhan med de //
translated: For that reason, apart from mind, there is no buddhahood in the three realms.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas yin par shes na thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas yin par shes na thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one knows that all sentient beings are buddhas, the suffering of samsara, which has no beginning, will be cut off.

original: yang na de rnams la smod pa dang slu ba la sogs par byas na dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i dus kyi bar du thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de rnams la smod pa dang slu ba la sogs par byas na dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i dus kyi bar du thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, if one disparages them, deceives them, and so forth, one will obtain the suffering of the hells and so on until the end of time.

original: de ltar yon tan dang skyon shes nas rnam par ma dag pa'i sems kyis mkhas pa dang mi mkhas pa'i skyes bu rnams la brgal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang skyon shes nas rnam par ma dag pa'i sems kyis mkhas pa dang mi mkhas pa'i skyes bu rnams la brgal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Having understood the good qualities and faults in that way, one should not dispute with wise and unwise persons with an impure mind.

original: gzhan yang sems can rnams las ma gtogs par byams pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can rnams las ma gtogs par byams pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi /
translated: Moreover, apart from sentient beings, there are no four doors of liberation, such as love.

original: @206b dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @206b dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the perfections such as generosity will not be completed.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sems can thams cad la gus par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / yi dam gyi lha bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sems can thams cad la gus par bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / yi dam gyi lha bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: For this reason, one should respect all sentient beings, make offerings to them, and regard them as one’s tutelary deities.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This is taught:

original: sangs rgyas sems can yin te 'jig rten khams 'dir sangs rgyas chen po gzhan ma yod pa min //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sems can yin te 'jig rten khams 'dir sangs rgyas chen po gzhan ma yod pa min //
translated: Sentient beings are buddhas. There are no other great buddhas in this world-system.

original: de rnams bsten pas dpag med srid par rnam par mi rtog kyis ni gcod par byed //
analyzed: de rnams bsten pas dpag med srid par rnam par mi rtog kyis ni gcod par byed //
translated: By relying on them, one is liberated from the nonconceptual, immeasurable existence.

original: 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen por rnal 'byor pa ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen por rnal 'byor pa ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: If one harms them, the yogi goes to the great hells such as Saṃjīva.

original: de phyir rnam dag sems kyis mkhas dang mi mkhas skyes bu la ni brgal mi bya //
analyzed: de phyir rnam dag sems kyis mkhas dang mi mkhas skyes bu la ni brgal mi bya //
translated: Therefore, with a pure mind, one should not dispute with wise or unwise people.

original: sems can sbyor ba thob nas dag pa byams pa la sogs sems thob 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //
analyzed: sems can sbyor ba thob nas dag pa byams pa la sogs sems thob 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //
translated: Having applied oneself to sentient beings, one attains the pure mind of love and so on, O Lord of Men.

original: dus gsum 'khor ba ru ni mi dge'am yon tan can rnams zhe sdang chags sogs sems yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum 'khor ba ru ni mi dge'am yon tan can rnams zhe sdang chags sogs sems yin no //
translated: The minds of those who are virtuous or nonvirtuous in the three times are hatred, desire, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what it says.

original: 'gro ba drug gam khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba drug gam khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The minds of sentient beings who live in the three realms or in the six life-journeys are of the nature of hatred, etc.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sems can rnams la sun dbyung ba byas nas rang don 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sems can rnams la sun dbyung ba byas nas rang don 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not, having criticized sentient beings, accomplish one’s own aim.

original: rang gi don ma grub pa rnams la gzhan gyi don 'grub par me 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi don ma grub pa rnams la gzhan gyi don 'grub par me 'gyur te /
translated: One should not accomplish the aim of others, having failed to accomplish one’s own aim.

original: rang gi don 'grub par mi 'dod pa'i sems ni bdud kyi sems yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi don 'grub par mi 'dod pa'i sems ni bdud kyi sems yin gyi /
translated: A mind that does not seek to accomplish one’s own aim is the mind of Māra.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the mind of the Lord Buddha.

original: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba byang chub sems ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam pa kun du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'dod dang 'gro ba byang chub sems ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam pa kun du 'gyur //
translated: The mind of the Bodhisattva is twofold, like the desire to go and the act of going.

original: thar pa dang ni 'jug pas dman zhing smon bral rnam pa kun du bdud kyi sems //
analyzed: thar pa dang ni 'jug pas dman zhing smon bral rnam pa kun du bdud kyi sems //
translated: The mind of Māra is always inferior, both in liberation and in engagement, and is devoid of aspiration.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: de bas na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyams par byed pa po ni bdud yin te gnyi ga sgrub par mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don nyams par byed pa po ni bdud yin te gnyi ga sgrub par mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin la /
translated: Therefore, the one who causes the loss of one's own aim and the aim of others is a demon. The Lord Buddha is the one who accomplishes both.

original: de ltar shes nas gang gi tshe bla na med pa'i byang chub la sems ldog pa dang ; sems can rnams la zhe sdang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa shes nas skad cig de nyid las stong pa nyid la dmigs pa dang byams pa la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes nas gang gi tshe bla na med pa'i byang chub la sems ldog pa dang ; sems can rnams la zhe sdang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa shes nas skad cig de nyid las stong pa nyid la dmigs pa dang byams pa la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Knowing this, when one sees that the mind turns away from unsurpassed enlightenment and becomes of the nature of anger toward sentient beings, then in that very moment one should cultivate the contemplation of emptiness and loving kindness and so on.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This is taught:

original: bdud rnams kyis ni zhi min byed cing srid gsum gnas @207a * //
analyzed: bdud rnams kyis ni zhi min byed cing srid gsum gnas @207a * //
translated: The demons do not do what is not peaceful. In the three worlds,

original: su byang chub sems dpa' zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: su byang chub sems dpa' zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: the Bodhisattva becomes peaceful.

original: bdud dbang rdzu 'phrul dman zhing mchog tu 'jigs byed ston pa gcig pur rdzu 'phrul ldan //
analyzed: bdud dbang rdzu 'phrul dman zhing mchog tu 'jigs byed ston pa gcig pur rdzu 'phrul ldan //
translated: The demons are of inferior magical power, but the one who displays the most frightening is the only one with magical power.

original: bdud rnams bdud kyi blo yin gzhan gyi sems la 'jigs skye skyo ba rnams bde ba'i thugs //
analyzed: bdud rnams bdud kyi blo yin gzhan gyi sems la 'jigs skye skyo ba rnams bde ba'i thugs //
translated: The demons are of demonic mind, but the one who is frightened in the mind of another and is sad is of a peaceful mind.

original: de phyir sangs rgyas mthu yis srid gsum ma lus dpag med dus su 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir sangs rgyas mthu yis srid gsum ma lus dpag med dus su 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the Buddha, the three worlds enter into the immeasurable time.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid dang byams pa la sogs pa'i bsgom pa ma gtogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam gzhan min par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid dang byams pa la sogs pa'i bsgom pa ma gtogs par bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi lam gzhan min par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that there is no other path to unsurpassed enlightenment than the cultivation of emptiness and love, etc.🔽That which is taught by the Victorious Ones in the world systems is not the wisdom of humans.

original: gang zhig 'jig rten khams kyi tshang rgyal bas gsungs pa mi rnams ye shes de min zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang dbyibs la sogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten khams kyi tshang rgyal bas gsungs pa mi rnams ye shes de min zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang dbyibs la sogs par bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa de gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ma yin te /
translated: Here, that which is taught by the Blessed One in the world systems, such as the measure and shape, etc., of the world systems, is not the wisdom of non-duality.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na bsod nams kyi stobs dang sdig pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgya che ba dang rgya chung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na bsod nams kyi stobs dang sdig pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams rgya che ba dang rgya chung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For what reason? Because the world systems appear vast and small due to the power of merit and the power of sin.

original: 'on gal te 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can rnams la tshad med pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas la yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gal te 'jig rten gyi khams dang sems can rnams la tshad med pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas la yod dam zhe na /
translated: But if the world spheres and sentient beings are immeasurable, are the buddhas immeasurable?

original: sangs rgyas rnams la tshad med lhan cig skyes sku'i dbang gis khru gcig skad cig gis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la tshad med lhan cig skyes sku'i dbang gis khru gcig skad cig gis //
translated: The buddhas are immeasurable by the power of the immeasurable body of innate bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: This is

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi sku la tshad med de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi sku la tshad med de lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body of the buddhas is immeasurable, since it is the nature of innate bliss.

original: 'o na gal te sems can dang sangs rgyas la don dam par tshad med pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sems can dang sangs rgyas la don dam par tshad med pa de lta na ni /
translated: But if sentient beings and buddhas are immeasurable in the ultimate sense,

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten khams kyi tshad gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten khams kyi tshad gsungs she na /
translated: why is the measure of the world spheres taught?

original: tshad ni sems can rjes su mthun par brjod de rtag par srog chags rnams la las kyi sar //
analyzed: tshad ni sems can rjes su mthun par brjod de rtag par srog chags rnams la las kyi sar //
translated: The measure is taught in accordance with sentient beings, since the world spheres are the field of karma for all living beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is🔽because the world spheres are the field of karma for all living beings.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshang gang gsungs pa de las kyi sa la gnas pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshang gang gsungs pa de las kyi sa la gnas pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par yin gyi /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Buddha spoke of the measure of the world-realm in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings abiding on the stage of action.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not ultimately so.

original: de nas gal te nyid kyis 'dod pa dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis brjod par mdzad pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: de nas gal te nyid kyis 'dod pa dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis brjod par mdzad pa de lta na ni /
translated: Then, if the measure of the world-realm were expressed by the Bhagavān under the influence of desire and pride,

original: mu stegs pa dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la khyad med de sems can gyi bsam pa las ma gtogs par rang 'dod pa dang mthun pa'i @207b phyir ro ;
analyzed: mu stegs pa dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la khyad med de sems can gyi bsam pa las ma gtogs par rang 'dod pa dang mthun pa'i @207b phyir ro ;
translated: then there would be no difference between the tīrthikas and the Bhagavān Buddha, because it accords with one’s own desire, apart from the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: / de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i las ma gtogs par don dam par bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan ma'i lam gang zhig kyang ma bstan te /
analyzed: / de bas na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i las ma gtogs par don dam par bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan ma'i lam gang zhig kyang ma bstan te /
translated: Therefore, apart from the karma of supreme unchanging bliss, the Bhagavān did not teach any other path because one would not attain the unsurpassed enlightenment ultimately.

original: rgyu de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dor nas bems po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi stobs kyis sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur bar bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid dor nas bems po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i stong pa nyid kyi stobs kyis sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur bar bstan par mdzad de /
translated: For that reason, having abandoned emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects, one will not attain the spiritual power of the great seal, which is the nature of the four bodies, by the power of emptiness, which is the nature of an inanimate object.

original: gang gis rgyal dbang skyed cing nyin dang mtshan bzhin dus su gang gis mngal nas 'byung ba dang // skad cig gang gis sgrub pa po rnams 'pho ba dang bral zag dang zag med 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: gang gis rgyal dbang skyed cing nyin dang mtshan bzhin dus su gang gis mngal nas 'byung ba dang // skad cig gang gis sgrub pa po rnams 'pho ba dang bral zag dang zag med 'gyur ba ste //
translated: By which the lord of the victors is generated, by which one is born from the womb at the proper time day and night, by which the adepts are free from transmigration, and by which the contaminated and uncontaminated are transformed,

original: sangs rgyas bya ba de dor nas ni mnyam pa'i bde ba dang bral gang gis ston pa gzhan sgom byed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bya ba de dor nas ni mnyam pa'i bde ba dang bral gang gis ston pa gzhan sgom byed //
translated: having abandoned that which is called buddhahood, by which one cultivates another teacher, devoid of the bliss of equality,

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan cig skyes bde bskal pa bye ba du mar de la ring du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan cig skyes bde bskal pa bye ba du mar de la ring du 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: for many millions of eons, one will be far from the connate bliss of buddhahood.

original: de ltar don bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar don bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Having taught the meaning in that way,

original: dpe bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: dpe bstan par mdzad de /
translated: he teaches the example.

original: sngon bu'i shing las rgun 'brum dang ni dug las bdud rtsi dag dang tshangs pa'i shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong las mya ngan 'das bde mi dge rjes su myong dang srog gcod las ni dngos grub med //
analyzed: sngon bu'i shing las rgun 'brum dang ni dug las bdud rtsi dag dang tshangs pa'i shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong las mya ngan 'das bde mi dge rjes su myong dang srog gcod las ni dngos grub med //
translated: From the tree of the son, from the poison, ambrosia, from the tree of Brahma, the lotus, from the void, the bliss of nirvana, from the experience of non-virtue, from the killing, there is no siddhi.

original: mchod sbyin las ni phyugs la mtho ris zhi ba mchog gi go 'phang dbang po 'gog pas min //
analyzed: mchod sbyin las ni phyugs la mtho ris zhi ba mchog gi go 'phang dbang po 'gog pas min //
translated: From the sacrifice, from the animal, there is no heaven, no supreme state, by the cessation of the senses.

original: rig byed kun mkhyen gsung dang mi 'gyur g-yo med bde bar 'gyur dang ma dag sems las min //
analyzed: rig byed kun mkhyen gsung dang mi 'gyur g-yo med bde bar 'gyur dang ma dag sems las min //
translated: From the Veda, from the speech of the Omniscient One, from the unchanging, from the unmoving, from the bliss, from the impure mind, there is no liberation.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dper na sngon bu'i shing dang tig ta las shin tu zhim pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i rgun 'brum mi skye ba dang mi 'chi bar byed pa'i bdud rtsi myur du 'chi bar byed pa'i dug las mi skye ba dang // rgya skyegs kyi shing las shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i padma dang bems po'i stong pa las rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las las 'jig rten gyi dngos grub brgyad dang /
analyzed: dper na sngon bu'i shing dang tig ta las shin tu zhim pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i rgun 'brum mi skye ba dang mi 'chi bar byed pa'i bdud rtsi myur du 'chi bar byed pa'i dug las mi skye ba dang // rgya skyegs kyi shing las shin tu yid du 'ong ba'i padma dang bems po'i stong pa las rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba dang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las las 'jig rten gyi dngos grub brgyad dang /
translated: For example, grapes do not grow from the wood of a jujube tree or a bitter gentian plant, nor does poison that quickly causes death grow from nectar that grants immortality.🔽A beautiful lotus does not grow from a lac tree, and the bliss of the nonabiding nirvana does not grow from the emptiness of an inanimate thing.🔽The eight mundane qualities of accomplishment do not grow from nonvirtuous actions such as killing, and the state of supreme, unchanging bliss does not grow from the cessation of the faculties.

original: mchod sbyin gyi dus su phyugs bsad pa rnams las mtho ris dang dbang po rnams 'gog pa las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang dang rig byed las thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung du mi 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du mi @208a * //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi dus su phyugs bsad pa rnams las mtho ris dang dbang po rnams 'gog pa las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang dang rig byed las thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung du mi 'gyur ba ji lta ba de bzhin du mi @208a * //
translated: The omniscient speech of the Buddha does not grow from the Vedas.

original: rtag pa dang ma dag pa'i sems las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ma dag pa'i sems las mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Bliss supreme does not arise from a permanent or impure mind.

original: de bas mi dge ba'i las dang sdug bsngal myong bar mi gang gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i sems ni bdud kyi byin gyis brlab par gyur par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas mi dge ba'i las dang sdug bsngal myong bar mi gang gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i sems ni bdud kyi byin gyis brlab par gyur par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind of one who wishes to accomplish mundane and supramundane feats, but who is not engaged in virtuous actions and the experience of suffering, should be understood as being empowered by Mara.

original: de bas na gal te sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par 'dod pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gal te sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs bsgrub par 'dod pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, if one wishes to accomplish the accumulation of merit that has the nature of benefiting sentient beings and the accumulation of nonconceptual wisdom, then that is the power of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'o na bdud rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chad ci'i phyir byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bdud rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chad ci'i phyir byed ce na /
translated: Well then, why do the Maras create obstacles to unsurpassed enlightenment?

original: bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This is explained.

original: gang phyir mya ngan 'das 'gro bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis nyon mongs bdud ni bcom nas te //
analyzed: gang phyir mya ngan 'das 'gro bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis nyon mongs bdud ni bcom nas te //
translated: Because, by the power of the pledge of bliss of the going to nirvana, the afflictive demons are conquered.

original: de phyir nyin bzhin dus su de rnams la ni bdud kyis bgegs rnams du mar byed //
analyzed: de phyir nyin bzhin dus su de rnams la ni bdud kyis bgegs rnams du mar byed //
translated: Therefore, the demons create many obstacles for them at the proper time, every day.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: rgyu gang gi phyir bza' ba dang bsrung ba'i dam tshig gi dbang gis bdud rnams bcom nas rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pa po rnams 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus su de rnams kyi sems ni bdud rnams
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir bza' ba dang bsrung ba'i dam tshig gi dbang gis bdud rnams bcom nas rab tu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pa po rnams 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus su de rnams kyi sems ni bdud rnams
translated: because, by the power of the pledge of eating and protecting, the demons are conquered and the practitioners go to the nonabiding nirvana. For that reason, in the future, the demons

original: kyis 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa'i lam la 'jug par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyis 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa'i lam la 'jug par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: will cause their minds to enter the path of wandering in samsara.

original: de bas na de dag la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo thams cad dor nas phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor bas gang gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'i bde ba de nyid sngon du bsgrub pa bstan par mdzad de ;
analyzed: de bas na de dag la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo thams cad dor nas phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor bas gang gis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa'i bde ba de nyid sngon du bsgrub pa bstan par mdzad de ;
translated: Therefore, having cast aside all the entities of suffering such as these, the method for accomplishing the power of the great seal is taught to be the bliss that is accomplished by the yoga of the four seals.

original: dang po las kyi phyag rgya rgyal ba'i lhan cig skyes bde 'di 'phel don du bsten //
analyzed: dang po las kyi phyag rgya rgyal ba'i lhan cig skyes bde 'di 'phel don du bsten //
translated: First, rely on the karma consort in order to increase the connate bliss of the victor.

original: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs 'dra lus gdong rkang ba gtsug tor yan lag kun rdzogs pa //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i gzugs 'dra lus gdong rkang ba gtsug tor yan lag kun rdzogs pa //
translated: Then, the body is complete with all limbs, the face, feet, and crown protuberance, like the form of the sun.

original: dbyug pa klog gi rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed byed mtshan dang yan lag rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa klog gi rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed byed mtshan dang yan lag rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra is complete with all the characteristics that generate unchanging bliss, which is concordant with the form of a club.

original: rdo rje snang bar byed cing srid gsum la gnas lus ni chos dbyings de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje snang bar byed cing srid gsum la gnas lus ni chos dbyings de nas 'gyur //
translated: The body, abiding in the three existences, is the dharmadhatavagina, which is the vajra.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the root text.

original: 'dir so sor spong bas sems brtan par byas nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig bsgrub pa'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya la brten par bya'i //
analyzed: 'dir so sor spong bas sems brtan par byas nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig bsgrub pa'i phyir las kyi phyag rgya la brten par bya'i //
translated: Here, having stabilized the mind by means of the individual withdrawals, one should rely on a karma consort in order to accomplish the moment of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: bde ba nyams pa'i phyir ni ma yin @208b no ;
analyzed: bde ba nyams pa'i phyir ni ma yin @208b no ;
translated: But not for the sake of the decline of bliss.

original: / de nas yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la chags par bya'o //
analyzed: / de nas yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi gzugs la chags par bya'o //
translated: Then one should become attached to the form of emptiness endowed with all the limbs.

original: phyi nas gzugs de nyid rgyun mi chad par 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo lte ba nas brtsams nas gtsug tor gyi bar du aa wa dh'u t'i'i sgo nas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas gzugs de nyid rgyun mi chad par 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo lte ba nas brtsams nas gtsug tor gyi bar du aa wa dh'u t'i'i sgo nas blta bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should see that very form, the nature of clear light, continuously from the navel up to the crown through the door of the central channel.

original: de ltar byas nas don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished by doing it that way?

original: sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rnams kyis 'od gsal bar gyur pa dang srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rdo rje rnams kyis 'od gsal bar gyur pa dang srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the Great Seal, which is the attainment of the clear light of the vajra body, speech, mind, and gnosis free of obscurations, and the attainment of the nature of the four bodies residing in the three existences.

original: de ltar las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor bas gang mi 'pho bar gyur pa de don dam pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi'i sbyor bas gang mi 'pho bar gyur pa de don dam pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the non-emission of any of the four mudras, such as the karmamudra, is the ultimate co-emergent bliss.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bya ba thams cad bor nas rnal 'byor bas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i phyag rgya bzhi de la dus thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bya ba thams cad bor nas rnal 'byor bas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba ster bar byed pa'i phyag rgya bzhi de la dus thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyis bsten par bya'o //
translated: For that reason, the yogi/nī should always rely on those four mudras, which bestow the supreme unchanging bliss, by forsaking all other activities, with non-conceptuality.

original: drang ba'i don gyis sngon du brjod pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa bzhi la ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir dur khrod la sogs pa'i gnas su kun du spyod pa dang bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i dngos po kun gyis bsnyen
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyis sngon du brjod pa'i las kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa bzhi la ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir dur khrod la sogs pa'i gnas su kun du spyod pa dang bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i dngos po kun gyis bsnyen
