translated: The four mudras, such as the karmamudra, which were mentioned above in the provisional meaning, are to be relied upon with all things, such as the conduct, food, and drink, in places such as charnel grounds, in order to achieve mundane powers.

original: par bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: par bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive meaning.

original: 'o na gal te so sor spong ba la sogs pas sems brtan par gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te so sor spong ba la sogs pas sems brtan par gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: Well then, if the mind becomes stable through the individual abandonments and so forth, what is accomplished?

original: don ci 'grub ce na rlung rnams zhes bya ba ni /🔽'dir gal te stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi lta bas srog la sogs pa'i rlung bcu ni lte bar phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ci 'grub ce na rlung rnams zhes bya ba ni / 'dir gal te stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi lta bas srog la sogs pa'i rlung bcu ni lte bar phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: The winds are united at the navel.

original: de rnams lte bar phrad par gyur na lte bar gnas pa'i ye shes kyi me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtum mo sbar ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams lte bar phrad par gyur na lte bar gnas pa'i ye shes kyi me'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtum mo sbar ba'o //
translated: Here, if the ten winds such as life are united at the navel through the view of the form of emptiness, the caṇḍālī fire, which has the nature of the gnosis existing at the navel, is ignited.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis dpral bar sra ba'i ngo bos gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams ni 'dzag par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis dpral bar sra ba'i ngo bos gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rnams ni 'dzag par byed do //
translated: The light rays of that fire cause the drops of bodhicitta, which exist at the forehead in the nature of solidity, to drip.

original: thig le de rnams gsang ba'i gnas su gnas par gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig thob par 'gyur te mi 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thig le de rnams gsang ba'i gnas su gnas par gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i skad cig thob par 'gyur te mi 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When those drops arrive at the secret place, the moment of supreme unchanging bliss is attained because they do not move.

original: phyi nas rgyu de yis brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la skye ba 'di nyid du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rgyu de yis brtson 'grus dang ldan par gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la skye ba 'di nyid du phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub ba'o //
translated: Later, by that cause, the yogis who are endowed with effort will attain the power of the Great Seal in this very life.

original: yang na rnal 'byor ma rdzogs par 'chi bar @209a * //
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ma rdzogs par 'chi bar @209a * //
translated: Or, if one dies before the yoga is complete,

original: gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: then,

original: mi'i skye ba bdun gyi sngon gyi stong pa nyid kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i skye ba bdun gyi sngon gyi stong pa nyid kyi bag chags kyi dbang gis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: it is certain that everything will be accomplished by the power of the latent tendencies of emptiness in the seven previous human rebirths.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: That is not explained by the Bodhisattva, etc.,

original: gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma dkrol lo //
analyzed: gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ma dkrol lo //
translated: because it is clear.

original: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa bstan par mdzad de //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mdzad pa bstan par mdzad de //
translated: Now, the deeds of the Blessed Buddha are taught.

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In sentient beings, etc.,

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams dang nad dang dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bzhugs par mdzad pa de sems can rnams smin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi khams dang nad dang dkyil 'khor du bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bzhugs par mdzad pa de sems can rnams smin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: here, the Blessed One abides in the world-realm, in the illness, and in the maṇḍala in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: de nyid nges pa'i don du ni srog gi rlung gis kun du spyod pa'i dbang gis gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su dngos po thams cad la sems 'jug pa ni phyi rol du bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid nges pa'i don du ni srog gi rlung gis kun du spyod pa'i dbang gis gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs su dngos po thams cad la sems 'jug pa ni phyi rol du bzhugs pa'o //
translated: That, in its definitive meaning, is the mind entering into all things in the state of sleep by the power of the life-force wind's activity, which is the abiding externally.

original: de bzhin dus la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga la phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i gtso bor gyur ba'i sems gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin dus la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga la phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i gtso bor gyur ba'i sems gnas pa ni /
translated: Likewise, the mind's abiding as the principal factor of the aggregates, constituents, and so forth in the five maṇḍalas of the directions and so forth,

original: de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha gar bzhugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha gar bzhugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the abiding in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sems 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa'i yul rnams la sems 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the mind's entering into the objects of sound and so forth is the abiding in the maṇḍala wheel.

original: ae wam yi ge la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i gnas skabs su sku dang / gsung dang thugs 'jug par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ae wam yi ge la bzhugs pa gang yin pa de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i gnas skabs su sku dang / gsung dang thugs 'jug par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which abides in the letters e and vaṃ is the entry of the body, speech, and mind into the state of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gcig pu ni gnas gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can gcig pu ni gnas gsum gyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the one Blessed One with a vajra is threefold by the division of the three abodes.

original: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po dang yul rnams dngos po gsum gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang dbang po dang yul rnams dngos po gsum gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the elements, faculties, and objects are surrounded by the three things.

original: sku gsum gyi dbye bas don gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi dbye bas don gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: By the division of the three bodies, he becomes the nature of the three meanings.

original: phyi dang nang dang dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa ni gnas gsum la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa ni gnas gsum la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Residing in the outer, inner, and mandala is residing in the three abodes.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad nas srid pa gsum la bzhugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa gsum la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad nas srid pa gsum la bzhugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having benefited sentient beings residing in the three existences of desire, form, and formlessness, he resides in the three existences.

original: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyud kyi rgyal po rnams las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de /
translated: Likewise, in the king of tantras, whatever is called thus have I heard,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mkhyen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mkhyen pa yin gyi /
translated: is known by the Blessed One himself.

original: gzhan gyi kha las snyan gyis thos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi kha las snyan gyis thos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not heard by the ear from the mouth of another.

original: nyid kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he himself taught it.

original: bcom ldan 'das de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that Bhagavat?

original: @209b rdo rje can ni gang zhig zla ba zhu las spyi mgrin snying pad lte ba gsang ba ru //
analyzed: @209b rdo rje can ni gang zhig zla ba zhu las spyi mgrin snying pad lte ba gsang ba ru //
translated: The one who is vajra-possessing, who descends from the moon, from the forehead, throat, heart, navel, and secret lotus

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: rang rig pa'i bde ba'i ngo bos dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams las mar byon la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi thig le gsum gyi mtha' mar ye shes kyi thig le'i ngo bos lhan cig skyes ba'i bde ba ster nas bud med kyi bha gar
analyzed: rang rig pa'i bde ba'i ngo bos dpral ba la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams las mar byon la lus dang ngag dang sems kyi thig le gsum gyi mtha' mar ye shes kyi thig le'i ngo bos lhan cig skyes ba'i bde ba ster nas bud med kyi bha gar
translated: that the essence of the bliss of self-awareness descends from the forehead cakra, and so on, and, in the end, the three bindus of body, voice, and mind, with the essence of the gnosis bindu, bestows connate bliss in the bhaga of the woman.

original: gang 'pho bar gyur pa de drang ba'i don gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can yin te /
analyzed: gang 'pho bar gyur pa de drang ba'i don gyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can yin te /
translated: The one who moves there is the Bhagavat who is vajra-possessing in the interpretable meaning.

original: de nyid nges pa'i don gyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bhi ga ni bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i 'khor lo bzhi yin la /
analyzed: de nyid nges pa'i don gyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bhi ga ni bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i 'khor lo bzhi yin la /
translated: In the definitive meaning, the bhaga of the vajra queen is the four cakras, such as the great bliss cakra, and so on.

original: 'khor lo de rnams la sku la sogs pa'i thig le bzhi mi 'pho ba'i ngo bos gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'khor lo de rnams la sku la sogs pa'i thig le bzhi mi 'pho ba'i ngo bos gnas pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The Bhagavān Vajra Holder is said to abide by the nature of the four bindus of body and so on not moving in those cakras.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi zhing la zhugs nas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad par shes par bya ba ni bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi zhing la zhugs nas sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad par shes par bya ba ni bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavān has taught that one should understand that he, who is such, benefits sentient beings by entering the buddhafields.

original: sangs rgyas zhing la rab zhugs bcom ldan 'das de rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing la rab zhugs bcom ldan 'das de rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavān, who has entered the buddhafields, should be known by the yogis.

original: de ltar mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi bag chags kyi dbye ba du mas tha dad par mthong bar bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de sems can rnams kyi rang rang gi bag chags kyi dbye ba du mas tha dad par mthong bar bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, who is of the nature of supreme unchanging bliss, is seen by sentient beings as different due to their many individual traces.

original: gcig ni du mar mthong ste ;
analyzed: gcig ni du mar mthong ste ;
translated: One is seen as many.

original: smon lam yon tan dbang gis zhing dang 'dod chags la sogs ngo bos so //
analyzed: smon lam yon tan dbang gis zhing dang 'dod chags la sogs ngo bos so //
translated: By the power of aspirations and qualities, through the nature of desire and so on.

original: 'khor lo la bzhugs skye ba snga mar rang snying las skyes bag chags stobs kyis so //
analyzed: 'khor lo la bzhugs skye ba snga mar rang snying las skyes bag chags stobs kyis so //
translated: The speech of the one who is seated on the wheel, due to the power of the habitual tendencies born from his own heart in a previous birth,

original: don gcig du ma'i skad ni srog chags rang rang dngos kyi sems la rab tu 'jug /'khor lo la bzhugs ljongs la rab tu gshegs te gnas ldan rnams kyi bsod nams don //
analyzed: don gcig du ma'i skad ni srog chags rang rang dngos kyi sems la rab tu 'jug /'khor lo la bzhugs ljongs la rab tu gshegs te gnas ldan rnams kyi bsod nams don //
translated: is the same in the many languages of the various creatures, and, seated on the wheel, he goes to the various countries and the meaning of the merit of those who have the abode.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what it says.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'i dus su bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa'i khyim pa rnams kyis rang khyim du bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms la byon par mthong zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi kyang sems can rnams la bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la bzhugs pa'i dus su bsod nams dang ldan par gyur pa'i khyim pa rnams kyis rang khyim du bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms la byon par mthong zhing bcom ldan 'das kyi kyang sems can rnams la bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags par bya ba'i phyir
translated: At the time of being seated on the wheel of Dharma, the householders who have become meritorious see the Blessed One coming to their homes for alms, and the Blessed One, in order to accumulate the collection of merit for sentient beings,

original: de bzhin du mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: acts accordingly.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the characteristics of the Blessed One's body,

original: gsung ji lta bu yin pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: gsung ji lta bu yin pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: he teaches what his speech is like.

original: dud 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dud 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the speech of animals, and so on,
here,

original: 'gro ba drug la gnas par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la rang rang gi skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ster bar mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yin gyi lha rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug la gnas par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad la rang rang gi skad kyis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ster bar mdzad pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yin gyi lha rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: The speech of the Blessed One is that which bestows mundane and supramundane powers to all sentient beings abiding in the six realms, in their respective languages. It is not the speech of the gods.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzad pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ma rtogs te /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzad pa ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ma rtogs te /
translated: For that reason, the deeds of the Blessed One are not realized even by the buddhas who have attained nirvāṇa with remainder,

original: sems can phal pa rnams la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can phal pa rnams la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: let alone ordinary sentient beings.

original: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: bcom ldan 'das ngo bo las ma skyes par sku'i snang ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngo bo las ma skyes par sku'i snang ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One has taught that the appearances of the kāyas and so forth are not born from an essence.

original: dper na nam mkha' la 'ja' tshon dang rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i nam mkha' chu'i nang du snang ba bzhin du zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la 'ja' tshon dang rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa'i nam mkha' chu'i nang du snang ba bzhin du zhes pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like a rainbow in the sky and the appearance of space in water, which is beyond subtle particles.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gang yin pa de phung po la sogs pa spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gang yin pa de phung po la sogs pa spangs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the body of the Lord is free from the aggregates, etc., and is endowed with all the aspects.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi rang rang gi bsam pa dang mthun par mdzad pa ni gsung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi rang rang gi bsam pa dang mthun par mdzad pa ni gsung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the speech of the Lord is the accomplishment of the aims of all sentient beings in accordance with their individual aspirations.

original: sems can thams cad la bsags pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bsags pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i sems ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs so //
translated: The mind of the Lord is the mind that abides in the nature of the accumulation for all sentient beings.

original: shel bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin bzung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: shel bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin bzung ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes so //
translated: The gnosis of the Lord is the apprehension of the nature of all things, like a crystal.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i me tog bzhin gang yang min pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sgrib pa med pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha'i me tog bzhin gang yang min pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, the Lord Buddha is the embodiment of the body, speech, mind, and gnosis that are free from obscurations. He is not totally nonexistent, like a flower in the sky.

original: da ni lha rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni lha rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the purity of the gods is taught.

original: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Generosity and so forth” and so on.

original: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnal 'byor bas gang lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sgom par byed pa de de rnams kyi dgongs pa ni nges pa'i don gyis gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnal 'byor bas gang lha dang lha mo rnams kyi sgom par byed pa de de rnams kyi dgongs pa ni nges pa'i don gyis gzhan yin te /
translated: Here, the contemplation of the creation stage yogī/nī, whatever they meditate on as gods and goddesses, that is their intention, which is of definitive meaning.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dang sna tshogs yum ni thabs dang shes rab la snyoms par zhugs pa dngos po gang zhig yin gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo dang sna tshogs yum ni thabs dang shes rab la snyoms par zhugs pa dngos po gang zhig yin gyi skyes pa dang bud med kyi sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Kālacakra and Viśvamātā are in union with method and wisdom, which is the actual thing, and not the union of male and female.

original: de bzhin du dkar mo 'bar ba la sogs pa lha mo rnams gang yin pa de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar mo 'bar ba la sogs pa lha mo rnams gang yin pa de sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sam /
translated: Similarly, whatever goddesses there are, such as Jvālamālinī and so on, they should be understood as the perfections of generosity and so on,

original: yang na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: or as the signs such as smoke and so on.

original: de bzhin @210b du sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams kyi bar na gnas pa'i bum pa rnams ni sgrib pa med pa'i klad pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin @210b du sangs rgyas dang lha mo rnams kyi bar na gnas pa'i bum pa rnams ni sgrib pa med pa'i klad pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the vases situated between the Buddhas and the Goddesses are the unobstructed elements of the head, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i zhabs gnyis kyi gdan du gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i lha dang drag po ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bdud dang nyon mongs pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i zhabs gnyis kyi gdan du gyur pa'i 'dod pa'i lha dang drag po ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa'i dkyil 'khor lnga lnga'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bdud dang nyon mongs pa zad pa'o //
translated: The gods of the desire realm and Rudra, who are the seats of the two feet of Lord Kalachakra, are the exhaustion of the five right and five left maṇḍalas, which are the nature of Mara and the afflictions.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa bzhi ni sgrib pa med pa'i lus la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pa bzhi ni sgrib pa med pa'i lus la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four, the wish-fulfilling tree, etc., are the four unobstructed bodies, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa phyag rgya drug ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa phyag rgya drug ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The six mudras, Lord Kalachakra, etc., are the six consciousnesses, such as the body consciousness, in a state of purity.

original: dngos po thams cad skyed par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' shes dang shes bya'i bdag nyid gcig pu'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skyed par mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' shes dang shes bya'i bdag nyid gcig pu'o //
translated: The single nature of the knower and the known is Lord Vajrasattva, the creator of all things.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan drug gi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan drug gi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Likewise, the six signs such as the wheel of the six transcendent lords are taught as the purities.🔽The wheel, etc.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma 'khor lo gang yin pa de sgrib pa med pa khams gsum gyi rtags yin gyi lcags la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma 'khor lo gang yin pa de sgrib pa med pa khams gsum gyi rtags yin gyi lcags la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no
translated: Here, the wheel, which is the sign of the transcendent lord Vairochana, is the sign of the three realms free of obscuration, not of the nature of substances such as iron.

original: // de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan ma ni rin chen te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan gyi mtshan ma ni rin chen te mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the jewel is the sign of Ratnasambhava, which is supreme unchanging bliss.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma padma ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba nyid la zhen pa'i ma 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi mtshan ma padma ni mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba nyid la zhen pa'i ma 'dod pa'o //
translated: The lotus is the sign of Amitabha, which is the non-attachment to supreme unchanging bliss.

original: bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i mtshan ma ral gri ni nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa'i mtshan ma ral gri ni nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The sword is the sign of Amoghasiddhi, which cuts all afflictions.

original: mi bskyod pa'i mtshan ma rdo rje ni rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i mtshan ma rdo rje ni rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The sign of Akshobhya is the vajra, which is the gnosis body that has become the nature of indivisibility like a vajra.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rtags gri gug ni mi shes pa'i bya ba ma rig pa gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rtags gri gug ni mi shes pa'i bya ba ma rig pa gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: The sign of Bhagavat Vajrasattva is the curved knife, which severs the activity of ignorance, i.e., nescience.

original: rigs drug po de rnams las lha dang lha mo rnams gang skyes par gyur pa de rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs drug po de rnams las lha dang lha mo rnams gang skyes par gyur pa de rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: From among those six families, one should know that the gods and goddesses that are born are also like that.

original: de ni 'di ltar rig bya mkha' bzhin ro mnyam phung po khams dang dbang po sogs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar rig bya mkha' bzhin ro mnyam phung po khams dang dbang po sogs shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should know that the aggregates, elements, faculties, etc. are of the same taste as space.

original: 'o na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what about Vairochana, etc.?

original: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽dngos po gang las skye ba dang gzugs mnyam @211a * //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dngos po gang las skye ba dang gzugs mnyam @211a * //
translated: In whatever, etc.

original: par gyur pa'i dngos po de ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yin te /
analyzed: par gyur pa'i dngos po de ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yin te /
translated: The entity from which one is born and the entity with which one's form becomes the same is Bhagavat Vairochana.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the aggregate of form that is free from obscuration.

original: de bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gang du mnyam par gyur pa de bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gang du mnyam par gyur pa de bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan yin te /
translated: Similarly, the one in whom the suffering of cyclic existence, such as birth and death, is equalized is the Blessed One Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i tshor ba'i phung po yin la dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba myong bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i tshor ba'i phung po yin la dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba myong bar mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: He is the aggregate of feeling that is free from obscuration and always experiences supreme unchanging bliss.

original: gang du bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams nyams par gyur ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po ni snang ba mtha' yas yin te /
analyzed: gang du bum pa dang ka ba la sogs pa dang yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ming rnams nyams par gyur ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i 'du shes kyi phung po ni snang ba mtha' yas yin te /
translated: The one in whom the aggregate of perception that is free from obscuration, in which the names of vase, pillar, etc. and existence, nonexistence, etc. are lost, is Amitābha.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis brag ca bzhin du chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skad kyis brag ca bzhin du chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He teaches the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma like an echo with the languages of all sentient beings.

original: dngos po gang la yang nas yang du 'khor ba'i 'phel ba nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la yang nas yang du 'khor ba'i 'phel ba nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po ni don yod grub pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of formations that is unobstructed and free from the obscurations of the increase and decrease of any entity is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las 'das pa'i dus thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las 'das pa'i dus thams cad nam mkha' bzhin du'o //
translated: Like space, he is beyond increase and decrease at all times.

original: gang du gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni phung po mi bskyod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa ni phung po mi bskyod pa yin te /
translated: The aggregate of consciousness that is unobstructed and free from the obscurations of the states of sleep and so on is Akshobhya.

original: dus thams cad du chos nyid gcig pa la bzhugs zhes bya ba'o //🔽de bzhin du 'pho ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am ma rig pa gang du nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin gyi kha dog
analyzed: dus thams cad du chos nyid gcig pa la bzhugs zhes bya ba'o // de bzhin du 'pho ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am ma rig pa gang du nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin gyi kha dog
translated: He is said to abide in the single reality at all times.

original: dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the aggregate of gnosis that is unobstructed and free from the obscurations of the nature of transference or ignorance is the nondual gnosis of the Bhagavat Vajrasattva, free from attachment, and not the nature of color and shape.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi sgrib pa med pa'i dngos po thams cad skyed par mdzad pa'i phyir /🔽rigs drug tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi sgrib pa med pa'i dngos po thams cad skyed par mdzad pa'i phyir / rigs drug tu gyur pa'o //
translated: In this way, by the process of expression, the six transcendent lords, Vairochana and so forth, are the six families, because they generate all things that are free of obscuration.

original: de bzhin du sgrib pa med pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams drug ni lha mo spyan ma la sogs pa drug tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrib pa med pa'i sa la sogs pa'i khams drug ni lha mo spyan ma la sogs pa drug tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the six elements, the element of space and so forth, are the six goddesses Locana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: gang du gti mug ma lus nyams par gyur pa de ni spyan ma la sogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang du gti mug ma lus nyams par gyur pa de ni spyan ma la sogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Where delusion is completely destroyed, that is Locana and so forth.

original: blang bya dang dor bya la sogs pa mi shes pa'i blo gang @211b du nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i sa'i khams ni lha mo spyan ma ste /
analyzed: blang bya dang dor bya la sogs pa mi shes pa'i blo gang @211b du nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i sa'i khams ni lha mo spyan ma ste /
translated: The element of earth, free of obscuration, where the mind that does not know what to adopt and what to reject is destroyed, is the goddess Locana.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems so //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems so //
translated: It is the mind free of delusion.

original: gang du rigs la sogs pa'i nga rgyal nyams par gyur pa chu'i khams ni m'a ma k'i ste /
analyzed: gang du rigs la sogs pa'i nga rgyal nyams par gyur pa chu'i khams ni m'a ma k'i ste /
translated: Where pride in caste and so forth is destroyed, the element of water is Mamaki.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nga rgyal chen po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nga rgyal chen po'o //
translated: It is the great pride that transcends the world.

original: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i bag chags nyams pa'i sgrib pa me'i khams ni gos dkar mo yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor ba'i bag chags nyams pa'i sgrib pa me'i khams ni gos dkar mo yin te /
translated: Similarly, the fire element, which is the obscuration that is the degeneration of the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence, is Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la zhen pa'o //
translated: She is the attachment to supreme, unchanging bliss at all times.

original: gang du bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa'i phrag dog nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rlung gi khams ni lha mo sgrol ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du bud med dang byis pa la sogs pa'i phrag dog nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rlung gi khams ni lha mo sgrol ma yin te /
translated: The wind element, which is the obscuration that is the degeneration of the jealousy of women, children, and so on, is Tārā.

original: dus thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la phrag dog byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du phyag rgya chen po la phrag dog byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: She is the one who is jealous of the great seal at all times.

original: de bzhin du phal ba'i zhe sdang nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i nam mkha'i khams ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phal ba'i zhe sdang nyams par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i nam mkha'i khams ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma ste /
translated: Similarly, the space element, which is the obscuration that is the degeneration of ordinary hatred, is Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la zhe sdang mdzad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la zhe sdang mdzad ces bya ba'o //
translated: She is the one who is said to hate the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du nor dang bud med pa la sogs pa'i ser sna gang du zad par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi khams ni bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs yum yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nor dang bud med pa la sogs pa'i ser sna gang du zad par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi khams ni bcom ldan 'das ma sna tshogs yum yin la /
translated: Likewise, the element of unobstructed intuition, in which the stinginess of wealth, women, and so on is exhausted, is the Transcendent Lord's mother, Prajñāpāramitā.

original: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba mi dor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba mi dor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called never abandoning supreme, unchanging bliss at any time.

original: de bzhin du mngon sum mam lkog tu gyur pa'i gzugs ni nam mkha' dang yid las gang gis mthong ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i mig gi dbang po ni byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon sum mam lkog tu gyur pa'i gzugs ni nam mkha' dang yid las gang gis mthong ba'i sgrib pa med pa'i mig gi dbang po ni byang chub sems dpa' sa'i snying po'o //
translated: Likewise, the unobstructed eye faculty, by which one sees forms that are either manifest or hidden, in space and in the mind, is the bodhisattva Kṣitigarbha.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi skad gsal por gang gis thos pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rna ba ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi skad gsal por gang gis thos pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rna ba ni phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: The unobstructed ear, by which one clearly hears the languages of all sentient beings dwelling in the worlds of the ten directions, is Vajrapāṇi.

original: mngon sum mam lkog tu gyur pa'i dri bzang po gang gis 'dzin pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i sa ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: mngon sum mam lkog tu gyur pa'i dri bzang po gang gis 'dzin pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i sa ni nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The unobstructed nose, by which one apprehends the good smells of things that are either manifest or hidden, is Ākāśagarbha.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi gang gis myong bar byed pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i zla ba'i bdud rtsi gang gis myong bar byed pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i lce ni 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: The tongue of the Lord of the World is the unobstructed organ of taste, by which one experiences the nectar of the moon, which has the nature of supreme changelessness.

original: snyoms par zhugs ba'i reg bya sgrib pa med pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs ba'i reg bya sgrib pa med pa'i lus kyi dbang po ni sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva Samantabhadra is the unobstructed organ of touch, which is the body of the one who is absorbed in union, and which removes all obscurations.

original: gang zhig thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la 'jug par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i yid kyi dbang po ni byang chub sems dpa' kun @212a * //🔽du bzang po zhes bya ba'o //🔽de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sgrib med yul dang yul can ni /
analyzed: gang zhig thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la 'jug par gyur pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i yid kyi dbang po ni byang chub sems dpa' kun @212a * // du bzang po zhes bya ba'o // de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas sgrib med yul dang yul can ni /
translated: The Bodhisattva Mañjughoṣa is the unobstructed organ of mind, which is the entrance to the bliss of supreme changelessness, which has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo rnams yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang lha mo rnams yin gyi /
translated: In this way, the unobstructed objects and subjects are the Bodhisattvas and goddesses,

original: rten cing 'brel pa las skyes pa dang nyi tshe ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa las skyes pa dang nyi tshe ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not those that are produced from dependent origination and are limited.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This is taught:

original: bye ba drug gi tha dad yul dang yul can 'di rnams sras bcas byang chub sems dpa' rnams //
analyzed: bye ba drug gi tha dad yul dang yul can 'di rnams sras bcas byang chub sems dpa' rnams //
translated: These objects and subjects, which are different in the six classes of beings, are the domain of the bodhisattvas and the buddhas.

original: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan la sogs 'di ni rgyal ba mchog gi yul te //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan la sogs 'di ni rgyal ba mchog gi yul te //
translated: This object, such as a reflection of form, is the domain of the supreme victors.

original: kun nas dang ba ma skyes 'gag med mchog gi bde byed rnyog pa med pa ye shes kyis bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dang ba ma skyes 'gag med mchog gi bde byed rnyog pa med pa ye shes kyis bgrod pa'o //
translated: It is clear, unborn, unceasing, the supreme bliss, unclouded, and traversed by gnosis.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bas na dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bag chags dang bral bas na dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “clear” because it is free from the habitual tendencies of cyclic existence.

original: sgrib pa med par gyur pas na ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med par gyur pas na ma skyes pa'o //
translated: It is “unborn” because it is free from obscurations.

original: phyi nas gos par mi 'gyur bas ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas gos par mi 'gyur bas ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: It is “unceasing” because it is not sullied later on.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das par gyur pas na mchog gi bde ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad las 'das par gyur pas na mchog gi bde ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is “the supreme bliss” because it transcends worldly conventions.

original: mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas na rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas na rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is “unclouded” because it is nonconceptual by nature.

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag par gyur pas na ye shes kyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin gyis dag par gyur pas na ye shes kyi zhes pa'o //
translated: It is “traversed by gnosis” because it is pure by nature as nondual.

original: de lta bu'i yul rnams ni gang gis 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yul rnams ni gang gis 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Who is it that apprehends such objects?

original: khams gsum gzhan gyis bzung bar mi 'gyur 'gro ba kun gyi dbang po'i sgo yis spyod //
analyzed: khams gsum gzhan gyis bzung bar mi 'gyur 'gro ba kun gyi dbang po'i sgo yis spyod //
translated: The doors of the senses of all beings are not seized by others in the three realms.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: dbang po de lta bur gyur pa rnams kyis ni yin gyi nye bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po de lta bur gyur pa rnams kyis ni yin gyi nye bas ni ma yin no //
translated: because they are like that, not because of proximity.🔽Now, in order to teach the joy of summoning the gnosis being, and so on,

original: da ni ye shes sems dpa' dgug pa la sogs pa'i dga' ba bstan par mdzad de ye shes spyan drangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni ye shes sems dpa' dgug pa la sogs pa'i dga' ba bstan par mdzad de ye shes spyan drangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, “the gnosis being is summoned,” and so on.

original: 'dir drang ba'i don gyi ye shes sems dpa' gang yin pa de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin la /
analyzed: 'dir drang ba'i don gyi ye shes sems dpa' gang yin pa de mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems yin la /
translated: Here, the provisional gnosis being is the bodhicitta that has the nature of supreme, immutable bliss.

original: khro bo'i rgyal po bgegs mthar byed kyis spyan 'dren pa ni /
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po bgegs mthar byed kyis spyan 'dren pa ni /
translated: The gnosis being is summoned by Kṣitigarbha,

original: srog la sogs pa rlung gi tshogs kyis dpral bar gang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa rlung gi tshogs kyis dpral bar gang bar byed pa'o //
translated: who is filled with the assembly of the prāṇa and so on at the brow.

original: de nas shes rab mthar byed kyis gzhug pa ni /
analyzed: de nas shes rab mthar byed kyis gzhug pa ni /
translated: Then, the gnosis being is caused to enter by Prajñānta,

original: me'i khams ni zhu bar byas nas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me'i khams ni zhu bar byas nas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor lo rnams la 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: who melts the fire element and causes it to enter the cakras of the throat, and so on.

original: gshin rje mthar byed kyis bcing ba ni sa'i khams kyi gsang ba'i padma las 'gro bar mi ster ba'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed kyis bcing ba ni sa'i khams kyi gsang ba'i padma las 'gro bar mi ster ba'o //
translated: Yama's noose is the secret lotus of the earth element, which does not allow him to go.

original: padma mthar byed kyis de la mnyes pa ni mi 'pho @212b ba'i khams kyi phung po la bde ba ster bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: padma mthar byed kyis de la mnyes pa ni mi 'pho @212b ba'i khams kyi phung po la bde ba ster bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: Padmanateśvara is the aggregate of the unmoving wind element, which gives him pleasure.

original: rim pa de lta bas na 'og tu byang chub kyi sems de nyid steng du ldog par gyur na rnal 'byor ba'i bdud la sogs pa rnams nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa de lta bas na 'og tu byang chub kyi sems de nyid steng du ldog par gyur na rnal 'byor ba'i bdud la sogs pa rnams nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since that is the process, when the bodhicitta returns upward, the yogi's māras and so on are destroyed.

original: gzhan yang gsung gi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams spros pa'i dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsung gi 'khor lo la gnas pa'i tsar tsi ka la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams spros pa'i dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of emanating the goddesses such as Cācī who reside in the wheel of awakened speech?

original: brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: brjod par mdzad de /
translated: It is stated:

original: yi dags rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yi dags rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The hungry ghosts

original: 'dir gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'i yi dags rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir tsa rtsi ka la sogs pa rnams spro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa'i yi dags rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir tsa rtsi ka la sogs pa rnams spro ba'o //
translated: Here, in order to ripen the hungry ghosts such as Aparājita, Cācī and so on are emanated.

original: de bzhin du mi rnams bsrung ba'i phyir brgya byin la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rnams bsrung ba'i phyir brgya byin la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, for the protection of humans, there are Indra and so on.

original: klu rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi bsam pa dang mthun par rgyal ba la sogs klu rnams bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: klu rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi bsam pa dang mthun par rgyal ba la sogs klu rnams bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: For the sake of ripening the nagas, the Victorious Ones, in accordance with their wishes, emanate the nagas, such as Takshaka, as the Blessed One Vajrapani.

original: lha ma yin rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi rigs su gyur pa'i khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams spro bar mdzad do //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir de rnams kyi rigs su gyur pa'i khyi gdong ma la sogs pa rnams spro bar mdzad do //
translated: For the sake of ripening the demigods, they emanate as the dog-faced and so on, who are of their kind.

original: de bzhin du mdor bsdus par dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'byung po la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dang rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams dang rigs sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sngags rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa
analyzed: de bzhin du mdor bsdus par dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'byung po la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dang rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams dang rigs sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sngags rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa
translated: Likewise, in brief, whatever things there are, such as the spirits that dwell in the mandala, and the tantras of the male and female practitioners, and the mantras that have the nature of various families, which the Blessed One has taught,

original: de thams cad sems can rnams la don grub par rig par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de thams cad sems can rnams la don grub par rig par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: all of them should be known as accomplishing the purpose for sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo 'di las dbang po 'bring por gyur pa dang dbang po mchog tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi dbang dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyud kyi rgyal po dus kyi 'khor lo 'di las dbang po 'bring por gyur pa dang dbang po mchog tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi dbang dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, in this King of Tantras, the Wheel of Time, the Lord Buddha taught the mundane and supramundane initiations in accordance with the aspirations of sentient beings of middling and superior faculties.

original: de la chu la sogs pa'i dbang bdun dang las kyi phyag rgya'i dkar 'dzin gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bum pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang chos kyi 'byung gnas la lta ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gsang ba dang / dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shes rab ye shes dang /
analyzed: de la chu la sogs pa'i dbang bdun dang las kyi phyag rgya'i dkar 'dzin gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bum pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba dang chos kyi 'byung gnas la lta ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gsang ba dang / dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i shes rab ye shes dang /
translated: Among them, the seven initiations beginning with the water initiation and the vase initiation, which is of the nature of the retention of the karmamudra, the secret initiation, which is of the nature of the view of the amṛta taste and the phenomena source, and the wisdom-knowledge initiation, which is of the nature of the union of the two organs,

original: thig le bzhi 'pho ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gang yin pa de thams cad 'jig rten pa'i dbang du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thig le bzhi 'pho ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gang yin pa de thams cad 'jig rten pa'i dbang du shes par bya'o //
translated: and whatever is of the nature of the four-drop transference states should all be understood as the mundane initiations.

original: 'o na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the supramundane empowerment?

original: brjod par mdzad de /🔽'jig rten @213a * //
analyzed: brjod par mdzad de / 'jig rten @213a * //
translated: It is stated:🔽The supramundane empowerment is the passion for the excellent

original: las 'das dbang gang rgyal ba mchog gi bdag po'i phyag rgya bzang la rjes chags pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las 'das dbang gang rgyal ba mchog gi bdag po'i phyag rgya bzang la rjes chags pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: seal of the supreme Victor, the Lord.

original: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “victors” are the Bhagavans Vairochana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin la mchog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin la mchog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The “Lord” of those is the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, who is “supreme.”

original: de'i phyag rgya ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo ste /
translated: His “seal” is the great seal, which is the nature of emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects.

original: las kyi phyag rgya las khyad par du gyur pas na bzang po yin la /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya las khyad par du gyur pas na bzang po yin la /
translated: It is “excellent” because it is superior to the action seal.

original: yang na bla na med pa'i byang chub ster bar mdzad pas na bzang mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa'i byang chub ster bar mdzad pas na bzang mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is called “excellent” because it bestows unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: de la rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan du sems kyi de nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan du sems kyi de nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: “ Passion” for that is the observation of the reality of the mind day and night.

original: so sor sdud pa la sogs pas de dang lhan cig tu sems ro mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa la sogs pas de dang lhan cig tu sems ro mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The transcendent power is the equal taste of the mind with that [power] through withdrawal, etc.

original: phyag rgya chen mo de nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo de nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that great seal?

original: sems kyi snang ba tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i gzugs ni rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam yin gyi phyi rol gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi snang ba tsam zhes bya ba ni 'dir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i gzugs ni rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam yin gyi phyi rol gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: The text says, It is merely an appearance of the mind. Here, the form of the great seal, which is the nature of emptiness, is merely an appearance of one's own mind, and not an external thing,

original: rang gi sems la snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems la snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears to one's own mind.

original: 'o na de gang nas byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de gang nas byung zhe na /
translated: Well, where does it come from?

original: rang gi yid las skyes zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi brin gyis rang gi sems las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi yid las skyes zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi brin gyis rang gi sems las skyes pa ste /
translated: The text says, It arises from one's own mind, meaning that it arises from one's own mind through the cause of emptiness.

original: dper na rang gi gdong pa me long gi gzugs brnyan du rang la snang bar gyur pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na rang gi gdong pa me long gi gzugs brnyan du rang la snang bar gyur pa bzhin du'o //
translated: For example, it is like one's own face appearing in a mirror.

original: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen mo gang yin pa de la bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsten par bya'o ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya chen mo gang yin pa de la bla na med pa'i byang chub bsgrub pa'i phyir khyad par du gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bsten par bya'o ;
translated: The yogins who are especially devoted to her in order to achieve unsurpassed enlightenment should rely on her.

original: / rnal 'byor pa las ma gtogs par gzhan gang gis de la brten zhe na /
analyzed: / rnal 'byor pa las ma gtogs par gzhan gang gis de la brten zhe na /
translated: Other than the yogins, who else should rely on her?

original: gang la rgyal ba ma lus sras dang sangs rgyas kyis bsten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang la rgyal ba ma lus sras dang sangs rgyas kyis bsten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “She is relied upon by all the victors, together with their sons and the buddhas.”

original: 'das pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang la brten par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang la brten par mdzad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the past, she was relied upon by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de bsten pas don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de bsten pas don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished by relying on her?

original: ye shes snang ba de ni rab tu sangs na bdud dpung yul bcas ma lus sreg par byed //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes snang ba de ni rab tu sangs na bdud dpung yul bcas ma lus sreg par byed // ces bya ba ni /
translated: “When that light of gnosis is fully arisen, it burns all the armies of Māra and their objects.”

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis ye shes kyi 'od zer de bzhengs par gyur na yul dang yul can dang bcas pa'i bdud kyi tshogs @213b sreg par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i yan lag drug gis ye shes kyi 'od zer de bzhengs par gyur na yul dang yul can dang bcas pa'i bdud kyi tshogs @213b sreg par mdzad de /
translated: Here, when that light of gnosis is arisen by means of the six limbs of union, it burns the hosts of Māra together with their objects.

original: dngos po thams cad sgrib pa med pas mdzad //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad sgrib pa med pas mdzad //
translated: all things are accomplished without obscuration.

original: ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: des don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: des don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished by that?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus la mnyam pa'i bde ster rnal 'byor las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus la mnyam pa'i bde ster rnal 'byor las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The verse beginning with Attachment, etc. bestow bliss equally on the yogis' bodies means:

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer des bdud kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa phung po rnams sgrib pa med par mdzad nas dpral ba nas byang chub sems 'dzag par mdzad de /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer des bdud kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa phung po rnams sgrib pa med par mdzad nas dpral ba nas byang chub sems 'dzag par mdzad de /
translated: By that light of intuition, having accomplished the aggregates, which are of the nature of demons, without obscuration, he causes the bodhicitta to drip from the forehead.

original: byang chub kyi sems de mar byung ba'i dus su dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi ster bar mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de mar byung ba'i dus su dga' ba la sogs pa bzhi ster bar mdzad do //
translated: When that bodhicitta comes out, it bestows the four joys, etc.

original: de nas rdo rje rtse nas yar ldog pa'i dus su mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ni lo'i sbyor bas ster bar mdzad ces pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rtse nas yar ldog pa'i dus su mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi ni lo'i sbyor bas ster bar mdzad ces pa'o //
translated: Then, when it returns from the tip of the vajra, the four fruits beginning with the natural outflow of supreme changelessness are bestowed by the yoga of the year.

original: da ni shes rab ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang / sems 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'grel pa las gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dir ma bkrol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni shes rab ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang / sems 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'grel pa las gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dir ma bkrol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, beginning with “The wisdom initiation,” etc., the characteristics of the four initiations are taught, and since the entry of the mind into clear light is clearly taught in the Stainless Light commentary, it is not explained here.

original: da ni dbugs rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni dbugs rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the purities of the breaths are taught.

original: gang zhig gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'dir dbus mar 'bab pa'i dbugs rnams gang yin de rnams mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin du gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa las 'dir dbus mar 'bab pa'i dbugs rnams gang yin de rnams mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin du gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that the breaths that flow in the middle are of the nature of the dakinis, as it is said, “The one who is the principal, etc.”

original: de bzhin du sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i dbugs rnams ni bkra shis la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa chu me rlung la sogs pa'i dbugs rnams ni bkra shis la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the breaths of earth, water, fire, wind, etc., are the dakinis of auspiciousness, etc.

original: bkra shis la sogs pa de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bkra shis la sogs pa de rnams kyang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are those auspicious ones, etc.?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum dang lhan cig tu brgyad po gang yin pa de bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lnga dang snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum dang lhan cig tu brgyad po gang yin pa de bkra shis la sogs pa'i gza' rnams te /
translated: In form, etc., etc., here the eight are the five objects such as form, and the three qualities such as goodness. They are the planets such as Ketu.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo ni sgra gcan no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo ni sgra gcan no //
translated: Rāhu is the chief of them.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu ba ni yul la sogs pa'i dbye bas de bzhin du shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu ba ni yul la sogs pa'i dbye bas de bzhin du shes par bya ba'o //
translated: Their movement is to be known as such by way of the divisions of objects, etc.

original: de lta bu'i gza' rnams gang yin pa de dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i tshul gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gza' rnams gang yin pa de dkyil 'khor 'khor lo'i tshul gyis gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The planets that are like that abide in the manner of a maṇḍala wheel.

original: dbugs de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbugs de yang ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that breath like?

original: dang po dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dang po dbugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In first breath, etc.,

original: 'dir mngal nas skyes pa'i byis pa'i dbugs nas dang po'i dbugs gang yin pa de nyid yul dang yon tan gyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir mngal nas skyes pa'i byis pa'i dbugs nas dang po'i dbugs gang yin pa de nyid yul dang yon tan gyi dbye bas rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: here the first breath of a child born from a womb becomes eightfold by way of the divisions of objects and qualities.

original: dbugs @214a * //
analyzed: dbugs @214a * //
translated: Breath is the life of the body.

original: de 'chi ba dang skyed par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de 'chi ba dang skyed par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis bskor ba'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of death and birth, it is surrounded by the dakinis.

original: don dam par mkha' 'gro ma de rnams gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par mkha' 'gro ma de rnams gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are those dakinis ultimately?

original: du ba la sogs zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams kyis kun nas bskor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags rnams kyis kun nas bskor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The “smoke, etc.” are the signs of smoke, etc., which surround it.

original: lam gsum du gyur pa'i dbugs de'i dbang gis ma shes pa'i sems can rnams kyis 'gro ba drug la 'khor bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam gsum du gyur pa'i dbugs de'i dbang gis ma shes pa'i sems can rnams kyis 'gro ba drug la 'khor bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: By the power of that breath, which is the three paths, sentient beings who do not know [the truth] wander in the six realms of transmigration.

original: 'o na gal te dbugs de'i dbang gis 'khor bar 'khor bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dbugs de'i dbang gis 'khor bar 'khor bar gyur pa de lta na ni /
translated: If, in that case, transmigrating beings wander in cyclic existence by the power of that breath,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gang gis ster zhe na /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub gang gis ster zhe na /
translated: then by whom is the spiritual power of the Great Seal bestowed?

original: de dbugs zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad kyi dbus su thig le dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bzhugs te /
analyzed: de dbugs zhes bya ba ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags brgyad kyi dbus su thig le dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bzhugs te /
translated: That breath is the Bhagavat, the Wheel of Time, who is in the form of a drop and a form in the middle of the eight signs of smoke, etc.

original: dang po'i dbugs yon tan dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i dbugs yon tan dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first is called “breath devoid of qualities.”

original: de bas gang gis 'khor bar 'khor bar byed pa'i dbugs de rnams 'gags nas stong pa nyid kyi dbus mar srog 'jug par byed pa de ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas gang gis 'khor bar 'khor bar byed pa'i dbugs de rnams 'gags nas stong pa nyid kyi dbus mar srog 'jug par byed pa de ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when those breaths that cause one to revolve in cyclic existence are blocked and the life force enters the middle of emptiness, one becomes the nature of Kālacakra.

original: gang gis dbugs ni bcad nas rgyal ba'i skur 'jug dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid do //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis dbugs ni bcad nas rgyal ba'i skur 'jug dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid do // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That very Kālacakra is the one who, having blocked the breath, enters the body of the victor.

original: dbugs de ji ltar bcad ce na /
analyzed: dbugs de ji ltar bcad ce na /
translated: How is that breath blocked?🔽It is said:

original: dbugs bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dbugs bcad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “The breath is blocked, and so on.”

original: 'dir g-yas dang g-yon pa dang dbus ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lam gsum 'gags par byas nas /
analyzed: 'dir g-yas dang g-yon pa dang dbus ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa lam gsum 'gags par byas nas /
translated: Here, having blocked the three paths that are of the nature of the right, left, and middle,

original: dbugs chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs chad par 'gyur te /
translated: the breath is blocked.

original: steng gi lam gsum las dbugs mi 'bab par gyur nas 'og tu dri chen la sogs pa'i lam gsum 'gag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: steng gi lam gsum las dbugs mi 'bab par gyur nas 'og tu dri chen la sogs pa'i lam gsum 'gag par gyur pa'o //
translated: When the breath does not flow through the three upper paths, the three lower paths of feces and so on are blocked.

original: de bzhin du dbang mdor bstan pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang mdor bstan pa las /
translated: Similarly, the Concise Explanation of the Initiations says:

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa 'gag na /
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rtsa 'gag na /
translated: When the channels of the moon and sun are blocked,

original: dri chen dri chu'i rtsa 'gag ste /
analyzed: dri chen dri chu'i rtsa 'gag ste /
translated: The channels of feces and urine are blocked.

original: steng du sgra gcan rtsa 'gags na //
analyzed: steng du sgra gcan rtsa 'gags na //
translated: Above, Rāhu blocks the channel.

original: 'og tu sa bon rtsa 'bab ma'o //
analyzed: 'og tu sa bon rtsa 'bab ma'o //
translated: Below, the seed is the channel of the downward flow.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'o na lam drug po de 'gags pas don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na lam drug po de 'gags pas don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of the cessation of those six paths?

original: thig le 'gags nas kun nas gtso bo mchog gi bde ba mtha' yas bskal bar 'phel /
analyzed: thig le 'gags nas kun nas gtso bo mchog gi bde ba mtha' yas bskal bar 'phel /
translated: The bindu is blocked, and the supreme bliss increases for endless eons.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'dir srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur na byang chub sems kyi thig le rnams 'gag par gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur na byang chub sems kyi thig le rnams 'gag par gyur te /
translated: Here, when the life-force vāyu is blocked, the bindus of bodhicitta are blocked.

original: thig le rnams 'gags par gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par gyur na skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zad par mdzad pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par @214b 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thig le rnams 'gags par gyur na mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par gyur na skye ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba zad par mdzad pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par @214b 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the bindus are blocked, one obtains the supreme, unchanging bliss, and one obtains the mahāmudrā siddhi that puts an end to birth, aging, and death.

original: rgyu de'i phyir tha ma sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i bde ba dor nas bla ma dam pa'i zhal nas sbyor ba'i yan lag drug bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir tha ma sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i bde ba dor nas bla ma dam pa'i zhal nas sbyor ba'i yan lag drug bsgom par bya ste /
translated: For that reason, having abandoned the wheel of pleasure that is of the nature of suffering in the end, one should meditate on the six-branched yoga that is received from the mouth of the holy guru.

original: gzhan yang dka' thub kyi spyod pa dor nas spyod pa sgeg pa'i gzugs dang mchog tu 'jig rten byed rnal 'byor ma rnams dgyes pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dka' thub kyi spyod pa dor nas spyod pa sgeg pa'i gzugs dang mchog tu 'jig rten byed rnal 'byor ma rnams dgyes pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, having abandoned the conduct of asceticism, the conduct of the yoginīs is the form of the dance, which is supremely pleasing to the world.

original: da ni gza' rnams nub pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni gza' rnams nub pa dang 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the setting of the planets and the destruction of the world are taught.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'og min gyi lha rnams yin te /🔽de'i dbugs rnams kyis mi'i 'jig rten du lo rnams de tsam gyis gza' rnams stong par 'jug ste /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'og min gyi lha rnams yin te / de'i dbugs rnams kyis mi'i 'jig rten du lo rnams de tsam gyis gza' rnams stong par 'jug ste /
translated: Here, the “chief” are the Akaniṣṭha gods.🔽By their breaths, the planets enter into the human world for that many years.

original: de rnams stong pa la 'jug pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams stong pa la 'jug pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of their entry into the empty [world], the world is destroyed.

original: lo de yang mi la sogs pa'i rang rang gi tshad kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lo de yang mi la sogs pa'i rang rang gi tshad kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: That year should be known by the measure of each individual, such as a human.

original: 'o na sben pa la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dus kyi grangs ji lta bas stong par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: 'o na sben pa la sogs pa'i gza' rnams dus kyi grangs ji lta bas stong par 'jug ce na /
translated: Now, how do the planets such as Mercury enter the zodiac signs in the number of the time?

original: stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis nub pa'i dus kyi nges ba bstan to //
analyzed: stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis nub pa'i dus kyi nges ba bstan to //
translated: Two verses beginning with “Empty” teach the determination of the time of setting.

original: 'o na gza' de rnams ci'i phyir nub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gza' de rnams ci'i phyir nub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, why do those planets set?

original: rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ni nang du lus po 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir phyi rol du 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa ni nang du lus po 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Here, in the external world-system, destruction is the destruction of the body internally.

original: gnyi ga la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa srog gi rlung 'bab pa'i dus su aa wa dh'u t'i las dbugs rnams 'bab pa ni 'chi ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu ni g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa srog gi rlung 'bab pa'i dus su aa wa dh'u t'i las dbugs rnams 'bab pa ni 'chi ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause of destruction in both is the flow of the life-force wind in the right, left, and central channels, etc. The flow of the breath in the avadhūtī is called the cause of death.

original: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: 'dir dbus mar 'bab pa'i srog rnams kyi dbang gis nyin bzhin du rtsa gnyis gnyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dbus mar 'bab pa'i srog rnams kyi dbang gis nyin bzhin du rtsa gnyis gnyis 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, by the power of the prāṇa winds that descend into the central channel, two channels are severed each day.

original: rim pa de lta bus lo brgya'i bar du rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis 'chad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa de lta bus lo brgya'i bar du rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis 'chad par gyur pa'o //
translated: In this way, for a hundred years, seventy-two thousand channels are severed.

original: rtsa thams cad chad par gyur na srog gi rlung rten dang bral ba'i phyir lus po 'di dor bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa thams cad chad par gyur na srog gi rlung rten dang bral ba'i phyir lus po 'di dor bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: When all the channels are severed, because the prāṇa wind is without support, this body is cast off.

original: rgyu de'i phyir phyi rol du mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis kun du spyod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas nang du rtsa'i kun du spyod pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir phyi rol du mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis kun du spyod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas nang du rtsa'i kun du spyod pa shes par bya'o //
translated: For this reason, just as the ḍākinīs behave externally, so the yogī should understand the behavior of the channels internally.

original: de bas na gtso bo nyid kyi 'khor lo drug gi rtsa rnams ni brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: de bas na gtso bo nyid kyi 'khor lo drug gi rtsa rnams ni brgya lnga bcu rtsa drug ste /
translated: Therefore, the principal channels of the six cakras are one hundred and fifty-six.

original: zla ba'i rkang pa nyid shu lnga dang bsres nas brgya brgyad cu rtsa gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i rkang pa nyid shu lnga dang bsres nas brgya brgyad cu rtsa gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Adding the twenty-five digits of the moon, they become one hundred and eighty-one.

original: de nyid kyi rdul dang sa @215a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rdul dang sa @215a * //
translated: That is the number of the particles and the elements.

original: bon gyi dbang gis nyis bldab tu byas nas rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis kyi rtsa sum brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: bon gyi dbang gis nyis bldab tu byas nas rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs bcu gnyis kyi rtsa sum brgya drug cu'o //
translated: By the power of the phonemes, the twelve joints of the legs, arms, and so on are doubled, and so there are three hundred and sixty channels.🔽Among them, the channels of the six cakras are divided into ten by the division of the sense objects and sense faculties, and so on.

original: de la 'khor lo drug gi rtsa rnams kyi tha ma ni yul dang yul cang yi dbye ba'am du ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcur gyur pa'i de rnams bzhi dang drug por gyur pa'i gza' rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor lo drug gi rtsa rnams kyi tha ma ni yul dang yul cang yi dbye ba'am du ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bcur gyur pa'i de rnams bzhi dang drug por gyur pa'i gza' rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: Those four and six planets should be known.

original: gza' re re'i thog ma dang tha ma rigs ldan ma'i tshul gyis bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gza' re re'i thog ma dang tha ma rigs ldan ma'i tshul gyis bza' bar bya ste /
translated: The first and last of each planet should be eaten in the manner of the Kulas.

original: nang du aa dh'u t'i ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: nang du aa dh'u t'i ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Internally, it is just like the avadhūti.

original: de nyid bstan par mdzad de /🔽gza' yi mtha' yang za byed srid gsum skyed par byed pa rdo rje sku yi mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par mdzad de / gza' yi mtha' yang za byed srid gsum skyed par byed pa rdo rje sku yi mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: He teaches just that:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The end of the planets is the eater, the producer of the three worlds, the ḍākinī of the vajrakāya.

original: de bas ni mi rtog par gyur pa dang / de nas yul dang yon tan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / phyi nas phung po la sogs pa dang / sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dang / de nas lo bcu drug gi mthar bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rigs pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pas btsal bar bya ste /
