analyzed: de bas ni mi rtog par gyur pa dang / de nas yul dang yon tan gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / phyi nas phung po la sogs pa dang / sad pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa dang / de nas lo bcu drug gi mthar bde ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rigs pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pa ni rnal 'byor pas btsal bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the object and the qualities, which is non-conceptual, and then the nature of the aggregates, etc., and the states of waking, etc., and then the nature of bliss at the end of the sixteen years, that reason is the mother of all the Buddhas, which the yogi should seek.

original: gang nas btsal zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas btsal zhe na /
translated: Where should he seek it?

original: rdo rje'i go 'phang la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i go 'phang la gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The abiding in the stage of the vajra🔽means that he should seek it in the stage of the vajra, i.e., in the body.

original: bzhi pa slar yang de bzhin de'i tshig las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa slar yang de bzhin de'i tshig las shes par bya'o //
translated: Again, as before, one should understand it from the words.

original: mdor bsdus par skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa gang gis 'grub par byed pa de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus par skye ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa gang gis 'grub par byed pa de nyid kyi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is certain that the yogi should accomplish the Great Seal, which is the very thing that accomplishes birth, death, etc.

original: 'dir sems 'grub par gyur na mngon par shes pa drug ji ltar skye bar bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dir sems 'grub par gyur na mngon par shes pa drug ji ltar skye bar bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Here, having accomplished the mind, it is taught how the six superknowledges arise.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir sems can rnams khu ba dang rdul gyi dbye bas thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas te /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir sems can rnams khu ba dang rdul gyi dbye bas thabs dang shes rab kyi dbye bas te /
translated: The principal, etc. Here, sentient beings are divided into semen and ovum, divided into method and wisdom.

original: de dag kyang sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas rnam pa drug tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas rnam pa drug tu gyur pa'o //
translated: They are also sixfold, divided into body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang steng 'og gi rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang steng 'og gi rtsa gsum gyi dbye bas shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood by the division of the three upper and lower channels.

original: de bzhin du dbang mdor bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang mdor bstan pa las kyang /
translated: Similarly, in the Abhisamayâlamkārāntuddeśa:

original: thabs kyi sku ni zla ba ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi sku ni zla ba ste /
translated: The method body is the moon.

original: shes rab gsung ni nyin byed do //
analyzed: shes rab gsung ni nyin byed do //
translated: Wisdom speech is the sun.

original: shes rab sku ni dri chen rtsa //
analyzed: shes rab sku ni dri chen rtsa //
translated: Wisdom body is the great feces channel.

original: dri chu 'bab pa gtso bo'i gsum //
analyzed: dri chu 'bab pa gtso bo'i gsum //
translated: The three principal ones are the flowing urine channel.

original: steng dang 'og gi rtsa gnyis ni //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi rtsa gnyis ni //
translated: The two upper and lower channels

original: sa bon 'bab dang mun can ma //
analyzed: sa bon 'bab dang mun can ma //
translated: are the seed-flowing and the dark.

original: thabs kyi thugs ni mun pa can //
analyzed: thabs kyi thugs ni mun pa can //
translated: The method mind is the dark.

original: sa bon 'bab ma shes rab kyi //
analyzed: sa bon 'bab ma shes rab kyi //
translated: The seed-flowing is the wisdom

original: sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: body, speech, and mind.

original: steng 'og rigs drug 'di yin te //
analyzed: steng 'og rigs drug 'di yin te //
translated: These are the six classes above and below.

original: thabs dang shes rab lus dngos kyis //🔽lus can kun la yang dag gnas //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab lus dngos kyis // lus can kun la yang dag gnas //
translated: With the body of method and wisdom,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it truly abides in all embodied beings.

original: rgyu de'i @215b phyir rtsa g-yon pa las 'gags par gyur na rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha'i mig skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i @215b phyir rtsa g-yon pa las 'gags par gyur na rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha'i mig skye ba'o //
translated: For that reason, when the left channel is blocked, the divine eye arises for yogins.

original: dri chu'i rtsa 'gags par gyur na lha'i rna ba'o //
analyzed: dri chu'i rtsa 'gags par gyur na lha'i rna ba'o //
translated: When the urine channel is blocked, the divine ear arises.

original: aa ba dh'u t'i 'gags par gyur na gzhan gyi sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i 'gags par gyur na gzhan gyi sems shes pa'o //
translated: When the avadhūti is blocked, the knowledge of others’ minds arises.

original: dri chen gyi rtsa 'gags par gyur na sngon gyi skye ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: dri chen gyi rtsa 'gags par gyur na sngon gyi skye ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: When the feces channel is blocked, the recollection of past lives arises.

original: rtsa g-yas pa 'gags par gyur na dus kun du rnam pa thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: rtsa g-yas pa 'gags par gyur na dus kun du rnam pa thams cad kyi rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: When the right channel is blocked, one has the power of magical emanation at all times.

original: dung can ma 'gags par gyur na gzhom du med pa dang zag pa med pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dung can ma 'gags par gyur na gzhom du med pa dang zag pa med pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the conch shell is blocked, one attains the supreme, unchanging bliss that is invincible and uncontaminated.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the divine eye and so on?

original: srid pa rnam gsum mig gis ma mthong yang ni lha mig stobs kyis mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa rnam gsum mig gis ma mthong yang ni lha mig stobs kyis mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: Although the three realms are not seen with the eye, they are seen by the power of the divine eye.

original: lha yi rna ba'i mthu yis srog chags rnams kyi snying dang khams brjod sgra thos 'gyur //
analyzed: lha yi rna ba'i mthu yis srog chags rnams kyi snying dang khams brjod sgra thos 'gyur //
translated: By the power of the divine ear, one hears the sounds of the elements and the heart of beings.

original: de ltar reg sogs thams cad sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor bas 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //
analyzed: de ltar reg sogs thams cad sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor bas 'gyur ro mi dbang kye //
translated: In this way, all contacts and so forth are transformed by the union of body, speech, and mind, O King.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor bas de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa med pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi sbyor bas de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that they are transformed by the union of the unobstructed body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni srog dang thur sel gyi rgyu ba bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni srog dang thur sel gyi rgyu ba bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the movement of the life-force and downward-voiding [winds] is taught:

original: rtsa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rtsa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: What are the channels?

original: 'dir thur sel gyi rlung gi lam gsum ni dri chen dang dri chu dang sa bon 'bab pa'i rtsa ste /
analyzed: 'dir thur sel gyi rlung gi lam gsum ni dri chen dang dri chu dang sa bon 'bab pa'i rtsa ste /
translated: Here, the three paths of the downward-voiding wind are the channels of feces, urine, and the descending seed.

original: de bzhin du steng gi rtsa gsum gang yin pa de srog gi rlung gi lam yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du steng gi rtsa gsum gang yin pa de srog gi rlung gi lam yin te /
translated: Similarly, the three upper channels are the paths of the life-force wind.

original: de rnams las lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur gyur pa'i srog rtsol bar gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams las lus la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgur gyur pa'i srog rtsol bar gyur te /
translated: From those, by the division of body, etc., there are nine types of life-force control.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcu pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the life-force control that has become the nature of pristine consciousness.

original: de rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become that?

original: rna ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir rna ba dang sna dag dang mig dag dang lce dang lce'u dang lce'u chung dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa dang / ye shes sla rgyas gdab par gyur pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rna ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir rna ba dang sna dag dang mig dag dang lce dang lce'u dang lce'u chung dang gtsug tor gyi bug pa dang / ye shes sla rgyas gdab par gyur pa bcu ste /
translated: Here, the “ears” are the ears and nose, the eyes, the tongue and uvula, the uvula and the cranial aperture, and the pristine consciousness door.

original: sgo de rnams la srog gi rlung gis rgyu bar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgo de rnams la srog gi rlung gis rgyu bar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The life-force vāyu moves in those doors.

original: lam de rnams gal te rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnal 'byor pas 'gags par nus pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: lam de rnams gal te rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis rnal 'byor pas 'gags par nus pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the yogi can block those paths with the power of yoga,

original: brjod du med pa'i don 'grub par bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i don 'grub par bstan par mdzad de /
translated: the meaning of inexpressibility is accomplished.

original: srog dang thur sel zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir steng 'og tu srog dang thur sel gyi rlung mi 'bab par gyur na lte ba nas gtum mo 'bar bar gyur te /
analyzed: srog dang thur sel zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir steng 'og tu srog dang thur sel gyi rlung mi 'bab par gyur na lte ba nas gtum mo 'bar bar gyur te /
translated: As such, when the upper and lower life-force and evacuative vāyus do not move, the caṇḍālī fire blazes from the navel.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis sra ba'i ngo bos gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhu bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis sra ba'i ngo bos gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems zhu bar byed de /
translated: The light rays from that melt the bodhicitta located by the essence of solidity.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhu bar gyur pa'i dus su ye shes dang rnam par shes pa ro mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhu bar gyur pa'i dus su ye shes dang rnam par shes pa ro mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: At the time of the melting of the bodhicitta, gnosis and consciousness become of equal taste.

original: gnyi ga ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur na rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i @216a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga ro mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur na rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i @216a * //
translated: When both become of equal taste, the animate and inanimate

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po ni sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gsum po ni sgrib pa med pa nyid kyis de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: three worlds become just like that, without obscurations.

original: de ltar de bzhin du ni rnam pa gsum yang 'gyur te gzhan ni cung zad med //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du ni rnam pa gsum yang 'gyur te gzhan ni cung zad med //
translated: Thus, just like that, there are three aspects, and nothing else.🔽This is

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: said.

original: lus la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All things, such as the body, become the nature of nonconceptual gnosis.

original: da ni nang gi thun mtshams bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni nang gi thun mtshams bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, the inner periods are taught.

original: zos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the line “having eaten,” and so on,

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi gnam stong gi dus su zla ba dang nyi ma ni sgra gcan gyis bkab par gyur na nyin mo yang mi snang mtshan mo yang mi snang ste /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi gnam stong gi dus su zla ba dang nyi ma ni sgra gcan gyis bkab par gyur na nyin mo yang mi snang mtshan mo yang mi snang ste /
translated: Here, when the moon and sun are covered by Rahu during the external new moon, neither day nor night appear.

original: thun mtshams de ni nges pa'i don gyi lus po la dngos grub kyi gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: thun mtshams de ni nges pa'i don gyi lus po la dngos grub kyi gnas skabs yin te /
translated: That period is the occasion of spiritual powers for the body of definitive meaning.

original: de yang nang du ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang nang du ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that known internally?

original: phyogs zad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs zad ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ The directions are exhausted”

original: 'dir phyi rol du gnam stong dus su zla ba'i cha rnams zad par gyur na cha gcig gi ngo bos nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zhugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol du gnam stong dus su zla ba'i cha rnams zad par gyur na cha gcig gi ngo bos nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zhugs par 'gyur te /
translated: means that when the parts of the moon are exhausted during the external new moon, the essence of the one part enters the maṇḍala of the sun.

original: nyi ma'i dus kyi dbang gis sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug par gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du srog dang thur sel 'gags par gyur na lus dang ngag dang sems 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dus kyi dbang gis sgra gcan gyi dkyil 'khor la 'jug par gyur pa ji lta ba de bzhin du srog dang thur sel 'gags par gyur na lus dang ngag dang sems 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the moon enters the maṇḍala of the sun by the power of the time of the sun, when the life-force and the downward-clearing vāyus cease, the body, voice, and mind cease.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “impermanence” is that.

original: lus la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog par gyur na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par gyur par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog par gyur na phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par gyur par shes par bya'o //
translated: When the body and so forth become non-conceptual, one should understand that one has attained the power of the Great Seal.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This very meaning is clarified:

original: nyi zla'i gzugs nyams lam gnyis rtag tu srog rlung 'gags gyur na //
analyzed: nyi zla'i gzugs nyams lam gnyis rtag tu srog rlung 'gags gyur na //
translated: When the forms of the sun and moon are destroyed, the two paths are always blocked by the life-force wind,

original: padma rdo rje rab sad zla ba zhu pa chen po'i gzugs la rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: padma rdo rje rab sad zla ba zhu pa chen po'i gzugs la rab tu zhugs //
translated: and the lotus and vajra are fully awakened, entering into the form of the great melted moon.

original: dngos dang dngos med gcig gyur gzhom med yang dag sad gyur na //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gcig gyur gzhom med yang dag sad gyur na //
translated: When existence and non-existence become one, the indestructible is fully awakened,

original: de dus gang la gnyis med rnal 'byor pa de mchog gi go 'phang 'gro //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dus gang la gnyis med rnal 'byor pa de mchog gi go 'phang 'gro // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: at that time the yogi/nī of non-duality goes to the supreme stage.

original: 'dir lam g-yas dang g-yon pa 'gags par gyur na srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir lam g-yas dang g-yon pa 'gags par gyur na srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur pa'o //
translated: Here, when the right and left paths are blocked, the life-force wind is blocked.

original: dkyil 'khor drug cu la srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur par shes nas las kyi phyag rgya snyoms par zhugs par mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor drug cu la srog gi rlung 'gags par gyur par shes nas las kyi phyag rgya snyoms par zhugs par mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i skad cig bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Understanding that the life-force wind is blocked in the sixty maṇḍalas, one should accomplish the supreme unchanging moment by entering into union with a karma consort.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa des chags pa'i dngos po dang chags pa dang bral ba'i dngos po med pa ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur na gang gis kyang rang bzhin du 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems bzhengs🔽par gyur te /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa des chags pa'i dngos po dang chags pa dang bral ba'i dngos po med pa ro mnyam pa nyid du gyur na gang gis kyang rang bzhin du 'gyur bar mi nus pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sems bzhengs par gyur te /
translated: When the one who has entered into union has become of equal taste with the object of passion and the object of freedom from passion, then the mind, which has become of the nature of nondual intuition, cannot be changed by anything into a natural state.

original: @216b gnyis su med pa'i sems bzhengs par gyur na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi go 'phang sku 'khrungs pa'i gnas rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @216b gnyis su med pa'i sems bzhengs par gyur na sangs rgyas thams cad kyi go 'phang sku 'khrungs pa'i gnas rnal 'byor pas thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the nondual mind has arisen, the yogin has attained the state of all the buddhas, the place of the birth of the body.

original: dngos grub thob pa'i dus su rtags ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos grub thob pa'i dus su rtags ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What are the signs when the adept has attained power?

original: bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: bstan par mdzad de /
translated: This is taught:

original: khro bo sangs rgyas lha mo dang bcas ro yi rdo rje ma dang sa snying sogs //
analyzed: khro bo sangs rgyas lha mo dang bcas ro yi rdo rje ma dang sa snying sogs //
translated: The wrathful ones, the buddhas, the goddesses, the vajra women, Kṣitigarbha, and so forth,

original: rab dga'i snying ste mkha' la mngon sum 'gyur zhing rnal 'byor pa la bsgrub pa'i dus //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab dga'i snying ste mkha' la mngon sum 'gyur zhing rnal 'byor pa la bsgrub pa'i dus //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are the heart of supreme joy, manifest in the sky, at the time of the adept’s practice.

original: dus ji lta bur de ltar dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji lta bur de ltar dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: At what time will one attain power in this way?

original: mkhyen nas dus khyad par du bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: mkhyen nas dus khyad par du bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Having understood, he teaches the special time:

original: zla ba'i nyin mo tho rangs mtshan mo phyed la 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'gyur //
analyzed: zla ba'i nyin mo tho rangs mtshan mo phyed la 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'gyur //
translated: “At dawn and midnight on the moon day, one attains the desired power.”

original: zhes bya ba la zla ba'i nyin mtshan zhes bya ba ni nya yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zla ba'i nyin mtshan zhes bya ba ni nya yin la /
translated: Here, the “moon day” is the full moon.

original: nya'i tho rangs kyi dus rnal 'byor pa de la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nya'i tho rangs kyi dus rnal 'byor pa de la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: At the time of dawn on the full moon, the yogin will attain the power of the great seal.

original: gzhan yang rtags ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /🔽rin chen me tog char mchog dus kyi dbang gis sa yi steng du 'bab par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtags ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na / rin chen me tog char mchog dus kyi dbang gis sa yi steng du 'bab par 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, what will the signs be?

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The supreme rain of jewel flowers falls on the earth by the power of time.”

original: 'o na nang gi rtags ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nang gi rtags ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, what will the inner signs be?

original: bstan par mdzad de /🔽dang po'i gzugs ni rdul phran nyams shing nam mkha' dang mnyam mtshan sogs kyis rdzogs 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan par mdzad de / dang po'i gzugs ni rdul phran nyams shing nam mkha' dang mnyam mtshan sogs kyis rdzogs 'gyur //
translated: He teaches:

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The first form is the atom, and the sky is perfected by the characteristics and so on.”

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par gyur nas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i sku thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba thob par gyur nas sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab las 'das par gyur pa dang / 'od gsal ba dang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i sku thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Here, the yogi, having attained the supreme unchanging bliss, attains a body that transcends the atoms of earth and so forth, and is luminous and complete with the thirty-two marks of a great being and so forth.

original: lus bo rnam pa thams cad du med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus bo rnam pa thams cad du med par gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the body is not completely non-existent.

original: gzhan yang rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad gang yin pa de rnams kyang sgrib pa med par sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du mthong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po thams cad gang yin pa de rnams kyang sgrib pa med par sgyu ma dang rmi lam bzhin du mthong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, all things, moving and unmoving, are seen without obscuration, like an illusion or a dream.

original: gzhan yang dag gi dngos grub ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dag gi dngos grub ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the accomplishment of the mind?

original: ngag gis kun nas mi 'chad 'gyur dang du ma'i ngag rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi snying la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis kun nas mi 'chad 'gyur dang du ma'i ngag rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi snying la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Speech is not interrupted, and with many voices it enters the hearts of others.

original: de bzhin du sems kyi dngos grub ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi dngos grub ni /
translated: Similarly, the accomplishment of the mind is as follows:

original: sems ni dam pa'i bde bas gang 'gyur g-yo med lhan cig skyes pas dus kun 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni dam pa'i bde bas gang 'gyur g-yo med lhan cig skyes pas dus kun 'khyud pa'o //
translated: The mind is filled with the bliss of the holy, embraced at all times by the unmoving innate.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par gyur na mdor bsdus par dngos po thams cad snga ma min pa bzhin dang sgrib pa med par gyur pa'o //🔽da ni 'jig rten gyi khams @217a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnal 'byor pas phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par gyur na mdor bsdus par dngos po thams cad snga ma min pa bzhin dang sgrib pa med par gyur pa'o // da ni 'jig rten gyi khams @217a * //
translated: Here, when the yogi has attained the power of the Great Seal, in brief, all things are as before, but without obscuration.

original: 'jig pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Now, the destruction of the world and so forth,

original: dri ma med pa'i 'grel pa las gsal por bstan pa'i phyir go sla'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'grel pa las gsal por bstan pa'i phyir go sla'o //
translated: are clearly taught in the Vimalaprabha, so they are easy to understand.

original: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi sngon du rgyur gyur pa bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi sngon du rgyur gyur pa bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, in order to teach the cause that precedes the supramundane power,

original: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, first, and so on.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor pas sngags kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor pas sngags kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order for the yogi to accomplish the power of mantra,

original: aom a'a:h'um dang ldan par yan lag drug gi sngags ni sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um dang ldan par yan lag drug gi sngags ni sngon du brjod pa'i rim pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: the mantra of the six limbs endowed with Oṃ ĀḤ HŪṃ is to be accomplished in the sequence previously stated.

original: de nas tshe bsgrub pa dang rnam pa brgyad du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas tshe bsgrub pa dang rnam pa brgyad du gyur pa'i 'jig rten gyi dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir gnod sbyin mo la sogs pa rnams bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, in order to accomplish the worldly powers that are of eight kinds, one should accomplish the Yakṣiṇī and so forth.

original: de nas phung po lnga pa sgrib pa med pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas phung po lnga pa sgrib pa med pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to accomplish the power of the five aggregates, the great seal without obscuration,

original: so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi dbus ma aa ba dh'u t'i bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should accomplish the avadhūtī, which is the middle of the withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: de nas srog la sogs pa'i rlung bcu po rtsol ba dang / 'dzin pa'i yan lag gnyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas srog la sogs pa'i rlung bcu po rtsol ba dang / 'dzin pa'i yan lag gnyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should accomplish the two branches of the ten prāṇa and so forth, the āyāma and the retention.

original: de nas rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi thig le bzhi mi 'pho bar bsgrub par byas nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi thig le bzhi mi 'pho bar bsgrub par byas nas mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde bas sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, having accomplished the four drops of the mindfulness and meditative concentration so that they do not move, one should accomplish the body of the Bhagavān Buddha, which is the nature of the four bodies, through the supreme immutable bliss.

original: da ni phal ba'i sems can dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bye brag bstan par mdzad de /🔽sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni phal ba'i sems can dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi bye brag bstan par mdzad de / sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now he teaches the distinction between ordinary beings and yoginīs.

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po gang rnams kyis sems can rnams shi bar gyur pa'i de nyid ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po gang rnams kyis sems can rnams shi bar gyur pa'i de nyid ni rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags dang bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the reality by which beings die through external things becomes nectar for the yogins by the power of mantra and concentration.

original: mi 'chi ba nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi ba nyid du byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that they make death itself not happen.

original: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis phal pa rnams kyi dngos grub gang mi thob pa de nyid rang bzhin med pa'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis phal pa rnams kyi dngos grub gang mi thob pa de nyid rang bzhin med pa'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the siddhi that ordinary beings do not attain by the suffering of the body, etc., is attained by the yogins by the power of the concentration of the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: de bzhin du grangs med pa'i bskal pa rnams kyis sems can rnams la thob par dka' bar gyur pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor bas sla bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs med pa'i bskal pa rnams kyis sems can rnams la thob par dka' bar gyur pa'i mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rdo rje dang padma'i sbyor bas sla bar gyur ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the supreme, unchanging gnosis, which is difficult to attain for sentient beings through countless eons, is easy for yogins through the union of vajra and lotus.

original: rgyu de'i phyir gang sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i de rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i @217b rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir gang sems can rnams kyi 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i de rnams rnal 'byor pa rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dang mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i @217b rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: For that reason, whatever is the cause of samsara for sentient beings, and whatever is of the nature of suffering for them, is the cause of nirvana and the nature of supreme, unchanging bliss for yogins.🔽The same meaning is stated in the Paramarthagāthā:🔽Whatever passion causes sentient beings to fall,

original: don de nyid don dam pa'i bsnyen pa las 'dod chags gang zhig gis ni sems can lhung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: don de nyid don dam pa'i bsnyen pa las 'dod chags gang zhig gis ni sems can lhung 'gyur ba //
translated: that very passion, when yogically utilized,🔽takes the yogin to the other side of existence.

original: srid pa'i pha rol de nyid kyis ni rnal 'byor dug / gang zhig gis ni sems can shi bar gyur pa yi //
analyzed: srid pa'i pha rol de nyid kyis ni rnal 'byor dug / gang zhig gis ni sems can shi bar gyur pa yi //
translated: Whatever poison kills sentient beings,

original: dug shes pa yis de nyid kyis ni nad 'phrog byed //
analyzed: dug shes pa yis de nyid kyis ni nad 'phrog byed //
translated: that very poison, when understood, removes disease.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is what

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon pos gsungs pa'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva Lokanātha says.🔽Therefore, may the Blessed One Vajrasattva appear to sentient beings,🔽having taken away their suffering and having become their special

original: de bas na sdug bsngal phrogs nas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos grub ni sems can rnams la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' snang bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal phrogs nas khyad par du gyur pa'i dngos grub ni sems can rnams la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' snang bar gyur cig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis gsungs so //
translated: accomplishment. This is what the Blessed One Mañjuśrī says.

original: de bzhin du sgra gcan la sogs pas lus kyi dbye ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra gcan la sogs pas lus kyi dbye ba la sogs pa bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Similarly, Rāhu and so on, having taught the divisions of the body and so🔽forth,

original: brda'i tshig gis gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyi ming bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: brda'i tshig gis gcig la sogs pa'i grangs kyi ming bstan par mdzad de /
translated: taught the names of the numbers one and so on with symbolic words.

original: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir zla bas gcig brjod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir zla bas gcig brjod par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that the moon says one.🔽Similarly, two is a pair, a hand, an embrace, an eye, a direction, north, and

original: de bzhin du zung dang lag pa dang 'khrig pa dang mig dang phyogs dang byang la sogs pa'i bgrod pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zung dang lag pa dang 'khrig pa dang mig dang phyogs dang byang la sogs pa'i bgrod pa gnyis so //
translated: so on.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang dbyar ka la sogs pa'i dus dang / snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang / lho la sogs pa'i me ni gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten dang dbyar ka la sogs pa'i dus dang / snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang / lho la sogs pa'i me ni gsum mo //
translated: The three are the worlds of desire, form, and formlessness; the three times of past, present, and future; the three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas; and the three fires of the south, west, and north.

original: shar la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho dang rdzogs ldan la sogs pa'i dus dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rig byed ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i rgya mtsho dang rdzogs ldan la sogs pa'i dus dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i rig byed ni bzhi'o //
translated: The four are the four oceans of the east, etc.; the four ages of completeness, etc.; the four Vedas of the Atharva, etc.; and the four directions of the east, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i mda' dang / sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po ni lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i mda' dang / sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po ni lnga'o //
translated: The five are the five arrows of form, etc.; the five elements of earth, etc.; the five sense faculties of the eye, etc.; and the five directions of the zenith, etc.

original: dpyid ka la sogs pa'i dus dang / ro tsha ba la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: dpyid ka la sogs pa'i dus dang / ro tsha ba la sogs pa drug go //
translated: The six are the six seasons of spring, etc.; the six tastes of hot, etc.; the six sense objects of form, etc.; and the six directions of the east, etc.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' dang / 'od sngon po la sogs pa'i ri dang / rnam par gzigs pa la sogs pa'i grub pa ni bdun no //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' dang / 'od sngon po la sogs pa'i ri dang / rnam par gzigs pa la sogs pa'i grub pa ni bdun no //
translated: The seven are the seven planets of the sun, etc.; the seven mountains of blue light, etc.; the seven perfections of seeing, etc.; and the seven directions of the zenith, etc.

original: 'jog po la sogs pa'i klu dang / lcags la sogs pa'i nor dang / shar la sogs pa'i lha ni brgyad do //
analyzed: 'jog po la sogs pa'i klu dang / lcags la sogs pa'i nor dang / shar la sogs pa'i lha ni brgyad do //
translated: The eight are the eight nagas of Takshaka, etc.; the eight treasures of iron, etc.; the eight gods of Indra, etc.; and the eight directions of the zenith, etc.

original: aa ba dh'u t'i la sogs pa'i rtsa dang / mig la sogs pa'i bug pa dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' dang ; rdzas kyi gter la sogs pa ni dgu'o //
analyzed: aa ba dh'u t'i la sogs pa'i rtsa dang / mig la sogs pa'i bug pa dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i gza' dang ; rdzas kyi gter la sogs pa ni dgu'o //
translated: The nāḍīs such as the avadhūti, the openings such as the eyes, the planets such as the sun, and the treasure of substances, etc., are the nine.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs ni bcu'o //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs ni bcu'o //
translated: The directions such as east are the ten.

original: drag po la sogs pa ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: drag po la sogs pa ni bcu gcig go //
translated: Rudra, etc., are the eleven.

original: chu srin la sogs pa gnas pa'i nyi ma ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: chu srin la sogs pa gnas pa'i nyi ma ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: The sun in the houses such as Capricorn is the twelve.

original: 'dod pa'i lha la sogs pa ni bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha la sogs pa ni bcu gsum mo //
translated: The desire gods, etc., are the thirteen.

original: drang srong shes bu la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i srid pa ni bcu bzhi'o //🔽tshes @218a * //
analyzed: drang srong shes bu la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa'i srid pa ni bcu bzhi'o // tshes @218a * //
translated: The sages such as Śukra and the existences such as earth are the fourteen.

original: gcig la sogs pa ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa ni bco lnga'o //
translated: The lunar days such as the first are the fifteen.

original: rgyal po shing rta la sogs pa ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: rgyal po shing rta la sogs pa ni bcu drug go //
translated: The kings such as Ratha are the sixteen.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skyon ni bco brgyad do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skyon ni bco brgyad do //
translated: The faults of the eye consciousness, etc., are the eighteen.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa rgyal ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa rgyal ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The victors such as the Bhagavān Śākyamuni are the twenty-four.

original: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid ni nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: The suchness of earth, etc., is the twenty-five.

original: steng 'og gi so ni sum cu rtsa gnyis so /
analyzed: steng 'og gi so ni sum cu rtsa gnyis so /
translated: The upper and lower teeth are thirty-two.

original: // / da ni rgyud kyi yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: // / da ni rgyud kyi yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he declares the qualities of the tantra.

original: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: With all and so forth.

original: de bzhin du gang la mtha' ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi sgrib pa med pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pas gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la mtha' ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi sgrib pa med pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rnam pa lnga'i bstod pas gsungs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, with whoever has an end and so forth, he declares four verses with praise of the five aspects of the aggregate of non-obstruction and so forth.

original: da ni las dang po pa rnams kyi skyon dang yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni las dang po pa rnams kyi skyon dang yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he declares the faults and qualities of beginners.

original: seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With lion and so forth.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i dpal ldan bla ma gang gis sun dbyung bar byed pa de dam tshig nyams pa'i phyir dmyal bar 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i dpal ldan bla ma gang gis sun dbyung bar byed pa de dam tshig nyams pa'i phyir dmyal bar 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Here, whoever disparages the glorious guru who is the nature of the emanation body of Bhagavān Vajrasattva will enter hell because of the deterioration of his commitments.

original: de nas gal te thugs 'dzin par byed pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs 'dzin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gal te thugs 'dzin par byed pa de lta na ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs 'dzin par gyur pa'o //
translated: Then, if he holds the mind, then he holds the mind of all the buddhas.

original: de ltar shes nas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar shes nas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Knowing this, you should practice the perfect benefit for yourself.

original: dus kun du dngos po thams cad kyis bla ma la gus par bya'i brgal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus kun du dngos po thams cad kyis bla ma la gus par bya'i brgal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Having understood it in this way, one should always honor the guru with all things in order to accomplish the perfection of one's own aim.🔽One should not dispute with the guru.

original: de nas shes nas snga dro dang nyi ma phyed dang nyi ma rgas pa'i dus su mandala la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba gang gis bla ma'i zhabs la phyag mi byed pa de las sdig pa can gzhan med de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas shes nas snga dro dang nyi ma phyed dang nyi ma rgas pa'i dus su mandala la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba gang gis bla ma'i zhabs la phyag mi byed pa de las sdig pa can gzhan med de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, having understood, there is no other sinner than he who, having made a mandala offering in the morning, at noon, and in the evening, does not bow down at the guru's feet.

original: de bzhin du dus gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, in order to accumulate the stores of merit in the three times,

original: yi dam gyi lha la yid du 'ong ba'i me tog rnams kyis gang gis mandala mi byed pa de las gzhan ma rmongs pa med do //
analyzed: yi dam gyi lha la yid du 'ong ba'i me tog rnams kyis gang gis mandala mi byed pa de las gzhan ma rmongs pa med do //
translated: there is no other deluded person than he who does not make a mandala offering with pleasing flowers to the pledged deity.

original: sdig pa gang yin dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad bzang la dus gsum gang gis phyag mi 'tshal //
analyzed: sdig pa gang yin dpal ldan bla ma'i zhabs pad bzang la dus gsum gang gis phyag mi 'tshal //
translated: What sin is there? In the three times, who does not bow down at the excellent lotus feet of the glorious guru?

original: mi shes pa gang dus gsum du ni sna tshogs me tog rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gang gis mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa gang dus gsum du ni sna tshogs me tog rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gang gis mi byed pa'o //
translated: What is ignorance? It is the failure to make a mandala of various flowers in the three times.

original: mnar med myur bar gang 'gro bde mnyam ster ba'i bla ma sdug par byed pa gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnar med myur bar gang 'gro bde mnyam ster ba'i bla ma sdug par byed pa gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the swift descent into Avīci? It is the hatred of the guru who bestows the bliss of sameness.

original: bla ma la mi gus pas dmyal bar 'gro bar gyur pa de lta na ni de la bsnyen pas don ci 'grub ce na /
analyzed: bla ma la mi gus pas dmyal bar 'gro bar gyur pa de lta na ni de la bsnyen pas don ci 'grub ce na /
translated: If one goes to hell through disrespect for the guru, what is the point of serving him?

original: shes rab ye shes thob ldan bla ma gang yin bla ma mchog gi zhabs ni gang zhig ma nyams me spong ba //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes thob ldan bla ma gang yin bla ma mchog gi zhabs ni gang zhig ma nyams me spong ba //
translated: The guru who possesses the wisdom of the wisdom initiation is the supreme guru.🔽The one who does not abandon the guru’s feet,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi gang gis nyin mtshan du bla mas gsungs pa bzhin du byed pa'i mi @218b de la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi gang gis nyin mtshan du bla mas gsungs pa bzhin du byed pa'i mi @218b de la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub sgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the one who does what the guru says day and night, that person will accomplish the mahāmudrā attainment.

original: de bzhin du 'khor bar shi bar gyur pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'khor bar shi bar gyur pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is death in saṃsāra?

original: gang gis dus thams cad du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya thar par byed pa shi ba yin gyi lus po bor ba tsam du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dus thams cad du nyi khri chig stong drug brgya thar par byed pa shi ba yin gyi lus po bor ba tsam du ni ma yin no //
translated: He who liberates the twenty-one thousand six hundred [winds] at all times is a killer, not just one who has cast off the body.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa gang zhig lam gsum la gnas pa'i srog gi rlung 'gag par byed pa'i gang zag de ni dba' bo yin gyi srog chags gsod par byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor pa gang zhig lam gsum la gnas pa'i srog gi rlung 'gag par byed pa'i gang zag de ni dba' bo yin gyi srog chags gsod par byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the yogi who blocks the life-force wind abiding in the three paths is a hero, not one who kills living beings or engages in worldly activities.

original: sbyin bdag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the benefactor?

original: gang gis bla ma la rnam pa bcu sbyin pa'i dngos po dbul ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis bla ma la rnam pa bcu sbyin pa'i dngos po dbul ba'o //
translated: He who offers the ten types of gifts to the guru.

original: ngan pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ngan pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the wicked one?

original: sems can slu bar byed pa dang / sdig pa bsags par byed pa dang / snying la bsam pa gzhan dang kha las tshig gzhan rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can slu bar byed pa dang / sdig pa bsags par byed pa dang / snying la bsam pa gzhan dang kha las tshig gzhan rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: He who deceives sentient beings, accumulates negativity, and speaks with a different intention in his heart than the words he utters.

original: ngan pa gang yin slu byed rang snying rnyog mas sems ni drangs shing g-yo sgyu can //
analyzed: ngan pa gang yin slu byed rang snying rnyog mas sems ni drangs shing g-yo sgyu can //
translated: The wicked one is a deceiver, his mind drawn by the mud of his heart, deceitful.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas skyon dang yon tan gyi bye brag shes nas ;
analyzed: de bas skyon dang yon tan gyi bye brag shes nas ;
translated: Therefore, having understood the distinctions of faults and qualities,

original: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to benefit oneself by the holy beings,

original: skyon thams cad dor nas khyad par du yon tan rnams la zhen par bya ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad dor nas khyad par du yon tan rnams la zhen par bya ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: having abandoned all faults, one should be certain to adhere to the qualities.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang bsdus pa'i rgyud tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang bsdus pa'i rgyud tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Now, having taught the nature of the root tantra and the summarized tantra as non-different,

original: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the glorious and so forth.

original: 'dir sngon du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje'i zhu ba gsan nas rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa gang bka' stsal pa de nyid bdag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam🔽dpal nyid de ;
analyzed: 'dir sngon du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje'i zhu ba gsan nas rgyud kyi rgyal po mchog gi dang po'i sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu gnyis pa gang bka' stsal pa de nyid bdag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid de ;
translated: Here, first the Bhagavān Śākyamuni, having heard the request of the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, taught the king of tantras, the Supreme Original Buddha of twelve thousand [verses]. That very one is the Bhagavān Mañjuśrī himself.

original: bdag gis me tog phreng 'dzin gyis tshigs su bcad pas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis me tog phreng 'dzin gyis tshigs su bcad pas bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I is the one who, holding a garland of flowers, taught the Bhagavān Kālacakra with verses.

original: de bas 'jig rten mgon po khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lung bstan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de bas 'jig rten mgon po khyod kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas lung bstan pa bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, O Protector of the World, you should teach in accordance with the prophecy of the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: bstan par gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan par gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what was said.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis /
translated: The Blessed Mañjuśrī,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po la bka' stsal nas smon lam 'debs par mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po la bka' stsal nas smon lam 'debs par mdzad de /
translated: having spoken to the Bodhisattva Lokanātha, made this aspiration:

original: shes rab ye shes thob 'gyur nyi ma dang bcas thub rigs 'di yis gyur pa ji lta bar //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes thob 'gyur nyi ma dang bcas thub rigs 'di yis gyur pa ji lta bar //
translated: Just as this family of sages, together with the sun, has attained the wisdom of insight,

original: de bzhin srid gsum la gnas sems can rnams ni dus 'khor @219a * //
analyzed: de bzhin srid gsum la gnas sems can rnams ni dus 'khor @219a * //
translated: in the same way, may all beings dwelling in the three worlds

original: drin gyis gyur par shog / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: drin gyis gyur par shog / ces bya ba'o //
translated: become so through the kindness of the Kālacakra.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid dang / 'khor gyi yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid dang / 'khor gyi yon tan brjod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, he praises the qualities of the Blessed Mañjuśrī himself and the retinue.

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba la 'dir bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis bram ze drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi'i gtso bor gyur pa'i nyi ma'i shing rta la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba la 'dir bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyis bram ze drang srong bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi'i gtso bor gyur pa'i nyi ma'i shing rta la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Sun - here, the Blessed Mañjuśrī said this to Sūryartha, the leader of 45 million brāhmaṇa sages:

original: khyod skye ba snga ma bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis tshangs pa'i rigs la gang zag khyad par du gyur par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: khyod skye ba snga ma bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis tshangs pa'i rigs la gang zag khyad par du gyur par skyes pa'o //
translated: You were born in the Brahma caste by the power of your yoga of the Bhagavat Kalachakra in a previous life, and you are a special person.

original: bdag kyang 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bdag kyang 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa yin gyi /
translated: I am also an emanation of Manjushri.

original: sems can phal pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: sems can phal pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: I am not an ordinary sentient being.

original: / de bzhin du bdag gis btsun mo ni sgrol ma'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du bdag gis btsun mo ni sgrol ma'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, my queen is an emanation of Tara.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi thugs rje'i ngo bor gyur pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po ni padma dkar po bdag gi sras zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi thugs rje'i ngo bor gyur pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po ni padma dkar po bdag gi sras zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Furthermore, the Bodhisattva Lokanatha, who is the essence of the compassion of all the Bhagavat Buddhas and the abode of all supramundane qualities, is my son, the white lotus.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la sogs pas rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'i tshig nyi ma'i shing rtas thos nas 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la sogs pas rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'i tshig nyi ma'i shing rtas thos nas 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal bar mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī and so on, having heard the words that are by nature the Sun's Chariot, together with the retinue, pay homage to the Bhagavat Mañjuśrī's feet.

original: 'gal ba'i rgyan gyis stod par byed do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rgyan gyis stod par byed do //
translated: They are adorned with contradictory ornaments.

original: khyed bgres gzhon yin rgyal bar kun gyi sras kyang khyod ni dang po'i thog ma'i sangs rgyas te //
analyzed: khyed bgres gzhon yin rgyal bar kun gyi sras kyang khyod ni dang po'i thog ma'i sangs rgyas te //
translated: You are elder and younger, the son of all the Victorious Ones, and you are the primordial first Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is said.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis bgres par gyur na yang nam mkha' bzhin du sku la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir khyod ni gzhon nu ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyis bgres par gyur na yang nam mkha' bzhin du sku la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir khyod ni gzhon nu ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though you are elder in all mundane and supramundane qualities, you are called youthful because your body is unchanging like space.

original: de bzhin du sngon du sangs rgyas pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi skur gyur pa na yang sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon du sangs rgyas pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi skur gyur pa na yang sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, even though you were previously enlightened and became the gnosis body of all tathāgatas, for the sake of training sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He abides in the manner of a Bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgyal sbyor bar mdzad na yang mi 'pho ba nyid kyis tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las kyi phyag rgyal sbyor bar mdzad na yang mi 'pho ba nyid kyis tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: Similarly, when he engages in union with a karmamudra, he is celibate because he is not emitted.

original: gzhan yang gdul dka' bar gyur pa'i sems can gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul dka' bar gyur pa'i sems can gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to tame those beings who are difficult to tame,

original: 'jigs par gyur pa'i zhal mang ba dang / phyag rnams mtshon cha du ma dang ldan par gyur par gshin rje gshed la sogs pa sprul pa'i @219b sku 'khrungs par mdzad na yang sems can thams cad ni yid du 'ong ba'i bu gcig pa bzhin du thugs rje chen po'i spyan gyis gzigs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par gyur pa'i zhal mang ba dang / phyag rnams mtshon cha du ma dang ldan par gyur par gshin rje gshed la sogs pa sprul pa'i @219b sku 'khrungs par mdzad na yang sems can thams cad ni yid du 'ong ba'i bu gcig pa bzhin du thugs rje chen po'i spyan gyis gzigs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: he manifests the emanation body of Yamantaka and so forth, with many terrifying faces and many hands holding various weapons, but he looks upon all sentient beings with the eye of great compassion as if they were his only child.

original: gzhan yang gdul dka' bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi rtsar khyod kyi sku 'jigs par bstan par mdzad na yang don dam bar rnyog pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gdul dka' bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi rtsar khyod kyi sku 'jigs par bstan par mdzad na yang don dam bar rnyog pa med pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: Moreover, when you display your terrifying body to those beings who are difficult to tame, you are in reality of the nature of the unperturbed.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad khyod kyis 'phrog par mdzad na yang bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chod byed pa'i bdud rnams nyams par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad la 'chi ba la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad khyod kyis 'phrog par mdzad na yang bla na med pa'i byang chub la bar chod byed pa'i bdud rnams nyams par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, you have taken away from all sentient beings all fears of death and so forth, and you have destroyed the demons who create obstacles to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang 'khor ba'i zhags pa rnams las grol bar gyur na yang sems can rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor bar sprul pa'i sku 'khrungs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'khor ba'i zhags pa rnams las grol bar gyur na yang sems can rnams smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor bar sprul pa'i sku 'khrungs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, although you are liberated from the bonds of cyclic existence, you take birth in cyclic existence in an emanation body in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi bla mar gyur pa bdag ni khyod kyis gdul bar mdzad pa'o //🔽gzhan yang sems can thams cad la phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshangs pa'i drang srong rnams kyi bla mar gyur pa bdag ni khyod kyis gdul bar mdzad pa'o // gzhan yang sems can thams cad la phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, I am disciplined by you, the guru of the sages of the Brahmā world.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo khyod kyis mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo khyod kyis mdzad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, you have composed the king of tantras, the Bhagavān Kālacakra, in order to bestow the attainment of the great seal on all sentient beings.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa 'joms par mdzad nas khyod ni nyi ma bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa 'joms par mdzad nas khyod ni nyi ma bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: Having destroyed the darkness of ignorance, you are like the sun.

original: rgyal rigs ni sku dgu bcu rtsa drug las skyes pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams la phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs ni sku dgu bcu rtsa drug las skyes pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sprul pa rnams la phyag 'tshal bar 'os pa'o //
translated: The royal class is worthy of homage to the emanations of gods and so forth born from the ninety-six bodies.

original: de bas na mi bzang 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas bdag ni khyed kyi zhabs kyi padmar skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: de bas na mi bzang 'khor ba'i 'jigs pas bdag ni khyed kyi zhabs kyi padmar skyabs su mchi //
translated: Therefore, O good one, I go for refuge to your lotus feet out of fear of the terrors of samsara.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la nyi ma'i shing rtas bstod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal la nyi ma'i shing rtas bstod pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus praised the Bhagavat Manjushri together with the retinue,

original: sems can rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas bram ze bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi dang lhan cig nyi ma'i shing rtas dbying  zla tha chungs kyi nyal /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab nas bram ze bye ba phrag phyed dang bzhi dang lhan cig nyi ma'i shing rtas dbying  zla tha chungs kyi nyal /
translated: the sun chariot, having made a prayer for the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment by sentient beings, together with four and a half million brahmins, on the last day of the month of Ashadha,

original: phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub mngon sum du mdzad ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: phyag rgya chen mo'i dngos grub mngon sum du mdzad ces bya ba'o ;
translated: manifested the siddhi of Mahamudra.

original: / bcom ldan 'das dpal gyis kyang rgyud kyi don bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das dpal gyis kyang rgyud kyi don bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: The Bhagavat Shri also taught the meaning of the tantra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po la rgyud kyi 'grel pa mdzad pa'i phyir dang / rgyud glegs bam du bri ba bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten mgon po la rgyud kyi 'grel pa mdzad pa'i phyir dang / rgyud glegs bam du bri ba bka' stsal nas /
translated: having written the tantra in a book,

original: sems can rnams la bkra shis par gnang ba @220a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bkra shis par gnang ba @220a * //
translated: bestowed it as a blessing for sentient beings,

original: dang / bsod nams bsngo bar mdzad de /
analyzed: dang / bsod nams bsngo bar mdzad de /
translated: and having dedicated the merit,

original: steng na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig bdud sder gnas rnams mchog tu 'jig par mdzad //🔽sa steng 'jig rten phyogs mtshams la gnas lha min khro bo'i rgyal po sras dang bcas //
analyzed: steng na byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig bdud sder gnas rnams mchog tu 'jig par mdzad // sa steng 'jig rten phyogs mtshams la gnas lha min khro bo'i rgyal po sras dang bcas //
translated: said, May the Bodhisattvas above, who are the supreme destroyers of the hosts of Mara,🔽 the angry kings of the demigods below, who dwell in the directions and intermediate directions of the world, together with their sons,🔽and those below, who bind the inauspicious planets of the lords of the nagas,🔽protect the entire world day and night, without exception.

original: 'og na gang zhig klu dbang mi dge'i gza' yi gnas ni kun du 'ching bar byed pa dang // de rnams kun gyi nyin mtshan dus su mi shes 'jig rten ma lus skyong bar shog / ma lus bsdus pa dus 'khor rgyud ni rdo rje sems dpa' lhag pa'i lha //
analyzed: 'og na gang zhig klu dbang mi dge'i gza' yi gnas ni kun du 'ching bar byed pa dang // de rnams kun gyi nyin mtshan dus su mi shes 'jig rten ma lus skyong bar shog / ma lus bsdus pa dus 'khor rgyud ni rdo rje sems dpa' lhag pa'i lha //
translated: The Kalachakra Tantra, which includes everything, is the supreme deity Vajrasattva.

original: thabs dang shes rab gcig sbyor rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje de nyid rnam pa bcu drug pa //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gcig sbyor rgyal ba'i bdag po'i rdo rje de nyid rnam pa bcu drug pa //
translated: The vajra of the Lord of Victors, the union of method and wisdom, is of sixteen aspects.

original: sems can thar pa'i rgyu ru rgyal ba'i bdag pos bstan cing bdag gis kyang bstan pas //
analyzed: sems can thar pa'i rgyu ru rgyal ba'i bdag pos bstan cing bdag gis kyang bstan pas //
translated: The Lord of Victors has taught it as the cause of liberation for sentient beings, and I have also taught it.

original: bsod nams de yis sems can mi 'gyur mchog gi bde ba ster bar gyur cig de la 'dud //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams de yis sems can mi 'gyur mchog gi bde ba ster bar gyur cig de la 'dud // ces bya ba ni /
translated: By that merit, may sentient beings attain the supreme bliss of the unchanging.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rjod par byed par gyur pa dang / sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rdo rje bzhi'i dbye bas de kho na nyid rnam pa bcu drug gi rjod par byed pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo gang bstan pa de nyid bdag sdud pa po nyid kyis bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rjod par byed par gyur pa dang / sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i rdo rje bzhi'i dbye bas de kho na nyid rnam pa bcu drug gi rjod par byed pa'i rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo gang bstan pa de nyid bdag sdud pa po nyid kyis bstan nas /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Śākyamuni, having become the nature of method and wisdom, and having become the expounder of the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, taught the King of Tantras of the glorious Kālacakra, which is the expounder of reality in sixteen aspects through the division of the four vajras such as the vajra body. Having taught that, the compiler himself says:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs gang bsags par gyur pa des sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang thob par gyur cig / mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba de nyid la bdag gis phyag 'tshal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs gang bsags par gyur pa des sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba'i go 'phang thob par gyur cig / mchog tu mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba de nyid la bdag gis phyag 'tshal zhes bya'o //
translated: By whatever accumulation of merit I have made, may all sentient beings attain the state of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur bde ba rjod byed pa'i //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid mchog tu mi 'gyur bde ba rjod byed pa'i //
translated: I pay homage to that supreme unchanging bliss, which is expressed by the union of method and wisdom.

original: rgyud rgyal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad padma can ni byas nas su //
analyzed: rgyud rgyal dus kyi 'khor lo'i 'grel bshad padma can ni byas nas su //
translated: Having composed the Padmavati commentary on the Kalachakra Tantra, the king of tantras,

original: bdag gis bsod nams tshogs ni gang thob de yis sems can ma lus pa //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod nams tshogs ni gang thob de yis sems can ma lus pa //
translated: by whatever accumulation of merit I have obtained, may all sentient beings🔽always attain the state of supreme unchanging bliss.

original: mchog tu 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i go 'phang rtag tu thob gyur cig / rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i ye shes kyi le'u las mdor bsdus pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: mchog tu 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i go 'phang rtag tu thob gyur cig / rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal dus kyi 'khor lo'i ye shes kyi le'u las mdor bsdus pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The summary explanation of the Wisdom Chapter of the glorious Kalachakra Tantra, the king of tantras,

original: 'grel bshad padma can zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'grel bshad padma can zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: the commentary called Padmavati, is complete.

original: // / kha che'i pandi ta so ma n'a thas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / kha che'i pandi ta so ma n'a thas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: Translated, revised, and finalized by the Kashmiri paṇḍita Somanātha.
